original: bar gyi dbugs ni dbugs rngub pa ste /
analyzed: bar gyi dbugs ni dbugs rngub pa ste /
translated: The intermediate breath is the in-breath.

original: lte ba'i bar du zhugs nas chad pa las dus cung zhig gi bar du dbugs mi 'byung zhing ngal gso ba ring po mi thogs par dbugs shin tu yang phra ba zhig skye bar gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i bar du zhugs nas chad pa las dus cung zhig gi bar du dbugs mi 'byung zhing ngal gso ba ring po mi thogs par dbugs shin tu yang phra ba zhig skye bar gyur ba'o //
translated: After it has entered as far as the navel, it ceases, and for a short time there is no breath. After a short rest, a very subtle breath arises.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang bar gyi dbugs 'byung ba la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang bar gyi dbugs 'byung ba la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya ste /
translated: The same should be said of the out-breath and the intermediate out-breath.

original: de la khyad par ni 'di yod de /
analyzed: de la khyad par ni 'di yod de /
translated: The difference is this:

original: dbugs 'byung ba ni rlung phyir 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba ni rlung phyir 'byung ba ste /
translated: The out-breath is the wind that goes out.

original: lte ba'i phyogs nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: lte ba'i phyogs nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning from the navel region,

original: kha sna'i bar du 'byung ba dang / de las kyang phyir mtho gang @163b dang ; khru gang la sogs par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kha sna'i bar du 'byung ba dang / de las kyang phyir mtho gang @163b dang ; khru gang la sogs par 'byung ba'o //
translated: it goes out as far as the mouth and nose, and from there it goes out a cubit or a fathom or more.

original: bar gyi dbugs ni dbugs phyir 'byung ba de chad nas /
analyzed: bar gyi dbugs ni dbugs phyir 'byung ba de chad nas /
translated: The intermediate out-breath is the out-breath that has ceased.

original: dus ji srid cig tu dbugs drag tu 'byung ba med cing /
analyzed: dus ji srid cig tu dbugs drag tu 'byung ba med cing /
translated: For a short time there is no strong out-breath,

original: ngal gso ba'i dus du skad cig gcig rlung phre'u zhig 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ngal gso ba'i dus du skad cig gcig rlung phre'u zhig 'byung ba'o //
translated: and for a moment there is a rest, a single breath.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i gleng gzhi yang /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i gleng gzhi yang /
translated: The context of the arising and ceasing of the breath is as follows.🔽

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The origin of inhalation and exhalation is also twofold:

original: de 'phen par byed pa'i las dang / lte ba'i phyogs na su la la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de 'phen par byed pa'i las dang / lte ba'i phyogs na su la la gnas pa'o //
translated: the action that projects it and the life faculty that sustains it.

original: de la gong du yang lus kyi sul la yod pa'o //
analyzed: de la gong du yang lus kyi sul la yod pa'o //
translated: The life faculty is the support of inhalation and exhalation, because it is the support of the body.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i rten yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i rten yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The support of inhalation and exhalation is twofold:

original: lus dang sems so //
analyzed: lus dang sems so //
translated: the body and the mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa ni lus la brten pa dang / sems la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa ni lus la brten pa dang / sems la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because inhalation and exhalation occur in dependence on the body and the mind.

original: gal te lus 'ba' zhig la brten cing 'byung na ni /
analyzed: gal te lus 'ba' zhig la brten cing 'byung na ni /
translated: If inhalation and exhalation occurred in dependence on the body alone,

original: 'du shes med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa dag la yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skyes pa dag la yang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: then the error would arise that inhalation and exhalation would occur in those who have entered the meditative attainment of non-perception, in those who have entered the meditative attainment of cessation, and in those born among the gods devoid of ideation.

original: de dag la mi 'byung bas na /
analyzed: de dag la mi 'byung bas na /
translated: But since that is not the case,

original: lus 'ba' zhig la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lus 'ba' zhig la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: inhalation and exhalation do not occur in dependence on the body alone.

original: gal te sems 'ba' zhig la brten cing 'byung ba ni /🔽gzugs med pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa dang / gzugs med par skyes pa'i sems can rnams la yang /
analyzed: gal te sems 'ba' zhig la brten cing 'byung ba ni / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa dang / gzugs med par skyes pa'i sems can rnams la yang /
translated: If it arises in dependence on mind alone,

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'byung ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'byung ba'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: then it would follow that the inhalation and exhalation of breath would occur for those beings who have entered the formless meditative attainments and for those beings born in the formless realm.

original: de dag la dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa med pas sems 'ba' zhig la brten pa ma yin no //🔽skabs kha cig tu lus la brten pa dang / sems la brten nas 'jug par yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de dag la dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa med pas sems 'ba' zhig la brten pa ma yin no // skabs kha cig tu lus la brten pa dang / sems la brten nas 'jug par yang mi rung ste /
translated: But that is unacceptable, because those beings do not have inhalation and exhalation of breath.

original: lus la brten pa dang / sems la brten nas 'jug par nges na ni /
analyzed: lus la brten pa dang / sems la brten nas 'jug par nges na ni /
translated: It is also unacceptable to say that inhalation and exhalation occur in dependence on the body and mind, because if they definitely occurred in dependence on the body and mind,

original: bsam gtan bzhi la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams dang / nur nur po'i dus na mer mer po'i dus kyi tshe'i sems can rnams la yang dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi la snyoms par zhugs pa'i sems can rnams dang / nur nur po'i dus na mer mer po'i dus kyi tshe'i sems can rnams la yang dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: then it would follow that the inhalation and exhalation of breath would occur for those beings who have entered the meditative attainments of the four dhyanas and for those beings in the embryonic stages of kalala and arbuda,

original: de dag la yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: de dag la yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: because they have bodies and minds.

original: de bas na dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa ni dus de dag las ma gtogs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bas na dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa ni dus de dag las ma gtogs pa'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, the exhalation and inhalation of the breath do not occur apart from those times.

original: lus la brten pa dang / sems la brten nas 'jug go zhes ci rigs par gzhag go //
analyzed: lus la brten pa dang / sems la brten nas 'jug go zhes ci rigs par gzhag go //
translated: It is appropriate to posit that the breath occurs in dependence on the body and the mind.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i 'gro ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i 'gro ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The movement of the breath is also twofold.

original: @164a * // gnyis po gang zhe na /
analyzed: @164a * // gnyis po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: 'byung ba ni gyen du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni gyen du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Exhalation is the upward movement.

original: dbugs rngub pa ni thur du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa ni thur du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Inhalation is the downward movement.

original: 'byung ba dang / rngub pa'i sa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / rngub pa'i sa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The location of the breath is also twofold:

original: sul dang bu ga rags pa dang / sul dang bu ga phra ba'o //
analyzed: sul dang bu ga rags pa dang / sul dang bu ga phra ba'o //
translated: the coarse pores and cavities, and the subtle pores and cavities.

original: de la sul dang bu ga rags pa ni lte ba'i phyogs nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: de la sul dang bu ga rags pa ni lte ba'i phyogs nas brtsams nas /
translated: The coarse pores and cavities begin from the region of the navel.

original: gyen du kha dang sna la sogs pa'i sgor 'byung ba dang / kha sna'i sgo nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: gyen du kha dang sna la sogs pa'i sgor 'byung ba dang / kha sna'i sgo nas brtsams nas /
translated: They emerge upward through the openings of the mouth, nose, and so on, and from the openings of the mouth and nose,

original: thur du lte ba'i phyogs kyi bar du sul gyi phyogs su rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: thur du lte ba'i phyogs kyi bar du sul gyi phyogs su rgyu ba'o //
translated: they move downward through the pores to the region of the navel.

original: sul dang bu ga phra ba ni lus su gtogs pa'i ba spu'i bu ga thams cad do //
analyzed: sul dang bu ga phra ba ni lus su gtogs pa'i ba spu'i bu ga thams cad do //
translated: The pores and cavities are all the pores of the body’s hair.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa'i ming gi rnam grangs kyang bzhi ste /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa'i ming gi rnam grangs kyang bzhi ste /
translated: There are four synonyms for inhalation and exhalation:

original: rlung dang / lus kyi 'du byed dang / dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang / dbugs phyir rgyu ba dang nang du rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: rlung dang / lus kyi 'du byed dang / dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang / dbugs phyir rgyu ba dang nang du rgyu ba'o //
translated: wind, bodily volitional formations, inhalation and exhalation, and the in-breath and out-breath.

original: de la rlung zhes bya ba'i ming gi rnam grangs kyi mu stegs dang / 'jig rten pa la sogs pa kun dang thun mong ngo //
analyzed: de la rlung zhes bya ba'i ming gi rnam grangs kyi mu stegs dang / 'jig rten pa la sogs pa kun dang thun mong ngo //
translated: Among them, the term “wind” is a synonym that is shared with non-Buddhists, worldly people, and so on.

original: lhag ma gsum ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma gsum ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: The remaining three are not shared.

original: bstan pa 'di 'ba' zhig la ming gi rnam grangs de dag grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di 'ba' zhig la ming gi rnam grangs de dag grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Only in this teaching are these synonyms for inhalation and exhalation well known.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la zhugs pa'i dri ma yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la zhugs pa'i dri ma yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are also two types of faults in engaging in inhalation and exhalation:

original: ha cang lhod par rab tu sbyor ba dang / ha cang bsgrims te rab tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang lhod par rab tu sbyor ba dang / ha cang bsgrims te rab tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: excessive looseness and excessive tightness.

original: de la ha cang lhod par rab tu sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: de la ha cang lhod par rab tu sbyor ba ni /
translated: Among them, excessive looseness is

original: le lo skyes pa gnyid dang / rmugs pas sems non par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: le lo skyes pa gnyid dang / rmugs pas sems non par 'byung ba'am /
translated: Laziness arises from sleepiness and languor, which overwhelm the mind.

original: sems phyis g-yengs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems phyis g-yengs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Or else, the mind is distracted later.

original: ha cang bsgrims te rab tu sbyor bas kyang lus mi mnyam pa dang / sems mi mnyam pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang bsgrims te rab tu sbyor bas kyang lus mi mnyam pa dang / sems mi mnyam pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one applies oneself with excessive effort, the body and the mind become unbalanced.

original: de la ji ltar lus mi mnyam pa skye zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar lus mi mnyam pa skye zhe na /
translated: How does the body become unbalanced?

original: stobs kyis bsgrims nas dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa la dam du dmigs pa na /🔽lus la rlung mi bzad pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: stobs kyis bsgrims nas dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa la dam du dmigs pa na / lus la rlung mi bzad pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When one observes too closely the exhalation and inhalation of the breath, which are grasped by the force of effort,🔽violent winds arise in the body.

original: rlung gis shas cher g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung gis shas cher g-yo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The body becomes agitated by these winds.

original: gang gi phyir rlung gis shas cher g-yo bar gyur pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rlung gis shas cher g-yo bar gyur pas /
translated: Because the body is agitated by these winds,

original: yan lag dang nying lag rnams g-yengs pa skye ste /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag rnams g-yengs pa skye ste /
translated: the limbs and the minor parts of the body are agitated.

original: de'i phyir lus rgod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus rgod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the body is agitated.”

original: 'di ltar lus g-yengs par gyur pa'i rlung de 'phel na /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus g-yengs par gyur pa'i rlung de 'phel na /
translated: When this wind that agitates the body increases in this way,

original: yan lag dang nying lag de dag tu lus kyi nang du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag de dag tu lus kyi nang du 'gyur te /
translated: it moves into the limbs and the minor parts of the body.

original: 'di ni lus mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lus mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: This is the “unbalancing of the body.”

original: ji ltar sems mi mnyam pa skye zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sems mi mnyam pa skye zhe na /
translated: How does an uneven mind arise?

original: @164b bsgrims te dmigs pa las sems g-yengs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @164b bsgrims te dmigs pa las sems g-yengs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind is distracted from the object by being too tight.

original: sems g-yengs pa 'phel ba las /
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa 'phel ba las /
translated: From the increase of distraction,

original: yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pas zil gyis gnon par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba dang 'khrugs pas zil gyis gnon par 'gyur te /
translated: the mind becomes overwhelmed by mental unhappiness and agitation.

original: de ni sems mi mnyam par skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sems mi mnyam par skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the arising of an uneven mind.

original: de la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'di la 'dris par bya ba rnam pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /🔽bgrang bas rab tu 'dris par bya ba dang / phung po la mkhas pas rab tu 'dris par bya ba dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la 'jug pas rab tu 'dris par bya ba dang / bden pa la 'jug pas rab tu 'dris par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de la dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'di la 'dris par bya ba rnam pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste / bgrang bas rab tu 'dris par bya ba dang / phung po la mkhas pas rab tu 'dris par bya ba dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la 'jug pas rab tu 'dris par bya ba dang / bden pa la 'jug pas rab tu 'dris par bya ba dang /
translated: Here, one should know that there are five ways of becoming familiar with inhalation and exhalation:

original: rnam pa bcu drug tu rab tu 'dris par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug tu rab tu 'dris par bya'o //
translated: becoming familiar with counting, becoming familiar with the aggregates, becoming familiar with entering into dependent origination, becoming familiar with entering into the truths, and becoming familiar with the sixteen aspects.

original: de la bgrang bas rab tu 'dris par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bgrang bas rab tu 'dris par bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is becoming familiar with counting?

original: de mdor na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de mdor na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, it is of four kinds:

original: re re nas bgrang ba dang / gnyis gcig tu bgrang ba dang / lugs bzhin du bgrang pa dang / lugs las bzlog ste bgrang ba'o //
analyzed: re re nas bgrang ba dang / gnyis gcig tu bgrang ba dang / lugs bzhin du bgrang pa dang / lugs las bzlog ste bgrang ba'o //
translated: Counting is of four types: counting from one up, counting from one hundred down, counting in the forward order, and counting in the reverse order.

original: de la re re nas bgrang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la re re nas bgrang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is counting from one up?

original: gang gi tshe dbugs nang du zhugs par gyur pa de na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbugs nang du zhugs par gyur pa de na /
translated: When the breath enters inside,

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la dmigs pa'i dran pas gcig ces bgrang bar byed do //🔽gang gi tshe dbugs rngub pa 'gags nas /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la dmigs pa'i dran pas gcig ces bgrang bar byed do // gang gi tshe dbugs rngub pa 'gags nas /
translated: through mindfulness that observes inhalation and exhalation, one counts “one.”🔽When inhalation ceases

original: dbugs 'byung ba skye ste med par gyur pa na /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba skye ste med par gyur pa na /
translated: and exhalation arises,

original: de'i tshe gnyis zhes bgrang bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe gnyis zhes bgrang bar byed do //
translated: at that time one counts “two.”

original: bgrang ba'i tshul de lta bus rnam pa bcu'i bar du bgrangs te /
analyzed: bgrang ba'i tshul de lta bus rnam pa bcu'i bar du bgrangs te /
translated: Through this method of counting, one counts up to ten.

original: 'di ni gnyis gcig tu bgrang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis gcig tu bgrang ba'o //
translated: This is counting from one up.

original: lugs bzhin du bgrang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: lugs bzhin du bgrang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is counting from one hundred down?

original: gang gong du bshad pa'i re re nas bgrang ba dang / gnyis gcig tu bgrang bar yang rung /
analyzed: gang gong du bshad pa'i re re nas bgrang ba dang / gnyis gcig tu bgrang bar yang rung /
translated: One may count from one up or count from one hundred down, as explained above.

original: rjes bzhin du bgrang ba'i bar du bgrang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: rjes bzhin du bgrang ba'i bar du bgrang bar byed pa ste /
translated: Counting in forward order is counting from one up to ten.🔽Counting in reverse order is counting from ten down to one.

original: 'di ni lugs bzhin du bgrang ba'o //🔽lugs las bzlog ste /🔽bgrang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni lugs bzhin du bgrang ba'o // lugs las bzlog ste / bgrang ba gang zhe na /
translated: Counting by twos is counting from one up to ten, saying “one and two” for the first two, “three and four” for the next two, and so on.🔽Counting by threes is counting from one up to ten, saying “one and two and three” for the first three, “four and five and six” for the next three, and so on.🔽Counting by fours is counting from one up to ten, saying “one and two and three and four” for the first four, “five and six and seven and eight” for the next four, and so on.

original: bcur phyin pa dang / gcig ces bgrang ngo //🔽dgu la gnyis zhes bgrang ngo //🔽brgyad la gsum zhes bgrang ba nas /
analyzed: bcur phyin pa dang / gcig ces bgrang ngo // dgu la gnyis zhes bgrang ngo // brgyad la gsum zhes bgrang ba nas /
translated: Counting by fives is counting from one up to ten, saying “one and two and three and four and five” for the first five, “six and seven and eight and nine and ten” for the next five, and so on.🔽Counting by sixes is counting from one up to ten, saying “one and two and three and four and five and six” for the first six, “seven and eight and nine and ten and eleven and twelve” for the next six, and so on.🔽Counting by sevens is counting from one up to ten, saying “one and two and three and four and five and six and seven” for the first seven, “eight and nine and ten and eleven and twelve and thirteen and fourteen” for the next seven, and so on.

original: gcig la bcu zhes bya ba'i bar du bgrangs te /🔽'di ni lugs las bzlog ste /🔽bgrang ba'o // gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa des re re nas bgrang ba'am /
analyzed: gcig la bcu zhes bya ba'i bar du bgrangs te / 'di ni lugs las bzlog ste / bgrang ba'o // gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa des re re nas bgrang ba'am /
translated: Counting by eights is counting from one up to ten, saying “one and two and three and four and five and six and seven and eight” for the first eight, “nine and ten and eleven and twelve and thirteen and fourteen and fifteen and sixteen” for the next eight, and so on.

original: gnyis gcig tu bgrang ba'am /🔽lugs las bzlog ste /🔽bgrang ba la rab tu goms par byas pas /🔽@165a * // de'i skabs su sems mi g-yeng zhing /🔽mi g-yeng pa kho nar bgrang nus na /🔽de'i gong du bgrang ba'i khyad par gzhan bgrang bar bya ste /🔽bgrang ba'i khyad par gzhan gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gcig tu bgrang ba'am / lugs las bzlog ste / bgrang ba la rab tu goms par byas pas / @165a * // de'i skabs su sems mi g-yeng zhing / mi g-yeng pa kho nar bgrang nus na / de'i gong du bgrang ba'i khyad par gzhan bgrang bar bya ste / bgrang ba'i khyad par gzhan gang zhe na /
translated: Counting by nines is counting from one up to ten, saying “one and two and three and four and five and six and seven and eight and nine” for the first nine, “ten and eleven and twelve and thirteen and fourteen and fifteen and sixteen and seventeen and eighteen” for the next nine, and so on.

original: re re nas bgrang ba'am /
analyzed: re re nas bgrang ba'am /
translated: Counting by tens is counting from one up to ten, saying “one and two and three and four and five and six and seven and eight and nine and ten” for the first ten, “eleven and twelve and thirteen and fourteen and fifteen and sixteen and seventeen and eighteen and nineteen and twenty” for the next ten, and so on.

original: gnyis gcig tu bgrang ba bsdoms nas gcig go /
analyzed: gnyis gcig tu bgrang ba bsdoms nas gcig go /
translated: Counting both as one, they are added together and counted as one.

original: zhes bgrang bar byed de /
analyzed: zhes bgrang bar byed de /
translated: Thus, they are counted.

original: de gnyis gcig tu bgrang bas ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa gnyis bzhi las gcig tu bgrod do //
analyzed: de gnyis gcig tu bgrang bas ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa gnyis bzhi las gcig tu bgrod do //
translated: By counting both as one, the two, exhalation and inhalation, are counted as one out of four.

original: re re nas bgrangs pas ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa re re nas bgrang bar byed de /
analyzed: re re nas bgrangs pas ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa re re nas bgrang bar byed de /
translated: By counting each one, they count each exhalation and inhalation.

original: de gnyis gcig tu bsdoms te /
analyzed: de gnyis gcig tu bsdoms te /
translated: By adding those two together,

original: bgrang ba'i tshul bcu'i bar du bgrang bar byed do //
analyzed: bgrang ba'i tshul bcu'i bar du bgrang bar byed do //
translated: they count up to ten ways of counting.

original: de la yang goms par byed na bcu yang gcig tu byas nas bgrang ba spel te /
analyzed: de la yang goms par byed na bcu yang gcig tu byas nas bgrang ba spel te /
translated: If one becomes familiar with that, then after making ten into one, they increase the counting.

original: bcu'i bar du bgrang ba nas /
analyzed: bcu'i bar du bgrang ba nas /
translated: They count up to ten.

original: brgya gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: brgya gcig tu byas te /
translated: After making one hundred into one,

original: bcu'i bar du bgrang bar byed do //
analyzed: bcu'i bar du bgrang bar byed do //
translated: they count up to ten.

original: gang gi tshe bgrang ba la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pas bcu gcig tu byas nas ;
analyzed: gang gi tshe bgrang ba la zhugs pa'i rnal 'byor pas bcu gcig tu byas nas ;
translated: When the yogi who has entered counting makes eleven,

original: bgrang ba'i tshul bcu'i bar du rdzogs par byed nus la /
analyzed: bgrang ba'i tshul bcu'i bar du rdzogs par byed nus la /
translated: he is able to complete the ten ways of counting.

original: bar du sems mi g-yeng na /
analyzed: bar du sems mi g-yeng na /
translated: If the mind is not distracted in between,

original: de tsam gyis bgrang pa'i tshul la goms par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam gyis bgrang pa'i tshul la goms par byas pa yin no //
translated: This is how one becomes familiar with the method of counting.

original: de ltar bgrang ba la zhugs pa las gal te sems 'khrugs sam g-yengs par gyur na /🔽slar mgo nas bzlog ste /
analyzed: de ltar bgrang ba la zhugs pa las gal te sems 'khrugs sam g-yengs par gyur na / slar mgo nas bzlog ste /
translated: If, while engaged in counting, the mind becomes agitated or distracted,🔽one should start over from the beginning

original: bgrang ba brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bgrang ba brtsam par bya'o //
translated: and begin counting again.

original: phung po la 'jug pa'i bar du goms par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: phung po la 'jug pa'i bar du goms par bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the practice of familiarization up to the aggregates?

original: rnal 'byor pa sbyor ba de la brten pa mang ba dang / bsgom pa mang ba dang / mang du bya ba dang ldan pas lus shin tu byang ba dang / sems shin tu byang ba skye bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa sbyor ba de la brten pa mang ba dang / bsgom pa mang ba dang / mang du bya ba dang ldan pas lus shin tu byang ba dang / sems shin tu byang ba skye bar 'gyur ro /
translated: The practitioner who is based on that yoga, who has much practice, who has much to do, will give rise to physical and mental fitness.

original: de lus shin tu byang ba dang / sems shin tu byang ba skyes pas /
analyzed: de lus shin tu byang ba dang / sems shin tu byang ba skyes pas /
translated: With the arising of physical and mental fitness,

original: sems rtse gcig pa la reg cing dmigs pa la rtag tu sems gnas pa dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa la reg cing dmigs pa la rtag tu sems gnas pa dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he will touch one-pointedness of mind and will always delight in the mind remaining on the object.

original: de ltar shin tu goms par bya ba de dbang po dang yul rnams kyi dngos po yid la byed pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de ltar shin tu goms par bya ba de dbang po dang yul rnams kyi dngos po yid la byed pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: In this way, through the method of bringing to mind the entities of the sense faculties and their objects,

original: phung po la 'jug ste ;
analyzed: phung po la 'jug ste ;
translated: he engages with the aggregates.

original: ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: How does one enter?

original: 'di ltar dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa 'di'i rten ni lus yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa 'di'i rten ni lus yin te /
translated: The support of this exhalation and inhalation is the body.

original: de lus la brten to zhes yid la byed pas na /
analyzed: de lus la brten to zhes yid la byed pas na /
translated: Since one attends to it as “the body is the support of that,”

original: gzugs kyi phung po la zhugs shing rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la zhugs shing rtogs pa yin no //
translated: one enters and realizes the form aggregate.

original: gang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa de dag la dmigs pa'i dran pas /
analyzed: gang dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa de dag la dmigs pa'i dran pas /
translated: By the mindfulness that observes those exhalations and inhalations,

original: de nyid kyi @165b mtshan nyid ma brjed par bzung zhing myong ba ni tshor ba'i phung po la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi @165b mtshan nyid ma brjed par bzung zhing myong ba ni tshor ba'i phung po la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: one holds and experiences their characteristics without forgetting them. This is entering the feeling aggregate.

original: de na gang kun tu shes pa yod pa de ni 'du shes kyi phung po ste zhes 'du shes kyi phung po la 'jug go //
analyzed: de na gang kun tu shes pa yod pa de ni 'du shes kyi phung po ste zhes 'du shes kyi phung po la 'jug go //
translated: One enters the perception aggregate by saying, “Whatever exists as perception there is the perception aggregate.”

original: gang de'i tshe dran pa yod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin yod pa dang / sems pa yod pa dang / shes rab yod pa ni /
analyzed: gang de'i tshe dran pa yod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin yod pa dang / sems pa yod pa dang / shes rab yod pa ni /
translated: One enters the aggregate of formations by saying, “Whatever exists as mindfulness there, whatever exists as concentration, volition, and wisdom there,

original: 'du byed kyi phung po'o //🔽zhes 'du byed kyi phung po la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po'o //🔽zhes 'du byed kyi phung po la 'jug go //
translated: is the formation aggregate.”

original: gang de'i tshe sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o zhes rnam par shes pa'i phung po la 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang de'i tshe sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o zhes rnam par shes pa'i phung po la 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, he enters into the aggregate of consciousness.

original: de ltar zhugs pa ni phung po la rab tu goms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa ni phung po la rab tu goms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has entered in this way is said to be well acquainted with the aggregates.

original: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa des phung po tsam du mthong zhing rab tu shes pa dang / 'du byed tsam dang / dngos po tsam du mthong zhing rab tu shes pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa des phung po tsam du mthong zhing rab tu shes pa dang / 'du byed tsam dang / dngos po tsam du mthong zhing rab tu shes pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When the yogin sees and understands only the aggregates, only the formations, and only the entities,

original: phung po de dag nyid la rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: phung po de dag nyid la rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu 'jug ste /
translated: then he enters into the characteristic of dependent origination in those very aggregates.

original: ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: How does he enter?

original: rnal 'byor pa de 'di ltar yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de 'di ltar yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: That yogin investigates in this way:

original: 'di ltar dbugs dbyung ba dang / rngub pa 'di ci la brten /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbugs dbyung ba dang / rngub pa 'di ci la brten /
translated: “In dependence on what do exhalation and inhalation occur?

original: ci'i rkyen las byung zhes brtags na /
analyzed: ci'i rkyen las byung zhes brtags na /
translated: What are their conditions?”

original: des 'di ltar khong du chud par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des 'di ltar khong du chud par 'gyur te /
translated: He understands in this way:🔽“Exhalation and inhalation occur in dependence on the body.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa 'di ni lus la brten pa /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa 'di ni lus la brten pa /
translated: This exhalation and inhalation is based on the body.

original: lus kyi rkyen las byung ba /
analyzed: lus kyi rkyen las byung ba /
translated: It arises with the body as its condition.

original: sems la brten pa /
analyzed: sems la brten pa /
translated: It is based on the mind.

original: sems kyi rkyen las byung ba'i zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: sems kyi rkyen las byung ba'i zhes rtogs so //
translated: It arises with the mind as its condition.

original: lus dang sems kyang ci'i rkyen gyis gnas zhes brtags na /
analyzed: lus dang sems kyang ci'i rkyen gyis gnas zhes brtags na /
translated: When he investigates, “On what condition do the body and mind remain?”

original: de yang da ltar 'tsho ba'i dbang po'i rten gyi gnas so zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: de yang da ltar 'tsho ba'i dbang po'i rten gyi gnas so zhes rtogs so //
translated: he understands, “They remain on the basis of the faculty of life.”

original: 'tsho ba'i dbang po de yang ci'i rkyen gyis byung zhes brtags na /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i dbang po de yang ci'i rkyen gyis byung zhes brtags na /
translated: When he investigates, “On what condition does the faculty of life arise?”

original: de yang tshe rabs gzhan gyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de yang tshe rabs gzhan gyi las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis byung bar rtogs so //
translated: he understands, “It arises with the condition of the formative forces of virtue and nonvirtue in other lives.”

original: sngon gyi 'du byed kyang ci'i rkyen gyis byung zhes brtags na /
analyzed: sngon gyi 'du byed kyang ci'i rkyen gyis byung zhes brtags na /
translated: When he investigates, “On what condition do the formative forces of the past arise?”

original: de yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung bar rtogs te /
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung bar rtogs te /
translated: he understands, “They arise with the condition of ignorance.”

original: de ltar na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis ni /🔽sngon du 'du byed rnams spyod do //
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis ni / sngon du 'du byed rnams spyod do //
translated: Thus, with the condition of ignorance,🔽the formative forces are activated in the past.

original: sngon gyi 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ni tshe'i dbang po //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis ni tshe'i dbang po //
translated: With the condition of the formative forces of the past, the faculty of life

original: tshe'i dbang po'i rkyen las ni lus dang rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: tshe'i dbang po'i rkyen las ni lus dang rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The condition of the life faculty is the body and consciousness.

original: lus dang sems kyi rkyen las ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa skye'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi rkyen las ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa skye'o //
translated: The condition of the body and mind is the arising of inhalation and exhalation.

original: de la ma rigs pa 'gags na 'du byed 'gag go //
analyzed: de la ma rigs pa 'gags na 'du byed 'gag go //
translated: When ignorance ceases, formations cease.

original: 'du byed 'gags na tshe'i dbang po 'gag go //
analyzed: 'du byed 'gags na tshe'i dbang po 'gag go //
translated: When formations cease, the life faculty ceases.

original: @166a * // tshe'i dbang po 'gags na lus dang sems 'gag go //
analyzed: @166a * // tshe'i dbang po 'gags na lus dang sems 'gag go //
translated: When the life faculty ceases, the body and mind cease.

original: lus dang sems 'gags na dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'gag ste /
analyzed: lus dang sems 'gags na dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa 'gag ste /
translated: When the body and mind cease, inhalation and exhalation cease.

original: de ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one enters into dependent origination.

original: ji ltar na bden pa la zhugs pa kun tu 'dris par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bden pa la zhugs pa kun tu 'dris par byed ce na /
translated: How does one who has entered the truths cultivate familiarity?

original: des de ltar rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la 'dris pa mang du byas pas /
analyzed: des de ltar rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la 'dris pa mang du byas pas /
translated: Through that, having cultivated familiarity with dependent origination extensively,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos de dag ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ste mi rtag pa'o zhes khong du chud do //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos de dag ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ste mi rtag pa'o zhes khong du chud do //
translated: one understands that those conditioned phenomena are dependently arisen and impermanent.

original: 'di dag mi rtag pa yin pas na /
analyzed: 'di dag mi rtag pa yin pas na /
translated: Since they are impermanent,

original: med pa la skye la skyes nas kyang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa la skye la skyes nas kyang med par 'gyur te /
translated: It arises from what does not exist, and having arisen, it becomes nonexistent.

original: de ltar gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de ni /
translated: This is how it is.

original: skye ba'i chos can dang / rga ba'i chos can dang / na ba'i chos can dang // gang skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba'i chos can de dag ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i chos can dang / rga ba'i chos can dang / na ba'i chos can dang // gang skye ba dang rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba'i chos can de dag ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: That which has the nature of arising, aging, sickness, and death is suffering.

original: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa /
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa /
translated: That which is suffering is without a self.

original: rab dbang med pa /
analyzed: rab dbang med pa /
translated: It is powerless,

original: bdag po med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag po med pa ste /
translated: and without an owner.

original: de ltar des mi rtag pa dang ; sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam par sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar des mi rtag pa dang ; sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam par sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, he enters into the truth of suffering by way of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self.

original: de yang 'di ji snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de yang 'di ji snyam du sems te /
translated: He also thinks this:

original: sdug bsngal gyi 'du byed sdug bsngal bar gyur pa dang / nad du gyur pa dang / 'bras bur gyur pa de skyed par byed pa'i rkyen ni srid pa'o zhes kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi 'du byed sdug bsngal bar gyur pa dang / nad du gyur pa dang / 'bras bur gyur pa de skyed par byed pa'i rkyen ni srid pa'o zhes kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: The condition that produces the formations of suffering, which are the suffering of change, the suffering of pain, and the suffering of the formative forces, is existence.🔽Thus, he enters into the truth of origination.

original: gang sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i sred pa de ma lus par spangs pa ni /
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i sred pa de ma lus par spangs pa ni /
translated: The complete abandonment of craving that generates suffering

original: zhi ba gya nom pa ste zhes 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: zhi ba gya nom pa ste zhes 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug go //
translated: is peace, excellence, the truth of cessation.

original: gang de ltar shes de ltar mthong /
analyzed: gang de ltar shes de ltar mthong /
translated: One who knows and sees thus,

original: de ltar khong du chud pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar khong du chud pa ni /
translated: who has thus penetrated🔽the truth of the path,

original: lam gyi bden pa yin te zhes lam gyi bden pa la yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa yin te zhes lam gyi bden pa la yang 'jug ste /
translated: thus enters the truth of the path.

original: de ltar na de bden pa bzhi la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de bden pa bzhi la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, one enters the four noble truths.

original: rnal 'byor pa de la bden pa bzhi la 'dris par byas pas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de la bden pa bzhi la 'dris par byas pas /
translated: The yogi/nī, having become familiar with the four noble truths,

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs nas /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs nas /
translated: having completely abandoned the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing,

original: de bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to abandon the afflictions to be abandoned by meditation,

original: rnam pa bcu drug la rab tu 'dris par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug la rab tu 'dris par byed de /
translated: becomes familiar with the sixteen aspects.

original: rnam pa bcu drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the sixteen aspects?

original: dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba la dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba la dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: When exhaling, he knows, “I am exhaling,” and when inhaling, he knows, “I am inhaling.”🔽When inhaling, he knows, “I am inhaling,” and when exhaling, he knows, “I am exhaling.”

original: so sor spong bar lta ba bzhin du dbugs rngub pa @166b la yang ;🔽so sor spong bar lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: so sor spong bar lta ba bzhin du dbugs rngub pa @166b la yang ; so sor spong bar lta ba bzhin du /
translated: When inhaling long, he knows, “I am inhaling long,” and when exhaling long, he knows, “I am exhaling long.”

original: dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa 'di ni /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa 'di ni /
translated: When inhaling short, he knows, “I am inhaling short,” and when exhaling short, he knows, “I am exhaling short.”🔽He trains thinking, “I will inhale and exhale experiencing the whole body.”🔽He trains thinking, “I will inhale and exhale calming the bodily formation.”🔽He trains thinking, “I will inhale and exhale experiencing happiness.”🔽He trains thinking, “I will inhale and exhale experiencing the mental formation.”🔽He trains thinking, “I will inhale and exhale experiencing the mind.”

original: dge slong dag dbugs ba 'byung ba dang rngub pa dran pa bcu drug go zhes gang mdo las gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag dbugs ba 'byung ba dang rngub pa dran pa bcu drug go zhes gang mdo las gsungs so //
translated: He trains thinking, “I will inhale and exhale gladdening the mind.”🔽He trains thinking, “I will inhale and exhale concentrating the mind.”🔽He trains thinking, “I will inhale and exhale liberating the mind.”🔽He trains thinking, “I will inhale and exhale contemplating impermanence.”🔽He trains thinking, “I will inhale and exhale contemplating the desire for detachment.”🔽He trains thinking, “I will inhale and exhale contemplating cessation.”🔽He trains thinking, “I will inhale and exhale contemplating relinquishment.”🔽These are the sixteen aspects of mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: tshig bcu drug po de dag ji ltar rab tu dbye zhe na /
analyzed: tshig bcu drug po de dag ji ltar rab tu dbye zhe na /
translated: How are these sixteen aspects classified?

original: gong du bden pa bzhi la goms par bya ba'i skabs su bden pa bzhi mthong ba'i slob pa'i gang zag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la dmigs pa thob pa des /
analyzed: gong du bden pa bzhi la goms par bya ba'i skabs su bden pa bzhi mthong ba'i slob pa'i gang zag dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la dmigs pa thob pa des /
translated: When a person who is a learner and has attained the object of observation of the four establishments of mindfulness has seen the four truths, he cultivates familiarity with the four truths as explained above.

original: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i kun nas sbyor ba lhag ma spang ba'i phyir dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yid la byed pa rtsol bar byed de /
analyzed: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i kun nas sbyor ba lhag ma spang ba'i phyir dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa yid la byed pa rtsol bar byed de /
translated: He exerts himself in the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation in order to abandon the remaining fetters that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: nam dbugs 'byung ba'i dus na /
analyzed: nam dbugs 'byung ba'i dus na /
translated: When exhaling,

original: sems ma rmongs pas ji ltar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dran pa bzhin du 'byung bar shes pa ni /
analyzed: sems ma rmongs pas ji ltar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid dran pa bzhin du 'byung bar shes pa ni /
translated: he knows, in accordance with the mindfulness of the characteristics of exhalation, that it is exhalation.

original: dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba la /
translated: When inhaling,

original: dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽dbugs nang du rngub pa'i dus la g-yeng ba med par dran pas de nyid la dran bzhin du dmigs so zhes shes pa na ni /🔽dran pa bzhin du dbugs rngub pa la yang /
analyzed: dran bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o // dbugs nang du rngub pa'i dus la g-yeng ba med par dran pas de nyid la dran bzhin du dmigs so zhes shes pa na ni / dran pa bzhin du dbugs rngub pa la yang /
translated: he knows, in accordance with the mindfulness of the characteristics of inhalation, that it is inhalation.🔽When exhaling, he knows, in accordance with the mindfulness of the characteristics of exhalation, that it is exhalation.

original: dran bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dran bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When inhaling, he knows, in accordance with the mindfulness of the characteristics of inhalation, that it is inhalation.

original: bcu drug las 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: bcu drug las 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: This is the first of the sixteen.

original: gang gi tshe dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la dmigs par byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la dmigs par byed pa de'i tshe na ni /
translated: When one focuses on inhalation and exhalation,

original: dbugs 'byung ba ring po la dbugs 'byung ba ring po'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / dbugs ring du shes pa dang / dbugs ring du rngub pa la yang dbugs ring du rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba ring po la dbugs 'byung ba ring po'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / dbugs ring du shes pa dang / dbugs ring du rngub pa la yang dbugs ring du rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: then it is called “correct knowledge of exhalation and inhalation just as it is,” “knowledge of long exhalation,” and “knowledge of long inhalation just as it is.”

original: 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second.

original: gang gi tshe dbugs 'byung ba'i bar dang rngub pa'i bar yid la byed pa na ni /🔽dbugs 'byung ba thung ngu zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbugs 'byung ba'i bar dang rngub pa'i bar yid la byed pa na ni / dbugs 'byung ba thung ngu zhes bya ba nas /
translated: When one attends to the interval of inhalation and exhalation,

original: dbugs rngub pa thung ngu zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa thung ngu zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ste /

original: 'di ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pa dbugs 'byung ba la dmigs pa na /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa dbugs 'byung ba la dmigs pa na /
translated: Or, when the yogi focuses on exhalation,

original: lte ba'i phyogs nas brtsams te dbugs byung nas kha sna'i sgo nas /
analyzed: lte ba'i phyogs nas brtsams te dbugs byung nas kha sna'i sgo nas /
translated: Beginning from the navel, the breath emerges through the mouth and nose.

original: phyi mtho gang dang khru gang dang 'dom gang la sogs pa ji srid du 'byung ba la dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: phyi mtho gang dang khru gang dang 'dom gang la sogs pa ji srid du 'byung ba la dmigs pa ni /
translated: It is focused on the exhalation as far as one cubit, one fathom, one league, and so on.

original: dbugs 'byung ba ring po la dbugs 'byung ba ring po'o zhes yang @167a * //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba ring po la dbugs 'byung ba ring po'o zhes yang @167a * //

original: dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the breath is short, it is known as it really is that the breath is short.

original: nam rnal 'byor pas dbugs rngub pa la dmigs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: nam rnal 'byor pas dbugs rngub pa la dmigs pa'i tshe /
translated: When the yogi focuses on the inhalation,

original: kha sna'i sgo nas brtsams te /
analyzed: kha sna'i sgo nas brtsams te /
translated: beginning from the mouth and nose,

analyzed: lte ba'i bar du dbugs ji ltar thung du song ba dmigs pa na ni / dbugs ring du rngub pa yang dbugs ring du rngub pa'o //
translated: as the breath goes to the navel, he focuses on how short it is.

original: zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽nam rnal 'byor pas dbugs phyir 'byung ba lte ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o // nam rnal 'byor pas dbugs phyir 'byung ba lte ba nas brtsams te /
translated: When the breath is long, it is known as it really is that the breath is long.🔽When the yogi focuses on the exhalation, beginning from the navel,

original: brang gi bar du byung nas chad pa la dmigs pa na ni /
analyzed: brang gi bar du byung nas chad pa la dmigs pa na ni /
translated: it emerges to the chest and then stops.

original: dbugs 'byung ba thung ngu la dbugs 'byung ba thung ngu zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba thung ngu la dbugs 'byung ba thung ngu zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the yogi knows the short exhalation as it is in reality, it is called the knowledge of the short exhalation.

original: nam rnal 'byor pas dbugs rngub pa na yang kha sna'i sgo nas mgrin pa la sogs pa'i bar du chad pa la dmigs na ni dbugs 'byung ba thung ngu la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nam rnal 'byor pas dbugs rngub pa na yang kha sna'i sgo nas mgrin pa la sogs pa'i bar du chad pa la dmigs na ni dbugs 'byung ba thung ngu la dmigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the yogi focuses on the interruption of the breath from the mouth and nose to the throat and so on during inhalation, it is called the focus on the short exhalation.

original: nam rnal 'byor pas sul dang bu ga rags pa'i dbugs 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i tshe na ni /🔽lus so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba la /
analyzed: nam rnal 'byor pas sul dang bu ga rags pa'i dbugs 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i tshe na ni / lus so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba la /
translated: When the yogi focuses on the coarse exhalation through the pores and cavities,🔽it is called the knowledge of the exhalation with bodily awareness.

original: lus so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When the yogi knows the exhalation with bodily awareness as it is in reality, it is called the knowledge of the exhalation with bodily awareness.

original: nam rnal 'byor pas dbugs rngub pa'i sul dang bu ga rags pa las dbugs rngub pa la dmigs pa'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: nam rnal 'byor pas dbugs rngub pa'i sul dang bu ga rags pa las dbugs rngub pa la dmigs pa'i tshe na ni /
translated: When the yogi focuses on the inhalation through the coarse pores and cavities,

original: lus so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa las lus so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa las lus so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one knows the body and inhales, it is called “knowing the body and inhaling.”

original: don du na lte ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: don du na lte ba nas brtsams te /
translated: In fact, it is from the navel

original: rgyu ma dang long ka dang / pho ba la sogs pa nas dbugs phyir ji ltar 'byung ba la dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu ma dang long ka dang / pho ba la sogs pa nas dbugs phyir ji ltar 'byung ba la dmigs pa ni /
translated: and from the intestines, the stomach, and so on, that the breath goes out.

original: lus so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Observing this, it is called “knowing the body and exhaling as it really is.”

original: nam kha sna'i sgo nas gre ba la sogs par thur du rgyu zhing rgyu ma dang / long ka la sogs par ji ltar zhugs pa la dmigs pa na ni ;
analyzed: nam kha sna'i sgo nas gre ba la sogs par thur du rgyu zhing rgyu ma dang / long ka la sogs par ji ltar zhugs pa la dmigs pa na ni ;
translated: When the breath goes down from the nose to the throat and so on, and enters the intestines, the stomach, and so on,

original: lus so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: observing this, it is called “knowing the body and inhaling as it really is.”

original: 'di ni bzhi pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bzhi pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the fourth.

original: nam rnal 'byor pas dbugs 'byung ba 'di yang lus kyi 'du byed de lus la brten /
analyzed: nam rnal 'byor pas dbugs 'byung ba 'di yang lus kyi 'du byed de lus la brten /
translated: When the yogi knows that this exhalation is a bodily formation, that it is based on the body,

original: lus la gnas par shes nas dbugs 'byung ba lus la @167b brten ;
analyzed: lus la gnas par shes nas dbugs 'byung ba lus la @167b brten ;
translated: and that it is present in the body, he knows that the exhalation is based on the body.

original: ji ltar 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i dus na ni /
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i dus na ni /
translated: When he focuses on the exhalation,

original: lus kyi 'du shes so sor shes bzhin dbugs 'byung ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi 'du shes so sor shes bzhin dbugs 'byung ba la /
translated: he knows the bodily formation of exhalation.

original: lus kyi 'du shes so sor shes bzhin du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du shes so sor shes bzhin du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “knowing the body as it really is.”

original: nam rnal 'byor pas dbugs rngub pa 'di yang /
analyzed: nam rnal 'byor pas dbugs rngub pa 'di yang /
translated: When the yogi knows that this inhalation

analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed lus la brten / lus la brten nas rngub par shes te /
translated: is a bodily formation, that it is based on the body,

original: lus la brten nas dbugs ji ltar rngub pa las /🔽dmigs pa'i dus na ni lus kyi 'du byed so sor shes bzhin dbugs rngub pa la /
analyzed: lus la brten nas dbugs ji ltar rngub pa las / dmigs pa'i dus na ni lus kyi 'du byed so sor shes bzhin dbugs rngub pa la /
translated: and that it is present in the body, he knows that the inhalation is based on the body.🔽When he focuses on the inhalation,🔽he knows the bodily formation of inhalation.

original: lus kyi 'du byed so sor shes bzhin dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed so sor shes bzhin dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “knowing the body as it really is.”

original: 'di ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth.

original: nam rnal 'byor pas spu dang ba spu'i khung bu la sogs pa sul dang bu ga phra mo nas dbugs ji ltar 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i dus na ni /🔽lus thams cad so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba la /
analyzed: nam rnal 'byor pas spu dang ba spu'i khung bu la sogs pa sul dang bu ga phra mo nas dbugs ji ltar 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i dus na ni / lus thams cad so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba la /
translated: When a yogin focuses on the way the breath comes out through the pores and the fine channels of the body,

original: lus thams cad la so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: lus thams cad la so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //

original: nam rnal 'byor pas ba spu la sogs pa'i bu ga dang sul phra mo nas dbugs ji ltar nang du 'jug pa la dmigs pa'i dus na ni /🔽lus thams cad so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa la /
analyzed: nam rnal 'byor pas ba spu la sogs pa'i bu ga dang sul phra mo nas dbugs ji ltar nang du 'jug pa la dmigs pa'i dus na ni / lus thams cad so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa la /
translated: When a yogin focuses on the way the breath goes in through the fine channels and pores of the body,

original: lus thams cad la so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus thams cad la so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he knows correctly and precisely that the breath is going in while the whole body is being aware of it.

original: 'di ni drug pa'o //🔽rnal 'byor pas dbugs 'byung ba yang 'gags /
analyzed: 'di ni drug pa'o // rnal 'byor pas dbugs 'byung ba yang 'gags /

original: bar gyi dbugs kyang 'gags te /
analyzed: bar gyi dbugs kyang 'gags te /

analyzed: dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa gzhan ma skyes pa'i gnas stong pa la dmigs shing /
translated: When one focuses on the empty state of the non-arising of the other exhalation and inhalation,

original: de khong du chud par gyur pa'i dus na ni /
analyzed: de khong du chud par gyur pa'i dus na ni /
translated: and when one comprehends that,

original: bdag gi lus kyi 'du byed shin tu byang bar dbugs 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bdag gi lus kyi 'du byed shin tu byang bar dbugs 'byung ba la /
translated: then, with regard to the exhalation of the very purified bodily volitions,

analyzed: bdag gi lus kyi 'du byed shin tu byang bar dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: it is said that one correctly knows, just as it is, that “the exhalation of the very purified bodily volitions is mine.”

analyzed: shin tu byang ba ni dbugs 'byung ba dang bral ba'i gnas dang dus la bya'o //

original: nam rnal 'byor ba dbugs rngub pa yang 'gags /
analyzed: nam rnal 'byor ba dbugs rngub pa yang 'gags /
translated: When the yogi’s inhalation ceases,

original: bar gyi dbugs kyang 'gags nas /
analyzed: bar gyi dbugs kyang 'gags nas /
translated: and the intermediate breath also ceases,

translated: and one focuses on the empty state of the non-arising of the other exhalation and inhalation,🔽then, with regard to the inhalation of the very purified bodily volitions,

analyzed: dbugs rngub pa la bdag gi lus kyi 'du byed shin tu byang ba'o //
translated: it is said that one correctly knows, just as it is, that “the inhalation of the very purified bodily volitions is mine.”

original: zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes te /
analyzed: zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes te /
translated: Thus, it is called “thoroughly knowing just as it is.”🔽🔽

original: 'di ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdun pa'o //
translated: This is the seventh.

analyzed: yang na shin tu byang ba'i don ni dbugs 'byin pa dang / rngub pa la dmigs pas lus dang sems las su rung ba byas pas shes pa'o //
translated: Or, the meaning of “purified” is that by observing inhalation and exhalation, the body and mind become serviceable, and one becomes aware of that.

analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa la dmigs pa'i tshe /

original: de dang bral te de goms par bya ba'i mthus /
analyzed: de dang bral te de goms par bya ba'i mthus /
translated: When that ceases, one is free from that, and by the power of cultivating that,

original: dbugs kyang phrar rgyu zhing /
analyzed: dbugs kyang phrar rgyu zhing /
translated: one’s inhalation and exhalation become subtle.

original: de la dmigs pa'i sems kyang sha thang ba med par bde ba'i reg pa dang ldan bzhin du dmigs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i sems kyang sha thang ba med par bde ba'i reg pa dang ldan bzhin du dmigs pa 'byung ste /
translated: The mind that focuses on that is also endowed with the pleasant touch of not being exhausted, and the object of meditation arises.

original: de bas na bdag gi lus kyi 'du byed shin tu byang bar dbugs 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gi lus kyi 'du byed shin tu byang bar dbugs 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The formative forces of my body are very pure, and I breathe out and breathe in.”

original: rnal 'byor pa des de ltar dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa'i dran pa'i sbyor ba rab tu sbyar ba'i stobs kyis /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa des de ltar dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa'i dran pa'i sbyor ba rab tu sbyar ba'i stobs kyis /
translated: By the power of that yogi’s application of the practice of mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation,

analyzed: gal te bsam gtan dang po'am /

analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa thob par gyur pa de na /

analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang / rngub pa la dmigs pa'i rgyus ji ltar bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa thob par shes pa ni / dga' ba so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: then, due to the cause of focusing on inhalation and exhalation, he knows how to attain the first and second concentrations.🔽It is said, “With individual knowledge of joy, I breathe out,” and “With individual knowledge of joy, I breathe in.”

original: dga' ba so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dga' ba so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is said, “I know it as it really is.”

original: 'di ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: This is the eighth.

original: gal te des dga' ba dang bral ba bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba myong bar gyur pa de'i tshe na ni /🔽bde ba so sor shes bzhin dbugs 'byung ba la zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gal te des dga' ba dang bral ba bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba myong bar gyur pa de'i tshe na ni / bde ba so sor shes bzhin dbugs 'byung ba la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: If he experiences the pleasure of the third concentration free from joy,🔽then he correctly knows, “Breathing out, I experience pleasure and am aware of pleasure,”

original: bde ba so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and “Breathing in, I experience pleasure and am aware of pleasure,” and so on.

original: 'di ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgu pa'o //
translated: This is the ninth.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad nyes pa brgyad dang bral ba yin pas /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad nyes pa brgyad dang bral ba yin pas /
translated: Since the fourth concentration and above are free from the eight faults,

analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi yan chad ni dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dran pa la sbyor ba @168b med do //
translated: the fourth concentration and above are not the context for the practice of mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: gal te rnal 'byor pa des rtsa ba'i bsam gtan dang po'am gnyis pa'am gsum pa thob par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor pa des rtsa ba'i bsam gtan dang po'am gnyis pa'am gsum pa thob par gyur na /
translated: If the practitioner has attained the first, second, or third concentration,

analyzed: des gdon mi za bar mi thob tu mi rung ba dang / bsam gtan dang po'i nyer bsdogs kyi ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will definitely attain the concentration of access to the first concentration.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin de dag la brten nas /🔽rang gi sems ci dang ci byung ba dang / ji lta ji ltar skyes pa la rab tu rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin de dag la brten nas / rang gi sems ci dang ci byung ba dang / ji lta ji ltar skyes pa la rab tu rtogs par byed de /
translated: On the basis of those meditative concentrations,🔽he fully understands whatever arises in his mind and how it arises.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa'am /
translated: He understands whether it is associated with desire

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'am /
translated: or free from desire,

original: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bcas pa'am /
translated: whether it is associated with hatred

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba'am /🔽gti mug dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba'am / gti mug dang bcas pa'am /
translated: or free from hatred,🔽whether it is associated with ignorance

original: gti mug dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: gti mug dang bral ba'am /
translated: or free from ignorance,

original: bsdus pa'am / g-yengs pa'am /🔽zhum pa'am / gzengs ma thos pa'am /
analyzed: bsdus pa'am / g-yengs pa'am / zhum pa'am / gzengs ma thos pa'am /
translated: whether it is contracted or distracted,

original: rgod pa'am / mi rgod pa'am /
analyzed: rgod pa'am / mi rgod pa'am /
translated: whether it is slack or excited,

original: zhi ba'am / ma zhi ba'am /🔽mnyam par gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: zhi ba'am / ma zhi ba'am / mnyam par gzhag pa'am /

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'am /🔽legs par bsgom pa'am /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'am / legs par bsgom pa'am /
translated: whether it is concentrated or not concentrated,

original: legs par ma bsgom pa'am /
analyzed: legs par ma bsgom pa'am /
translated: whether it is well cultivated or not well cultivated,

original: rnam par grol ba'am /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'am /
translated: whether it is liberated or not liberated.

original: rnam par ma grol ba zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu khong du chud cing shes pa byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par ma grol ba zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu khong du chud cing shes pa byung ste /
translated: He understands these things just as they are.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la dmigs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa la dmigs pa'i tshe /
translated: When he is focused on the inhalation and exhalation of breath,

original: sems kyi ngo bo ci 'dra bar 'byung bar shes pa ni /🔽sems so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba nas ;
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo ci 'dra bar 'byung bar shes pa ni / sems so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba nas ;
translated: Knowing how the nature of the mind arises is🔽knowing that the breath goes out while being aware of the mind, and

original: sems so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems so sor shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o zhes bya ste /
translated: knowing that the breath goes in while being aware of the mind, just as it is.

original: 'di ni bcu pa'o //🔽rnal 'byor pa sems la brten nas dbugs 'byung bar 'gyur ba las sems la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ni bcu pa'o // rnal 'byor pa sems la brten nas dbugs 'byung bar 'gyur ba las sems la brten nas /
translated: This is the tenth.🔽When the breath goes out in dependence on the mind,

original: dbugs ji ltar 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i tshe na ni ;🔽sems kyi 'du byed so sor shes bzhin dbugs 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dbugs ji ltar 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i tshe na ni ; sems kyi 'du byed so sor shes bzhin dbugs 'byung ba la /
translated: and the yogi focuses on how the breath goes out in dependence on the mind,🔽it is called “knowing the mental formations while being aware of the breath going out.”

original: sems kyi 'du byed so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽dbugs rngub pa yang sems la brten nas dbugs rngub pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi 'du byed so sor shes bzhin du dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o // dbugs rngub pa yang sems la brten nas dbugs rngub pa ste /
translated: It is knowing that the breath goes out while being aware of the mental formations, just as it is.🔽Inhaling is also in dependence on the mind.

original: sems la brten nas dbugs ji ltar rngub pa la dmigs pa'i dus na ni /
analyzed: sems la brten nas dbugs ji ltar rngub pa la dmigs pa'i dus na ni /
translated: When the breath goes in in dependence on the mind, and the yogi focuses on how the breath goes in in dependence on the mind,🔽it is called “knowing the mental formations while being aware of the breath going in.”🔽It is knowing that the breath goes in while being aware of the mental formations, just as it is.

original: sems kyi 'du byed so sor yang dag par shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa la /
analyzed: sems kyi 'du byed so sor yang dag par shes bzhin du dbugs rngub pa la /
translated: Inhaling while knowing the mental formations individually,🔽exhaling while knowing the mental formations individually,🔽inhaling while knowing the mental formations individually,

original: sems kyi 'du byed so sor yang dag par shes bzhin dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems kyi 'du byed so sor yang dag par shes bzhin dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: and exhaling while knowing the mental formations individually.

original: 'di ni bcu gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bcu gcig pa'o //
translated: This is the eleventh.

original: de ltar @169a * //🔽des dga' ba so sor myong bar gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de ltar @169a * // des dga' ba so sor myong bar gyur pa'am /
translated: In this way,🔽if he experiences joy individually,

original: bde ba so sor myong bar gyur pas /
analyzed: bde ba so sor myong bar gyur pas /
translated: or experiences happiness individually,

original: gal te brgya la zhig dran pa rmongs pa'i rgyus bdag ce'am /
analyzed: gal te brgya la zhig dran pa rmongs pa'i rgyus bdag ce'am /
translated: if he becomes confused due to a cause of forgetfulness,

original: bdag ni bdag gi zhe'am /🔽bdag gi 'byung bar 'gyur zhe'am /
analyzed: bdag ni bdag gi zhe'am / bdag gi 'byung bar 'gyur zhe'am /
translated: thinking “I” or “mine,”

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe'am /🔽gzugs can du 'gyur zhe'am /
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhe'am / gzugs can du 'gyur zhe'am /
translated: thinking “I will come to be” or “I will not come to be,”

original: gzugs med par 'gyur zhe'am /
analyzed: gzugs med par 'gyur zhe'am /
translated: thinking “I will have form” or “I will be formless,”

original: 'du shes can nam /🔽'du shes med pa'am /
analyzed: 'du shes can nam / 'du shes med pa'am /
translated: thinking “I will have perception” or “I will be without perception,”🔽or thinking “I will be neither with nor without perception,”

original: 'du shes med min du 'gyur zhes rmongs pa'i 'du shes kyis sems g-yo ba byung na /
analyzed: 'du shes med min du 'gyur zhes rmongs pa'i 'du shes kyis sems g-yo ba byung na /
translated: if a confused perception causes the mind to move,

original: myur du myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: myur du myur bar shes rab kyis rtogs par byas nas /
translated: he should quickly, quickly understand it with wisdom.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa gnyis la dmigs te /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa gnyis la dmigs te /
translated: He focuses on the two, exhalation and inhalation.

original: rtogs pa de dag gnas par mi byed cing rab tu spong ba la sel bar byed de /🔽de ni bdag gi sems kyi 'du byed shin tu byang bar dbugs 'byung ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rtogs pa de dag gnas par mi byed cing rab tu spong ba la sel bar byed de / de ni bdag gi sems kyi 'du byed shin tu byang bar dbugs 'byung ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He does not dwell on those thoughts, but eliminates them by thoroughly abandoning them.🔽This is called “I breathe out with the mental formation of my mind thoroughly purified” and “I breathe in with the mental formation of my mind thoroughly purified.”

original: bdag gi sems kyi 'du byed shin tu byang bar dbugs rngub pa zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gi sems kyi 'du byed shin tu byang bar dbugs rngub pa zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called “I know as it really is.”

original: 'di ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the twelfth.

original: de ltar bsgoms pa las /
analyzed: de ltar bsgoms pa las /
translated: Thus, through meditation,

original: gal te gnyid dang rmongs pa'i sgrib pas sems non par gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gnyid dang rmongs pa'i sgrib pas sems non par gyur te /
translated: if the mind is overcome by the obscurations of sleep and confusion,

original: sems mi gsal bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: sems mi gsal bar gyur pa na /
translated: and the mind becomes unclear,

original: sems dga' ba dang / gsal bar gyur pa'i dmigs pa 'ga' zhig la dmigs nas ;
analyzed: sems dga' ba dang / gsal bar gyur pa'i dmigs pa 'ga' zhig la dmigs nas ;
translated: then, focusing on some object that delights and clarifies the mind,

original: sems gzengs bstod pa dang / dga' bar bya ste /
analyzed: sems gzengs bstod pa dang / dga' bar bya ste /
translated: he should encourage the mind and delight it.

original: yang dmigs pa'i phyi nang du rgyu ba dmigs pa'i tshe na ni /🔽bdag gi sems mngon par dga' ste /
analyzed: yang dmigs pa'i phyi nang du rgyu ba dmigs pa'i tshe na ni / bdag gi sems mngon par dga' ste /
translated: Again, when he focuses on the movement of the breath inside and outside the body,

original: dbugs rngub pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa'o //
translated: he should think, “I breathe in with my mind filled with joy.🔽I breathe out with my mind filled with joy.”

original: zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called “thoroughly knowing what is true just as it is.”

original: 'di ni bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the thirteenth.

original: de ltar dmigs pa de la brten pa mang ba dang / sgom pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la dmigs pa nyid la mang du bya ba mang bas /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa de la brten pa mang ba dang / sgom pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la dmigs pa nyid la mang du bya ba mang bas /
translated: Thus, by frequently attending to that object, by cultivating it, and by frequently attending to the inhalation and exhalation of the breath,

original: rmugs pa dang rgod pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa mngon du rgyu ba rnams ring du byas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang rgod pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa mngon du rgyu ba rnams ring du byas par 'gyur te /
translated: the obscurations of lethargy, agitation, etc., that are manifest are removed.

original: bdag gi sgrib pa rnams bsal zhes pa na ni /🔽bdag gi sems rnam par grol te dbugs 'byung ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdag gi sgrib pa rnams bsal zhes pa na ni / bdag gi sems rnam par grol te dbugs 'byung ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “When my obscurations are removed” means

original: bdag gi sems rnam par grol te dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi sems rnam par grol te dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “my mind is liberated when I exhale” and “my mind is liberated when I inhale.” This is called “thoroughly knowing what is true just as it is.”

original: 'di ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bcu bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourteenth.

original: gal te de ltar bsgom pa'i tshe rgod sgrib pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pas bsgribs par gyur pa @169b mthong nas dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa gnyis la dmigs nas sems mngon par bsdus te nang du 'jog par byed cing zhi bar byed /
analyzed: gal te de ltar bsgom pa'i tshe rgod sgrib pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pas bsgribs par gyur pa @169b mthong nas dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa gnyis la dmigs nas sems mngon par bsdus te nang du 'jog par byed cing zhi bar byed /
translated: If, while meditating in this way, he sees that he is obscured by the obscurations of agitation and doubt, he focuses on the two, exhalation and inhalation, and, by strongly concentrating his mind, he pacifies.

original: sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'i dus na ni /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu 'jog pa'i dus na ni /
translated: When he is placing his mind one-pointedly,

original: bdag gi sems mnyam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: bdag gi sems mnyam par gzhag ste /
translated: he thinks, “My mind is in equipoise.

original: dbugs 'byung ba la zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: I am exhaling,” and so on, up to

original: bdag gi sems mnyam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: bdag gi sems mnyam par gzhag ste /
translated: “My mind is in equipoise.

original: dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: I am inhaling.”

original: 'di ni bco lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bco lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifteenth.

original: de sgrib pa rnams las sems rnam par grol bar gyur pa dang / lhag ma las bsgom pa'i bar du gcod par byed pa'i bag la nyal lhag ma lus par gyur te /
analyzed: de sgrib pa rnams las sems rnam par grol bar gyur pa dang / lhag ma las bsgom pa'i bar du gcod par byed pa'i bag la nyal lhag ma lus par gyur te /
translated: When his mind is liberated from the obscurations and the remaining latent states that obstruct the meditation remain,

original: de dag spang bar bya ba'i phyir bden pa bzhi bsgom pa'i lam mngon du byed do //
analyzed: de dag spang bar bya ba'i phyir bden pa bzhi bsgom pa'i lam mngon du byed do //
translated: In order to abandon them, he manifests the path of meditation on the four noble truths.

original: de yang 'di ltar byed de /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar byed de /
translated: And he does it in this way:

original: 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa'i chos so zhes sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dang por rtogs te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams mi rtag pa'i chos so zhes sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la dang por rtogs te /
translated: First, he realizes the truth of suffering, that all conditioned things are impermanent.

original: de bas na de bzhin du mi rtag par lta ba dang / zhes gsungs so //
