analyzed: de bas na de bzhin du mi rtag par lta ba dang / zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he sees them as impermanent in that way.

original: rnal 'byor pa des sngar bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa la brten pa dang / mi thos su mi rung ba la brten nas zhi gnas la goms par byas so //🔽da ni mi rtag pa dang rjes su mthong bas na /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa des sngar bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang gsum pa la brten pa dang / mi thos su mi rung ba la brten nas zhi gnas la goms par byas so // da ni mi rtag pa dang rjes su mthong bas na /
translated: That yogin, previously, based on the first, second, and third concentrations, and based on the unpleasant, has cultivated serenity.

original: lhag mthong goms par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag mthong goms par byed pa yin no //
translated: Now, he cultivates insight by seeing impermanence.

original: de ltar de'i sems ni /
analyzed: de ltar de'i sems ni /
translated: Thus, his mind,

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms par byas pas /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms par byas pas /
translated: having cultivated serenity and insight,

original: de'i 'og tu khams gsum la mos par byed de /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khams gsum la mos par byed de /
translated: after that, he becomes devoted to the three realms.

original: khams gsum ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams dang / so sor spong ba'i khams so //
analyzed: khams gsum ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams dang / so sor spong ba'i khams so //
translated: The three realms are the realm of freedom from desire, the realm of cessation, and the realm of individual liberation.

original: de la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad spang ba la mos pa ni /
analyzed: de la bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad spang ba la mos pa ni /
translated: The aspiration to eliminate all the mental formations that are to be eliminated by the path of cultivation is

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar lta'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar lta'o //
translated: the view of freedom from desire.

original: phung po thams cad spang ba la mos pa ni 'gog pa la lta ste /
analyzed: phung po thams cad spang ba la mos pa ni 'gog pa la lta ste /
translated: The aspiration to eliminate all the aggregates is the view of cessation.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad spang ba la mos pa ni /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i 'du byed thams cad spang ba la mos pa ni /
translated: The aspiration to eliminate all the mental formations that are to be eliminated by the path of seeing is

original: so sor spong bar lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: so sor spong bar lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: called the view of individual liberation.

original: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i tshe de ltar rmongs pa skyes pa ni /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa'i tshe de ltar rmongs pa skyes pa ni /
translated: When you are confused about the exhalation and inhalation of the breath,

original: dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par byas nas /
analyzed: dbugs 'byung ba'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par byas nas /
translated: you should understand correctly that “exhalation” is🔽and,🔽having understood correctly that “inhalation” is🔽,

original: so sor spong bar lta ba bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byas nas /
analyzed: so sor spong bar lta ba bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byas nas /
translated: you should view it as the individual liberation.

original: so sor spong bar lta ba bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽yang @170a * //
analyzed: so sor spong bar lta ba bzhin du dbugs rngub pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o // yang @170a * //
translated: The right view is the view that the exhalation of the breath is the abandonment of the five hindrances.

original: na sdug bsngal gyi phung po la 'jig pa'i chos can du lta ba ni mi rtag par lta ba'o //🔽kun 'byung la spang bar bya ba'i chos can du lta ba ni /
analyzed: na sdug bsngal gyi phung po la 'jig pa'i chos can du lta ba ni mi rtag par lta ba'o // kun 'byung la spang bar bya ba'i chos can du lta ba ni /
translated: The view that the mass of suffering is subject to destruction is the view of impermanence.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar lta ba'o //🔽'gog pa la mngon du bya ba'i chos can du lta ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar lta ba'o // 'gog pa la mngon du bya ba'i chos can du lta ba ni /
translated: The view that the origin of suffering is subject to abandonment is the view of the abandonment of desire.

original: 'gog par lta ba'o /🔽lam gyi bden pa ni nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'o zhes lta ba ni /
analyzed: 'gog par lta ba'o / lam gyi bden pa ni nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'o zhes lta ba ni /
translated: The view that cessation is subject to realization is the view of cessation.

original: so sor spong bar lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor spong bar lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The view that the truth of the path is the abandonment of the defilements is the view of the abandonment of the defilements.🔽The right view is the view that the inhalation of the breath is the abandonment of the five hindrances.

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba bcu drug bsgom pa bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba bcu drug bsgom pa bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the teaching on the sixteen aspects of the breath,

original: dge slong dag dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dran pa bcu drug go zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag dbugs 'byung ba dang rngub pa dran pa bcu drug go zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: the Buddha said: Monks, this is the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation in sixteen aspects.

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba bcu drug bstan pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba bcu drug bstan pa'i 'og tu /
translated: After teaching the sixteen aspects of the breath,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi bstan te /
translated: The four limbs of stream entry are taught.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: Desiring to explain them as they are taught,

original: de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: he says, “What are the four limbs of stream entry?”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so /
translated: and so on.

original: de la rgyun ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam la bya ste /
analyzed: de la rgyun ces bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam la bya ste /
translated: Here, “stream” refers to the noble path,

original: chu bo'i rgyun rgya mtshor 'jug pa bzhin du /
analyzed: chu bo'i rgyun rgya mtshor 'jug pa bzhin du /
translated: because like the flow of a river entering the ocean,

original: lam des kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pas na /
analyzed: lam des kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'jug pas na /
translated: that path also enters the city of nirvana.

original: lam ni rgyun to //🔽lam der zhugs pa'am /
analyzed: lam ni rgyun to // lam der zhugs pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the path is a stream.🔽One who has entered that path

original: lam de thob pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: lam de thob pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa ste /
translated: or has attained that path is a stream enterer.

original: lam gyi grogs su gyur pa'i chos bzhi la ni /
analyzed: lam gyi grogs su gyur pa'i chos bzhi la ni /
translated: The four dharmas that are aids to that path

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi zhes bya ste /
translated: are called the four limbs of stream entry.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi kun tu rig pa'i dad pa bzhi zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi kun tu rig pa'i dad pa bzhi zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: They are also called the four kinds of faith that are fully understood by the noble ones.

original: de la 'phags pa'i nyan thos bcom ldan 'das de yang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i nyan thos bcom ldan 'das de yang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Here, “the noble śrāvakas of the Bhagavān” and so on up to

original: sangs rgyas la rjes su shes nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la rjes su shes nas /
translated: “having understood the Buddha,

original: dad pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du ni /
translated: He has faith in the Buddha,🔽the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽He has faith in the training in the precepts of the noble ones,🔽and he has the view that is conducive to liberation.🔽He has the view that is conducive to liberation and is endowed with the view that accords with liberation.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag dang po'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag dang po'o //
translated: He has the view that accords with liberation and is endowed with the view that accords with the path.🔽He has the view that accords with the path and is endowed with the view that accords with the Dharma.🔽He has the view that accords with the Dharma and is endowed with the view that accords with the truth.🔽He has the view that accords with the truth and is endowed with the view that accords with reality.🔽He has the view that accords with reality and is endowed with the view that accords with the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dam pa'i chos legs par gsungs pa /🔽zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dam pa'i chos legs par gsungs pa / zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He has the view that accords with the Dharma and is endowed with the view that accords with the truth.🔽He has the view that accords with the truth and is endowed with the view that accords with reality.🔽He has the view that accords with reality and is endowed with the view that accords with the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos la dad pa dang ldan pa yin no //🔽zhes bya ba yan chad ni /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la dad pa dang ldan pa yin no // zhes bya ba yan chad ni /
translated: He has the view that accords with the Dharma and is endowed with the view that accords with the truth.🔽He has the view that accords with the truth and is endowed with the view that accords with reality.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag gnyis pa'o //
translated: He has the view that accords with reality and is endowed with the view that accords with the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dges 'dun zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dges 'dun zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He has the view that accords with the Dharma and is endowed with the view that accords with the truth.

original: skyes bu gang zag brgyad rnams so zhes bya ba yan chad yan lag gsum pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag brgyad rnams so zhes bya ba yan chad yan lag gsum pa'o //
translated: He has the view that accords with the truth and is endowed with the view that accords with reality.🔽He has the view that accords with reality and is endowed with the view that accords with the Dharma.🔽He has the view that accords with the Dharma and is endowed with the view that accords with the truth.🔽He has the view that accords with the truth and is endowed with the view that accords with reality.🔽He has the view that accords with reality and is endowed with the view that accords with the Dharma.🔽He has the view that accords with the Dharma and is endowed with the view that accords with the truth.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang dad pa phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang dad pa phun sum tshogs pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He has the view that accords with the truth and is endowed with the view that accords with reality.🔽He has the view that accords with reality and is endowed with the view that accords with the Dharma.

original: mkhas pa ma smad pa'i 'phags pa 'dod pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /🔽zhes bya ba yan chad yan lag bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa ma smad pa'i 'phags pa 'dod pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin te /🔽zhes bya ba yan chad yan lag bzhi pa'o //
translated: He has the view that accords with the Dharma and is endowed with the view that accords with the

original: 'phags pa nyan @170b thos zhes bya ba la 'dod chags spang ba dang / zhe sdang spang ba dang / gti mug spang ba la zhugs pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa la slob pa'i gang zag rnams dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan @170b thos zhes bya ba la 'dod chags spang ba dang / zhe sdang spang ba dang / gti mug spang ba la zhugs pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa la slob pa'i gang zag rnams dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang /
translated: The noble ones who are śrāvakas are the persons who are training in the stream-enterers and so forth, who are engaged in abandoning attachment, abandoning aversion, and abandoning delusion.

original: gti mug spang ba dang / dgra bcom pa ma slob pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gti mug spang ba dang / dgra bcom pa ma slob pa'i 'bras bu la gnas pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who have abandoned attachment, aversion, and delusion, and who abide in the result of the non-learner, the state of an arhat,

original: 'phags pa'i nyan thos te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nyan thos te /
translated: are the noble śrāvakas.

original: nyan thos kyi don ni bden pa mthong bar bya ba gzhan gyi lung dang man ngag mnyan pa la rag lus pas nyan thos so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi don ni bden pa mthong bar bya ba gzhan gyi lung dang man ngag mnyan pa la rag lus pas nyan thos so //
translated: The meaning of śrāvaka is one who relies on listening to the instructions and advice of others in order to see the truths, thus they are śrāvakas.

original: de dag chos bzhi la dad pa mi phyed pa skye'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag chos bzhi la dad pa mi phyed pa skye'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Faith in the four dharmas arises inseparably in them.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the first branch of the stream-enterers,

original: bcom ldan 'das de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, The Blessed One, that also... and so forth.

original: yan lag dang pos mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: yan lag dang pos mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief, by the first branch,

original: rnam pa drug bstan te bgegs bcom pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gang gis de thob pa dang / ji ltar gshegs pa dang / ston pa'i las dang / gang dag gis yongs su gzung ba bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa drug bstan te bgegs bcom pa dang / ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gang gis de thob pa dang / ji ltar gshegs pa dang / ston pa'i las dang / gang dag gis yongs su gzung ba bstan to //
translated: The six aspects are: the destruction of obstacles, the excellence of the teacher, the attainment of that, the manner of going, the activity of the teacher, and the demonstration of those who are guided.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bgegs bcom pa bstan te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni bgegs bcom pa bstan te /
translated: The Blessed One indicates the destruction of obstacles.

original: de la bgegs ni /
analyzed: de la bgegs ni /
translated: Here, obstacles are:

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i bar chad byed pa'i bdud sdig can dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dus na bdud sdig can dang / 'di'i 'khor du gtogs pa'i 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu 'khor dang bcas pa rnams bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par byed pa'i bar chad byed pa'i bdud sdig can dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa'i dus na bdud sdig can dang / 'di'i 'khor du gtogs pa'i 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu 'khor dang bcas pa rnams bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Mara, the evil one, who creates obstacles to attaining unsurpassed enlightenment, Mara, the evil one, at the time of perfect enlightenment, and the sons of the gods of the desire realm who belong to his retinue.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The phrase the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Fully Enlightened One indicates the excellence of the teacher.🔽The phrase who has gone to bliss indicates the attainment of that.

original: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase the Sugata indicates the manner of going.

original: de yang ji lta ba bzhin du smra ba dang / yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de yang ji lta ba bzhin du smra ba dang / yang dag par bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: The first is the one who speaks as it is, and the second is the one who accomplishes it.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //🔽de la de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya bas /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis ston pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to // de la de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya bas /
translated: These two show the excellence of the teacher.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du smras pa bstan te /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du smras pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the Tathāgata” shows the one who speaks as it is.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ma nor ba'o //🔽gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'am /🔽smra ba 'am /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ma nor ba'o // gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni ston pa'am / smra ba 'am /
translated: The word “tathā” means “unerringly.”

original: gsung ba ste /
analyzed: gsung ba ste /
translated: The word “gata” means “to teach,” “to speak,” or “to proclaim.”

original: dngos po rnams kyi don 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du gsung zhing 'chad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi don 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du gsung zhing 'chad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata is so called because he teaches and proclaims the meaning of things, the four noble truths, just as they are.

original: yang dag par sgrub par byed pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽spong ba phun sum tshogs pa sgrub pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub par byed pa yang rnam pa gnyis te / spong ba phun sum tshogs pa sgrub pa dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs par sgrub pa'o //
translated: The one who accomplishes it is also of two kinds:

original: de la dgra @171a * //
analyzed: de la dgra @171a * //
translated: the one who accomplishes the excellence of abandonment and the one who accomplishes the excellence of knowledge.

original: bcom pa zhes bya bas spong ba phun sum tshogs pa sgrub pa bstan te /
analyzed: bcom pa zhes bya bas spong ba phun sum tshogs pa sgrub pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “the Arhat” shows the one who accomplishes the excellence of abandonment.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams spangs pas na dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos rnams spangs pas na dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: He is an arhat because he has abandoned the afflictions such as desire, and the phenomena that are to be abandoned by means of the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa sgrub pa bstan te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bas ye shes phun sum tshogs pa sgrub pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “perfectly enlightened one” indicates the perfection of his knowledge.

original: yang dag par ni ma nor bar ram phyin ci ma log par ro //
analyzed: yang dag par ni ma nor bar ram phyin ci ma log par ro //
translated: “Perfectly” means without error or distortion.

original: rdzogs par ni ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par ni ma lus pa'o //
translated: “Enlightened” means completely.

original: sangs rgyas ni mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni mkhyen pa ste /
translated: “Buddha” means knowledge.

original: yang dag par sangs rgyas pa dang / rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang dag par sangs rgyas pa dang / rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes sbyar ro //
translated: “Perfectly enlightened” and “fully enlightened” are synonyms.

original: don du bsdu na ji snyed mkhyen par bya ba'i yul /🔽phung po dang khams la sogs pa ma lus par mkhyen cing /
analyzed: don du bsdu na ji snyed mkhyen par bya ba'i yul / phung po dang khams la sogs pa ma lus par mkhyen cing /
translated: In summary, he is perfectly enlightened because he knows the entire range of objects of knowledge,

original: de yang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med par phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med par phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: such as the aggregates and elements, and he is fully enlightened because he knows them without error as impermanent, painful, empty, and selfless.

original: yang na rnam pa gsum gyis ston pa phun sum tshogs par ston te /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gsum gyis ston pa phun sum tshogs par ston te /
translated: Alternatively, the three expressions indicate the excellence of the teacher.

original: rnam pa gsum ni phyin ci ma log par smra ba dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / shes bya brjod par bya ba ji snyed yod pa thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ni phyin ci ma log par smra ba dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / shes bya brjod par bya ba ji snyed yod pa thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: The three expressions are: he speaks without error, he is free of afflictions, and he has realized all that can be known.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya bas phyin ci ma log par smra ba bstan te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya bas phyin ci ma log par smra ba bstan te /
translated: The expression “tathāgata” indicates that he speaks without error.

original: shes bya'i dngos po ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya'i dngos po ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du gsungs pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is a tathāgata because he speaks in accordance with the way things are.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya bas nyon mongs pa med pa bstan te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya bas nyon mongs pa med pa bstan te /
translated: The expression “arhat” indicates that he is free of afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dgra lta bur gyur pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dgra lta bur gyur pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: He is an arhat because he has abandoned the afflictions and secondary afflictions that are like enemies.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bas /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bas /
translated: The expression “perfectly enlightened one” indicates that

original: shes bya brjod par bya ba ji snyed yod pa thugs su chud pa bstan te /
analyzed: shes bya brjod par bya ba ji snyed yod pa thugs su chud pa bstan te /
translated: he has realized all that can be known.

original: ji snyed du shes par bya ba yod pa'i dngos po thams cad ma lus pa dang / phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji snyed du shes par bya ba yod pa'i dngos po thams cad ma lus pa dang / phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has comprehended all things without exception that exist as objects of knowledge, and he has comprehended them without error.

original: rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa zhes bya bas gang gis gshegs pa bstan te /
analyzed: rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa zhes bya bas gang gis gshegs pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase “endowed with knowledge and feet” indicates by what he went.

original: don du yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su gshegs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don du yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su gshegs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he went to the state of nirvana by means of the eightfold noble path, which consists of the noble path of right view and the rest.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la yang dag pa'i lta ba la rig pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la yang dag pa'i lta ba la rig pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Right view is called “knowledge” among the eight members of the noble path.

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag pa @171b ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag pa @171b ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the knowledge of the four noble truths just as they are.

original: yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa yan lag lhag ma bdun rnams la ni rkang pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rtog pa la sogs pa yan lag lhag ma bdun rnams la ni rkang pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The remaining seven members, beginning with right thought, are called “feet.”

original: don du na 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su song ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don du na 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su song ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In fact, the meaning is that one goes to the state of nirvana by means of the eightfold noble path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad las yang dag pa'i lta ba ni rig par bshad la /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad las yang dag pa'i lta ba ni rig par bshad la /
translated: From among the eight members of the noble path, right view is explained as knowledge.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams ci'i phyir rkang par bshad ce na /🔽dper na mig med de ma mthong ba dang / rkang pa med de 'gro ma nus pas gang yang mi phyin gyi mig gis mthong la rkang pa yod na /
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams ci'i phyir rkang par bshad ce na / dper na mig med de ma mthong ba dang / rkang pa med de 'gro ma nus pas gang yang mi phyin gyi mig gis mthong la rkang pa yod na /
translated: Why are the remaining members explained as feet?🔽For example, one does not go anywhere without eyes, because one does not see, and without feet, because one cannot walk.

original: gdod 'gro nus pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gdod 'gro nus pa bzhin du /
translated: But when one has eyes and feet,🔽one can go.

original: yang dag pa'i lta bas bden pa bzhi mthong la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta bas bden pa bzhi mthong la /
translated: Similarly, one sees the four truths with right view.

original: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin du /
translated: And when one practices in accordance with what one sees

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams kyis bsgrubs na /
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams kyis bsgrubs na /
translated: with the remaining members,

original: gdod mya ngan las 'das par phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdod mya ngan las 'das par phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one goes to nirvana.

original: yang na bslab pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na bslab pa gsum ste /
translated: Or, they are the three trainings.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'o //
translated: the training in the higher wisdom.

original: de la lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la ni /
analyzed: de la lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la ni /
translated: In this regard, the training in the higher wisdom

original: rig pa zhes bya'o //🔽lhag pa'i sems kyi dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la ni /
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya'o // lhag pa'i sems kyi dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la ni /
translated: is called the “knowledge” .

original: rkang pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rkang pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The training in the higher thought and the training in the higher virtue are called the “feet” .

original: de ltar bslab pa gsum gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du song ngo zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽brgal ba dang / gsung rab gzhan las ni tshul khrims la brten nas /
analyzed: de ltar bslab pa gsum gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du song ngo zhes bstan pa yin no // brgal ba dang / gsung rab gzhan las ni tshul khrims la brten nas /
translated: Thus, it is taught that one goes to the city of nirvana by means of the three trainings.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'grub /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'grub /
translated: But in other scriptures, it is said that concentration is achieved on the basis of virtue,

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten nas shes rab 'grub ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten nas shes rab 'grub ste /
translated: and wisdom is achieved on the basis of concentration.

original: de bas na tshul khrims dang por smos /
analyzed: de bas na tshul khrims dang por smos /
translated: Therefore, virtue is mentioned first,

original: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin /
translated: then concentration,

original: de'i 'og tu shes rab brten na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu shes rab brten na /
translated: and then wisdom.

original: 'dir ci'i phyir shes rab dang por smos /
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir shes rab dang por smos /
translated: So why is wisdom mentioned first here?

original: smras pa / shes rab kyis yongs su zin na ni /
analyzed: smras pa / shes rab kyis yongs su zin na ni /
translated: It is said: When wisdom is present,

original: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Morality and concentration are purified by wisdom.

original: shes rab med pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dag par mi 'gyur pas shes rab sngar smos so//
analyzed: shes rab med pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dag par mi 'gyur pas shes rab sngar smos so//
translated: Morality and concentration are not purified without wisdom.

original: dper na mig gis bltas nas rkang pas 'gro ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na mig gis bltas nas rkang pas 'gro ba bzhin du /
translated: For example, after seeing with the eye, one goes with the foot.

original: shes rab mig dang 'dra bas brtags nas /
analyzed: shes rab mig dang 'dra bas brtags nas /
translated: In the same way, after investigating with the eye of wisdom,

original: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin rkang pa lta bur gyur pas 'gro bar byed pas na /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin rkang pa lta bur gyur pas 'gro bar byed pas na /
translated: one goes with the foot of morality and concentration.

original: bslab pa gsum la rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa zhes bya'o //🔽yang na mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum @172a * //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum la rig pa dang rkang par ldan pa zhes bya'o // yang na mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum @172a * //
translated: Therefore, the three trainings are called “endowed with knowledge and feet.”

original: la rig pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: la rig pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or, the three knowledges of the nonlearner are called “knowledge.”

original: rig pa gsum ni sngon gyi gnas shes pa'i rig pa zhes bya ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba shes pa'i rig pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'i rig pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa gsum ni sngon gyi gnas shes pa'i rig pa zhes bya ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba shes pa'i rig pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa'i rig pa'o //
translated: The three knowledges are called “knowledge of the former lives,” “knowledge of the passing away and rebirth of beings,” and “knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.”

original: zhabs ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / mngon par shes pa dang lhag ma rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: zhabs ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang / mngon par shes pa dang lhag ma rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The feet are the three kinds of morality, concentration, and superknowledge.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa dang / 'phrul gyi mig dang / 'phrul gyi rna ba ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa dang / 'phrul gyi mig dang / 'phrul gyi rna ba ste /
translated: The knowledge of the categories of mind, the divine eye, and the divine ear.

original: chos lnga la zhabs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos lnga la zhabs zhes bya'o //
translated: These five are called “feet.”

original: de ltar rig pa gsum la sogs pa ston pa phun sum tshogs pa brnyes so //🔽zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rig pa gsum la sogs pa ston pa phun sum tshogs pa brnyes so // zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he has attained the perfect teaching of the three knowledges and so forth.

original: 'di yang chad du bcom ldan 'das bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang rgyu dang bcas pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang chad du bcom ldan 'das bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa dang rgyu dang bcas pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: This also shows the perfection of the Bhagavān’s own aim and its cause.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya bas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: From “Bhagavān” up to “perfect Buddha” shows the perfection of his own aim.

original: rig pa dang rkang par ldan pas de'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: rig pa dang rkang par ldan pas de'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: “Endowed with knowledge and conduct” shows its cause.

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya bas ji ltar shes pa bstan te /🔽de la rims nad shin tu byang ba slar mi ldog pa bzhin du /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya bas ji ltar shes pa bstan te / de la rims nad shin tu byang ba slar mi ldog pa bzhin du /
translated: “Sugata” shows how he knows.🔽There, he is called “Sugata” because he has gone well, without returning to saṃsāra,

original: slar 'khor bar ldog pa med par shin tu gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: slar 'khor bar ldog pa med par shin tu gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa'o //
translated: like someone with a severe fever who is completely cured and does not get it again.

original: yang na mar gyis gang ba'i bum pa bzhin du shes bya ji snyed thugs su chud la /
analyzed: yang na mar gyis gang ba'i bum pa bzhin du shes bya ji snyed thugs su chud la /
translated: Or else, like a vase filled with butter, he has completely penetrated all objects of knowledge,

original: sgrib pa ji snyed spang bar bya ba kun ma lus par spangs te /
analyzed: sgrib pa ji snyed spang bar bya ba kun ma lus par spangs te /
translated: and he has completely abandoned all the obscurations that are to be abandoned.

original: ji srid du phyin par bya ba legs par gshegs pas na /
analyzed: ji srid du phyin par bya ba legs par gshegs pas na /
translated: And he has gone to the end of what is to be gone to.

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya'o //🔽bshad pa gnyis kyi mdor na /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya'o // bshad pa gnyis kyi mdor na /
translated: Thus he is called the “Well-Gone One.”

original: bcom ldan 'das phyi rol pa'i don dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / de las gzhan dgra bcom pa rnams las khyad par du gyur par ston to //🔽de la rims nad byang ba bzhin du slar mi ldog par gshegs pas ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyi rol pa'i don dang 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams dang / de las gzhan dgra bcom pa rnams las khyad par du gyur par ston to // de la rims nad byang ba bzhin du slar mi ldog par gshegs pas ni /
translated: In brief, these two explanations show that the Lord is superior to non-Buddhist ascetics, to those who are free from passion, and to other Arhats.

original: phyi rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams las khyad zhugs par ston te /
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams las khyad zhugs par ston te /
translated: He is superior to non-Buddhist ascetics who are free from passion because he has gone to the end of the path without returning, like one who has been cured of an infectious disease.

original: mu stegs la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams 'dod chags dang thang cig bral yang slar khams gsum du ldog pas mi ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams 'dod chags dang thang cig bral yang slar khams gsum du ldog pas mi ldog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For although non-Buddhist ascetics such as the Sāṃkhyas are free from passion, they return to the three realms of existence, and so are not cured.

original: bum pa gang ba bzhin du legs par gshegs pas dgra bcom pa las khyad par du gyur par ston te /
analyzed: bum pa gang ba bzhin du legs par gshegs pas dgra bcom pa las khyad par du gyur par ston te /
translated: He is called a well-gone one because he has gone well, like a filled vase, and he is distinguished from the arhats.

original: dgra bcom pa la sogs pa phyir mi ldog pa yin yang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la sogs pa phyir mi ldog pa yin yang /
translated: Even though the arhats and so on are irreversible,

original: shes @172b bya thams cad ma rtogs shing /
analyzed: shes @172b bya thams cad ma rtogs shing /
translated: they have not realized all that is to be known,

original: bag chags kun kyang ma lus par ma spangs pas legs par gshegs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags kun kyang ma lus par ma spangs pas legs par gshegs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and they have not abandoned all the propensities to the afflictions, so they have not gone well.

original: 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston pa'i las bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston pa'i las bstan te /
translated: The verse beginning with “knowing the world” teaches the Teacher’s activity.

original: ston pa'i las kyang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: ston pa'i las kyang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The Teacher’s activity is also twofold.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni skal ba yod pa dang / skal ba med pa'i 'jig rten las gzigs pa dang / 'dul bar bya ba la 'dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni skal ba yod pa dang / skal ba med pa'i 'jig rten las gzigs pa dang / 'dul bar bya ba la 'dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: The two aspects are seeing the world with its fortunate and unfortunate realms and taming those to be tamed.

original: 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya bas /
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya bas /
translated: “Knowing the world”

original: skal ba yod pa dang skal ba med pa'i 'jig rten las gzigs pa bstan te /
analyzed: skal ba yod pa dang skal ba med pa'i 'jig rten las gzigs pa bstan te /
translated: teaches seeing the world with its fortunate and unfortunate realms.

original: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum snying rje chen po dang ye shes kyi 'jig rten rnams la brtags nas /
analyzed: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum snying rje chen po dang ye shes kyi 'jig rten rnams la brtags nas /
translated: Having examined the worlds with his great compassion and gnosis three times during the day and three times during the night,

original: sems can 'di ni grol ba'i skal ba yod pa /
analyzed: sems can 'di ni grol ba'i skal ba yod pa /
translated: This sentient being has the fortune to be liberated.🔽

original: 'di ni grol ba'i skal ba med pa'o zhes mkhyen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni grol ba'i skal ba med pa'o zhes mkhyen pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he knows that this sentient being has the fortune to be liberated

original: 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and that one does not, he is called the knower of the world.

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: He is the unsurpassed

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /🔽zhes bya bas /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba / zhes bya bas /
translated: tamer of human beings to be tamed.

original: skal ba yod par 'dul bar byed pa bstan to //
analyzed: skal ba yod par 'dul bar byed pa bstan to //
translated: This shows that he tames those who have the fortune to be tamed.

original: de ltar mkhyen nas sems can skal pa yod pa rnams 'phags pa'i lam la bkod de /
analyzed: de ltar mkhyen nas sems can skal pa yod pa rnams 'phags pa'i lam la bkod de /
translated: Having known that, he sets those sentient beings who have the fortune to be tamed on the ārya path

original: 'dul bar byed pas na /
analyzed: 'dul bar byed pas na /
translated: and tames them.

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'o //🔽de la 'dul bar 'os pa'am /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'o // de la 'dul bar 'os pa'am /
translated: Thus he is the tamer of human beings.

original: 'dul bar nus pa ni gdul ba'o //
analyzed: 'dul bar nus pa ni gdul ba'o //
translated: Those who are worthy of being tamed or who can be tamed are those to be tamed.

original: kha lo sgyur ba dang 'dra bas kha lo sgyur ba ste /
analyzed: kha lo sgyur ba dang 'dra bas kha lo sgyur ba ste /
translated: He is like a charioteer, so he is a charioteer.

original: dper na rta 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: dper na rta 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: For example, a charioteer who trains horses

original: rta'i g-yo skyon rnams med par byas nas btul te /
analyzed: rta'i g-yo skyon rnams med par byas nas btul te /
translated: removes the faults of the horses’ behavior, trains them,

original: lam bde ba la 'dzud par byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: lam bde ba la 'dzud par byed pa bzhin du /
translated: and makes them go on a pleasant path.

original: 'dis kyang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa btul nas /
analyzed: 'dis kyang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa btul nas /
translated: In the same way, this one tames the afflictions of sentient beings🔽and makes them go on the path to liberation.

original: yang dag pa'i lam la bkod pas kha lo sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam la bkod pas kha lo sgyur ba'o //
translated: He is the one who guides, because he establishes them in the true path.

original: de la yang gdul dka' ba lteng rgyas 'od srungs la sogs pa dang / dga' bo dang sor phreng la sogs pa gti mug dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi shas che ste /
analyzed: de la yang gdul dka' ba lteng rgyas 'od srungs la sogs pa dang / dga' bo dang sor phreng la sogs pa gti mug dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi shas che ste /
translated: Among them, Uruvilva-Kasyapa and others were difficult to convert, and Nanda and Angulimala and others were dominated by delusion, desire, and hatred, respectively.

original: gdul dka' ba rnams btul nas gnas kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das par 'jog par byed pas na /
analyzed: gdul dka' ba rnams btul nas gnas kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das par 'jog par byed pas na /
translated: Having converted those who were difficult to convert, he established them in the supreme abode, nirvana.

original: bla na med pa skyes bu 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa skyes bu 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is the unsurpassed trainer of those to be trained.

original: de la lteng rgyas 'od srungs la sogs pa ni gti mug gi shas che ba'o //
analyzed: de la lteng rgyas 'od srungs la sogs pa ni gti mug gi shas che ba'o //
translated: Among them, Uruvilva-Kasyapa and others were dominated by delusion.

original: dga' bo ni 'dod chags kyi shas che ba'o //
analyzed: dga' bo ni 'dod chags kyi shas che ba'o //
translated: Nanda was dominated by desire.

original: sor phreng ni zhe sdang gi shas che ba'o //
analyzed: sor phreng ni zhe sdang gi shas che ba'o //
translated: Angulimala was dominated by hatred.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba gang gis yongs su gzung ba bstan te /🔽de @173a * //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba gang gis yongs su gzung ba bstan te / de @173a * //
translated: The phrase teacher of gods and humans indicates who upholds it.

original: bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa gang gis yongs su gzung zhe na /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa gang gis yongs su gzung zhe na /
translated: Who upholds the teaching of the Tathagata?

original: lha dang mis gzung ste /
analyzed: lha dang mis gzung ste /
translated: It is upheld by gods and humans.

original: byol song la sogs pa yang chos 'chad pa'i sgra thos pas mtho ris la sogs par 'jog mod kyi /
analyzed: byol song la sogs pa yang chos 'chad pa'i sgra thos pas mtho ris la sogs par 'jog mod kyi /
translated: Also, animals and so on are placed in higher rebirths and so forth by hearing the sound of the Dharma.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa khong du chud pa dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob pa'i snod du ni lha dang mi rnams gyur pas na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa khong du chud pa dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob pa'i snod du ni lha dang mi rnams gyur pas na /
translated: However, gods and humans are vessels for comprehending the four noble truths and for obtaining the results of virtue.

original: de'i phyir lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the teacher of gods and humans.

original: gong du bshad pa'i yon tan de dag dang ldan pa de dngos su su zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i yon tan de dag dang ldan pa de dngos su su zhig yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “Who is the one who possesses the qualities explained above?”

original: de'i phyir / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so zhes bya bar gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so zhes bya bar gsungs te /
translated: The response is, “The Bhagavān Buddha.”

original: gong du de yang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dir sbyar la /
analyzed: gong du de yang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dir sbyar la /
translated: The word “also” above is applied here.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa la sogs pa'i yon tan smos pa de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽de la ma rig pa'i gnyid las sad cing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa la sogs pa'i yon tan smos pa de yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // de la ma rig pa'i gnyid las sad cing /
translated: The Bhagavān, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, and so on, who possesses the qualities mentioned above is also the Bhagavān Buddha.🔽He is a Buddha because he is awakened from the sleep of ignorance

original: shes bya thams cad thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas so //
translated: and he has realized all objects of knowledge.

original: yon tan drug dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan drug dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he possesses six qualities,

original: bcom ldan 'das te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das te /
translated: he is the Bhagavan.

original: yon tan drug ni ji skad du /
analyzed: yon tan drug ni ji skad du /
translated: The six qualities are as follows:

original: phyug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / grags pa dang / dpal dang ye shes dang ni 'bad pa ste /
analyzed: phyug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / grags pa dang / dpal dang ye shes dang ni 'bad pa ste /
translated: Wealth, excellent form, fame, glory, pristine wisdom, and effort.

original: drug po rnams la ldan zhes bshad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: drug po rnams la ldan zhes bshad ces gsungs so //
translated: It is explained that he possesses these six.

original: sangs rgyas su shes nas dad pa dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su shes nas dad pa dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is endowed with faith that arises from knowing that the Buddha possesses the qualities of a Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gong du bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan par shes nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gong du bshad pa'i yon tan dang ldan par shes nas /
translated: Having known that the Tathagata possesses the qualities explained above,

original: de bzhin du de la dang ba dang yid ches pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du de la dang ba dang yid ches pa dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: he is endowed with faith and confidence in him.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the second branch of stream entry,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dam pa'i chos legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dam pa'i chos legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Bhagavan said, “The Bhagavan has well-proclaimed the holy Dharma.”

original: dam pa rnams kyis gsungs pa'i chos ni dam pa'i chos te /
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyis gsungs pa'i chos ni dam pa'i chos te /
translated: The Dharma that is proclaimed by holy beings is the holy Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it was taught by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i mtha' dang bde ba la kun tu chags pa'i mtha' spangs pa mtha' gnyis dang bral ba ston pa dang / mi slu ba dang / mi 'khrul ba dang / thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar dge ba'i chos sha stag gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i mtha' dang bde ba la kun tu chags pa'i mtha' spangs pa mtha' gnyis dang bral ba ston pa dang / mi slu ba dang / mi 'khrul ba dang / thog ma dang / bar dang / tha mar dge ba'i chos sha stag gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It teaches the middle way that is free from the two extremes, the extreme of the suffering of samsara and the extreme of the addiction to pleasure. It is non-deceptive, non-erroneous, and is only virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos legs par gsungs @173b pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos legs par gsungs @173b pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One is said to have well-spoken Dharma.

original: yang na rnam pa bcus na /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa bcus na /
translated: Or, in ten ways:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The Blessed One is said to have well-spoken Dharma.

original: rnam pa bzhi ni yang dag pas bskyed pa dang / dbang du byas pa dang / rab tu 'jug pa dang / rab tu bsgrags pa dang / rab tu phye ba dang / brten pa dang / rnam par rig pa dang / rab tu btags pa dang /🔽dus dang yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi ni yang dag pas bskyed pa dang / dbang du byas pa dang / rab tu 'jug pa dang / rab tu bsgrags pa dang / rab tu phye ba dang / brten pa dang / rnam par rig pa dang / rab tu btags pa dang /🔽dus dang yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The four aspects are: well-proclaimed, well-transmitted, well-practiced, well-attained, well-purified, well-manifested, well-realized, well-awakened, well-taught, and well-mastered.

original: de la yang dag pas bskyed pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad ma lus par spangs nas /
analyzed: de la yang dag pas bskyed pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad ma lus par spangs nas /
translated: It is generated by the perfect buddhas because it is taught after they have completely abandoned all afflictions

original: shes bya mtha' dag thugs su chud de /🔽mngon par byang chub nas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya mtha' dag thugs su chud de / mngon par byang chub nas bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and have realized all objects of knowledge.

original: dbang du byas pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don du mdzad nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang du byas pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don du mdzad nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is taught for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: rab tu 'jug pa ni bar 'ga' bar 'ga' tsam bshad pa ma yin gyi /🔽rgyun ma chad par bshad pa'i phyir ro //🔽rab tu bsgrags pa ni kha cig mi 'chad pa dang / kha cig la 'chad kha cig la mi 'chad pa lta bu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa ni bar 'ga' bar 'ga' tsam bshad pa ma yin gyi / rgyun ma chad par bshad pa'i phyir ro // rab tu bsgrags pa ni kha cig mi 'chad pa dang / kha cig la 'chad kha cig la mi 'chad pa lta bu ma yin gyi /
translated: It is taught continuously, not just here and there.

original: slob dpon 'chab pa med par kun la 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob dpon 'chab pa med par kun la 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is taught by the master without concealment, not concealing it from some and teaching it to others.

original: rab tu phye ba ni sems can so so'i bsam pa dang sbyar nas /
analyzed: rab tu phye ba ni sems can so so'i bsam pa dang sbyar nas /
translated: It is taught in accordance with the individual dispositions of sentient beings,

original: de dang mthun mthun du chos ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dang mthun mthun du chos ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: teaching the Dharma in accordance with their inclinations.

original: 'dod chags can la mi gtsang ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags can la mi gtsang ba /
translated: For example, the impure is taught to the desirous,

original: zhe sdang can la byams pa ston pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang can la byams pa ston pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: loving kindness to the hateful, and so on.

original: brten pa ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i gsung la yang dag par brten nas 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brten pa ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i gsung la yang dag par brten nas 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is based on speech endowed with five limbs, because it is taught in dependence on that.

original: rnam par rig pa ni gsung gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med par go zhing rig par mdzad pa dang / nye ring med par 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ji snyed rnams la shes shing rnam par rig par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa ni gsung gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med par go zhing rig par mdzad pa dang / nye ring med par 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ji snyed rnams la shes shing rnam par rig par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is cognized, because one voice is cognized and understood in immeasurable world systems, and because it is cognized and understood in all the circles of the retinue without distinction of near and far.

original: btags pa ni mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i lam ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: btags pa ni mtha' gnyis dang bral ba'i lam ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is designated, because it teaches the path free from the two extremes.

original: mtha' gnyis ni mu stegs kyi dka' thub pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi mtha' dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la zhen pa la sogs pa bde ba'i mtha' la zhen pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis ni mu stegs kyi dka' thub pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi mtha' dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la zhen pa la sogs pa bde ba'i mtha' la zhen pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The two extremes are the extreme of suffering, such as the austerities of the tīrthikas, and the extreme of pleasure, such as attachment to sensual desire.

original: dus ni yongs su smin pa'i 'bul ba rnams kyi dus dang sbyar nas ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus ni yongs su smin pa'i 'bul ba rnams kyi dus dang sbyar nas ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is timely, because it is taught in accordance with the time of those who are ready.

original: yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni chos 'chad pa'i gsung yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i gsung gis 'chad par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni chos 'chad pa'i gsung yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa'i gsung gis 'chad par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: 2. It is the upholder of good qualities, because it teaches with a voice endowed with sixty aspects.

original: lta ba'i chos la 'byung ba zhes @174a * //🔽bya ba ni /
analyzed: lta ba'i chos la 'byung ba zhes @174a * // bya ba ni /
translated: 3. It is the source of the Dharma of vision,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi chos 'di mngon sum du bya ba'i don yin te /🔽tshad mas thog tu bab pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab kyi chos 'di mngon sum du bya ba'i don yin te / tshad mas thog tu bab pa yin gyi /
translated: because it is the direct cause of the Dharma of the Tathagata's scriptures.🔽It is the Dharma of vision because it is the direct cause of the Dharma of the Tathagata's scriptures.

original: mu stegs kyi chos bzhin du rung yang rung ma rung yang ma rung dad pa tsam gyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas lta ba'i chos la 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs kyi chos bzhin du rung yang rung ma rung yang ma rung dad pa tsam gyis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pas lta ba'i chos la 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is not to be accepted merely out of faith, like the scriptures of the heterodox, whether they are good or bad.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bag chags de spang ba'i gnyen por gyur pas na nad med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bag chags de spang ba'i gnyen por gyur pas na nad med pa'o //
translated: 4. It is the absence of disease, because it is the antidote for the elimination of the instincts of the afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: spangs nas nyams pa'i dus med pa ste /
analyzed: spangs nas nyams pa'i dus med pa ste /
translated: 5. It is the absence of relapse, because it is the elimination that is not subject to relapse.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pas ni dus phyis ji srid cig lon nas nyams par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pas ni dus phyis ji srid cig lon nas nyams par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The elimination of the afflictions by the mundane path is subject to relapse after some time.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pas ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi nyon mongs pa spangs pas ni /
translated: But the afflictions are abandoned by the supramundane path.

original: lan cig spangs nas phyis nams kyang nyams pa'i dus med pa'i phyir dus med pa'o //
analyzed: lan cig spangs nas phyis nams kyang nyams pa'i dus med pa'i phyir dus med pa'o //
translated: The transcendent path is timeless because it is impossible for the afflictions to recur once they have been eliminated.

original: yang na yang dag pa'i sbyor ba la zhugs pa rnams dus ring po mi thogs par khyad par myur du thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir dus med pa ste /
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa'i sbyor ba la zhugs pa rnams dus ring po mi thogs par khyad par myur du thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir dus med pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is timeless because those who engage in authentic spiritual practice will swiftly attain distinctive states of realization without delay.🔽For this reason, other sutras state:

original: de'i phyir mdo gzhan dag las dge slong dag tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo gzhan dag las dge slong dag tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la sbyor ba ni /
translated: Monks, those who apply themselves to keeping the mind properly focused

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa skyes pa mi skye /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa skyes pa mi skye /
translated: will not give rise to the defilements of desire that have not yet arisen.

original: skyes pa rnams myur du spong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams myur du spong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Those that have arisen will be quickly eliminated.

original: nye bar 'dren pa zhes bya ba la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ma lus pa las 'byung ba 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: nye bar 'dren pa zhes bya ba la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ma lus pa las 'byung ba 'thob pa'am /
translated: The term “conducive” means that one attains freedom from the entirety of samsara’s sufferings or

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par byed cing gnas der 'dren par byed pas na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par byed cing gnas der 'dren par byed pas na /
translated: attains nirvana, and that one is led to that state.

original: nye bar 'dren pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar 'dren pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is conducive.

original: de la goms par byas nas rim gyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las thar nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de la goms par byas nas rim gyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las thar nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas su phyin par byed pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Having become accustomed to that, one gradually attains liberation from the sufferings of cyclic existence and reaches the state of nirvana.

original: 'di la mthong zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la mthong zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, “seeing” means

original: chos 'di lta bu 'di las phyi rol du gyur pa mu stegs pa la sogs pa la med de /
analyzed: chos 'di lta bu 'di las phyi rol du gyur pa mu stegs pa la sogs pa la med de /
translated: that this kind of Dharma does not exist for non-Buddhists such as tīrthikas.

original: gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pas na /
analyzed: gzhan dang thun mong ma yin pas na /
translated: Since it is not shared with others,

original: 'di las mthong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di las mthong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: it is called “seeing.”

original: chos de lta bu ni sangs rgyas pa'i chos 'di 'ba' zhig la yod par mthong gi / mu stegs la sogs pa'i lta ba gzhan la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de lta bu ni sangs rgyas pa'i chos 'di 'ba' zhig la yod par mthong gi / mu stegs la sogs pa'i lta ba gzhan la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such a Dharma is seen to exist only in this Buddhist teaching and does not exist in other views such as those of tīrthikas.

original: mkhas pa rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba ni chos de rtog ge pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mkhas pa rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba ni chos de rtog ge pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin zhing /
translated: “The wise know it for themselves” means that this Dharma is not the domain of logicians

original: rtog ge pa rnams kyis rtogs par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rtog ge pa rnams kyis rtogs par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: and is not realized by logicians.

original: mkhas pa rnams nang gi rang nyid kyi ye shes kyis mthong zhing shes par 'gyur ba yin pas na @174b mkhas pa rang gis rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams nang gi rang nyid kyi ye shes kyis mthong zhing shes par 'gyur ba yin pas na @174b mkhas pa rang gis rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the wise ones see and know through their own inner wisdom, it is called “the wise one’s self-knowledge.”

original: yon tan gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach other good qualities,

original: rgyags pa med par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rigs mtho ba dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / nad med pa dang / tshe ring ba la chags shing snyems pa sel bar byed pas na ;
analyzed: rgyags pa med par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rigs mtho ba dang / gzugs bzang ba dang / nad med pa dang / tshe ring ba la chags shing snyems pa sel bar byed pas na ;
translated: it is said, “It makes one free from conceit,” and so forth.

original: rgyags pa med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyags pa med par byed pa'o //
translated: It is “free from conceit” because it eliminates attachment to and pride in high birth, a good body, good health, and long life.

original: 'dod pa med par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa med par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is “free from desire” because it eliminates attachment to the qualities of desire.

original: gnas kun 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi phung po lnga 'dor ba'i thabs su gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas kun 'joms pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang nyon mongs pa'i rten gyi phung po lnga 'dor ba'i thabs su gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is “the destroyer of all abodes” because it is the method for abandoning the five aggregates, which are the basis of suffering and the afflictions.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ba kun spong bar byed pas na gnas kun 'joms par byed pa'o //🔽lam rgyud lngar skye ba'am /🔽tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad par skye ba'i tshe'i rgyun gcod par byed pas na /
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ba kun spong bar byed pas na gnas kun 'joms par byed pa'o // lam rgyud lngar skye ba'am / tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu rgyun mi 'chad par skye ba'i tshe'i rgyun gcod par byed pas na /
translated: Or else, it is the destroyer of all the bases because it eliminates the latent states of the afflictions.

original: lam gcod pa'o //
analyzed: lam gcod pa'o //
translated: The path is the severer of the continuum because it severs the continuum of lives that is uninterrupted from one life to another in the five realms of rebirth.

original: bdag gi dngos po med par ston pas na stong pa nyid do /
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po med par ston pas na stong pa nyid do /
translated: It is emptiness because it teaches the non-existence of a self.

original: bdag ces bya ba yang mi 'grub par ston pas na mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba yang mi 'grub par ston pas na mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the non-apprehension of a self because it teaches the non-establishment of a self.

original: tshe rabs gzhan gyi lus dang longs spyod la chags pa spong ba'i rgyur gyur bas na srid pa zad pa'o //🔽tshe 'di'i lus dang longs spyod la chags pa yang spong bar byed pas na /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan gyi lus dang longs spyod la chags pa spong ba'i rgyur gyur bas na srid pa zad pa'o // tshe 'di'i lus dang longs spyod la chags pa yang spong bar byed pas na /
translated: It is the exhaustion of existence because it is the cause for the abandonment of attachment to the body and enjoyments in other lives.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is freedom from attachment because it also causes the abandonment of attachment to the body and enjoyments in this life.

original: nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal gyi phung po thams cad spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i lam yin pas na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal gyi phung po thams cad spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i lam yin pas na /
translated: It is the path to the attainment of nirvana, which is the abandonment of all the aggregates of afflictions and suffering.

original: 'gog pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called cessation and nirvāṇa.

original: yang na chos rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na chos rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Or else, there are three kinds of Dharma:

original: bshad pa'i chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / 'bras bu'i chos so //🔽de la dam pa'i chos legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / 'bras bu'i chos so // de la dam pa'i chos legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the Dharma of teaching, the Dharma of practice, and the Dharma of result.

original: mkhas pa rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bshad pa'i chos kyi yon tan bstan to //🔽'di ltar rgyags pa med par byed pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mkhas pa rang gis rig pa zhes bya ba yan chad kyis bshad pa'i chos kyi yon tan bstan to // 'di ltar rgyags pa med par byed pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Among them, the qualities of the Dharma of teaching are shown by the passage from “The holy Dharma is well-spoken” up to “the wise should enter it themselves.”

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya bas bsgrub pa'i chos kyi yon tan bstan to ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya bas bsgrub pa'i chos kyi yon tan bstan to ;
translated: The qualities of the Dharma of practice are shown by the passage from “It is free from pride” up to “free from desire.”

original: /'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bas 'bras bu'i chos bstan to //
analyzed: /'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya bas 'bras bu'i chos bstan to //
translated: The Dharma of result is shown by “cessation” and “nirvāṇa.”

original: chos rnams la yon tan de dag dang ldan par dad pa brten zhing yid ches par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: chos rnams la yon tan de dag dang ldan par dad pa brten zhing yid ches par gyur pa ni /
translated: Those who have faith in the Dharma endowed with these qualities, who rely on it and believe in it,

original: dam pa'i chos la dad pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la dad pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are said to have faith in the holy Dharma.

original: des ni sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di mu stegs la sogs pa'i @175a * //
analyzed: des ni sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di mu stegs la sogs pa'i @175a * //
translated: This Dharma of the Buddha is not the same as the teachings of non-Buddhists, such as the Ājīvikas,

original: chos las khyad par du gyur pa ston te /
analyzed: chos las khyad par du gyur pa ston te /
translated: It is taught that it is superior to the Dharma.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽de dag gi chos ni phyin ci log tu bshad pas na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / de dag gi chos ni phyin ci log tu bshad pas na /
translated: How so?

original: legs par bshad pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Their Dharma is not well taught, because it is taught in a distorted way.🔽It is not the Dharma of vision, because it is not capable of withstanding investigation by valid cognition,

original: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba tsam du zad kyi /🔽tshad mas brtag tu mi bzod pas na /🔽lta ba'i chos la 'byung ba ma yin pa'o /
analyzed: dad pa'i rjes su 'brang ba tsam du zad kyi / tshad mas brtag tu mi bzod pas na / lta ba'i chos la 'byung ba ma yin pa'o /
translated: and because it is merely the pursuit of faith.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ma yin pas na nad med pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po ma yin pas na nad med pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the Dharma of purification, because it is not the antidote to the afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: phyis nyams par 'gyur bas na dus med pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyis nyams par 'gyur bas na dus med pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the Dharma of the time, because it is subject to later degeneration.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas thob par mi byed pas na nye bar 'dren pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas thob par mi byed pas na nye bar 'dren pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the Dharma of the guide, because it does not lead to the attainment of the state of nirvana.

original: mu stegs pa rnams kyi chos ni phan tshun thun mong du gyur pas na 'di la mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs pa rnams kyi chos ni phan tshun thun mong du gyur pas na 'di la mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the Dharma of the seen, because the Dharma of the tirthikas is common to all.

original: de dag gi chos rtog ge'i spyod yul du gyur pa yin pas /
analyzed: de dag gi chos rtog ge'i spyod yul du gyur pa yin pas /
translated: It is not the Dharma of the wise, because their Dharma is the domain of sophistry.

original: mkhas pa rang gis rig pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa rang gis rig pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not the Dharma of the self-realized, because it is not realized by oneself.

original: rigs dang gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa mi sel bas na rgyags pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs dang gzugs la sogs pa la chags pa mi sel bas na rgyags pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not without intoxication, because it does not eliminate attachment to caste, form, and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags pa sel bar mi byed pas na 'dod pa med par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan la chags pa sel bar mi byed pas na 'dod pa med par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the state of desirelessness, because it does not eliminate attachment to the pleasures of the senses.

original: phung po lnga spong bar mi byed pas na gnas 'joms pa ma yin no //🔽lam rgyud lnga dang tshe'i rgyun gcod par mi byed pas na /
analyzed: phung po lnga spong bar mi byed pas na gnas 'joms pa ma yin no // lam rgyud lnga dang tshe'i rgyun gcod par mi byed pas na /
translated: It is not the destruction of the abodes, because it does not eliminate the five aggregates.

original: lam gcod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lam gcod pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the cutting off of the path, because it does not cut off the continuity of the five life-paths.

original: bdag gi yod par ston pas na stong pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi yod par ston pas na stong pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not emptiness, because it teaches the existence of the self.

original: bdag yod par ston pas na mi dmigs par ston pa ma yin no //🔽ma 'ongs pa'i lus dang longs spyod la chags pa'i gnyen po mi byed pas na /🔽sred pa zad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag yod par ston pas na mi dmigs par ston pa ma yin no // ma 'ongs pa'i lus dang longs spyod la chags pa'i gnyen po mi byed pas na / sred pa zad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the teaching of non-apprehension, because it teaches the existence of the self.🔽It is not the exhaustion of craving, because it does not serve as the antidote to attachment to future bodies and enjoyments.

original: da ltar gyi phung po yo byad la chags pa spong bar mi byed pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: da ltar gyi phung po yo byad la chags pa spong bar mi byed pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not freedom from attachment, because it does not eliminate attachment to the present aggregates and possessions.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i lam ma yin pas 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i lam ma yin pas 'gog pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Since it is not the path for attaining nirvana, it is not nirvana.

original: yang na gzhan sngar bshad par zad kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dus gang gis bsgrubs kyang bsgrub par rung ste /
analyzed: yang na gzhan sngar bshad par zad kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dus gang gis bsgrubs kyang bsgrub par rung ste /
translated: Or else, it is as explained above, but it is suitable to practice the qualities of a buddha at any time.

original: bsgrub pa'i dus med pas na dus med pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i dus med pas na dus med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no time to practice, it is timeless.🔽It is easy to practice and suitable to practice, just as the lay vow holder Anathapindika explained:

original: bsgrub sla zhing bsgrub tu rung bar yang ji ltar dge bsnyen mgon med zas sbyin gyis bshad pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ni 'gro ba na yang bla /🔽'dug pa na yang bla /
analyzed: bsgrub sla zhing bsgrub tu rung bar yang ji ltar dge bsnyen mgon med zas sbyin gyis bshad pa sangs rgyas kyi chos ni 'gro ba na yang bla / 'dug pa na yang bla /
translated: “The qualities of a buddha are easy to practice when walking,🔽easy to practice when sitting,

original: nyal ba na yang bla /
analyzed: nyal ba na yang bla /
translated: easy to practice when lying down,

original: 'chag pa na yang bsgrub bla'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'chag pa na yang bsgrub bla'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: and easy to practice when standing.”

original: de la mu stegs kyis bshad pa'i chos ni rgyal rigs dang / bram ze la bshad kyi dmangs rigs la @175b bshad par mi bya'o zhes kun la mi 'chad pa'i phyir 'chab pa yod kyi /
analyzed: de la mu stegs kyis bshad pa'i chos ni rgyal rigs dang / bram ze la bshad kyi dmangs rigs la @175b bshad par mi bya'o zhes kun la mi 'chad pa'i phyir 'chab pa yod kyi /
translated: The qualities explained by the tirthikas are not to be explained to the low caste, but are to be explained to the royal caste and the priestly caste.

original: dam pa'i chos ni rigs bzhi car la yang 'chab pa med par skabs su phye ste bstan pas 'di la mthong ngo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ni rigs bzhi car la yang 'chab pa med par skabs su phye ste bstan pas 'di la mthong ngo zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said, Look at this!

original: bde re ltos zhes slob dpon 'chab pa med par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde re ltos zhes slob dpon 'chab pa med par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The master teaches without concealment, saying, How happy they are!

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the third branch of the stream-enterer,🔽it is said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun shin tu rab tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun shin tu rab tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One's assembly of disciples is very well-practiced, etc.

original: 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyi dge 'dun gyi yon tan te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyi dge 'dun gyi yon tan te /
translated: These are the qualities of the Blessed One's assembly.

original: shin tu rab tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu rab tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Very well-practiced

original: mdo tsam du bstan pa'o ;
analyzed: mdo tsam du bstan pa'o ;
translated: is taught in brief.

original: / rigs pa la rab tu zhugs pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar shin tu rab tu zhugs pa'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: / rigs pa la rab tu zhugs pa la sogs pa ni ji ltar shin tu rab tu zhugs pa'i bshad pa'o //
translated: Well-practiced in reasoning, etc. is explained as very well-practiced.

original: de yang don rnam pa bzhir blta ste /
analyzed: de yang don rnam pa bzhir blta ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be seen in four aspects.

original: dge sbyong gi phyir zhugs pa dang / dge sbyong la zhugs pa dang / dge sbyong la dge sbyong gi dngos por zhugs pa dang / dge sbyong gi nye bar bstan pa la zhugs pa la brtsams nas bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi phyir zhugs pa dang / dge sbyong la zhugs pa dang / dge sbyong la dge sbyong gi dngos por zhugs pa dang / dge sbyong gi nye bar bstan pa la zhugs pa la brtsams nas bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is explained in terms of one who has entered for the sake of the ascetic, one who has entered into the ascetic, one who has entered into the reality of the ascetic, and one who has entered into the teaching of the ascetic.

original: de la rigs pa la rab tu zhugs pa zhes bya bas dge sbyong gi phyir zhugs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la rigs pa la rab tu zhugs pa zhes bya bas dge sbyong gi phyir zhugs pa bstan te /
translated: Here, one who has entered into the path is one who has entered for the sake of the ascetic.

original: dge sbyong gi phyir ni dge sbyong gi don du bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi phyir ni dge sbyong gi don du bya ba ste /
translated: For the sake of the ascetic means for the sake of the ascetic’s goal.

original: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: And that is nirvana.
