original: mya ngan las 'das pa la zhugs pas na rigs pa la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la zhugs pas na rigs pa la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who has entered into nirvana is said to have entered the path.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la rigs ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la rigs ste /
translated: Nirvana is the path,

original: nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba dang sbyor ba'i gnyen por chos ni bla na med kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba dang sbyor ba'i gnyen por chos ni bla na med kyi /
translated: because the Dharma is unsurpassed as the antidote that abandons the afflictions and their preparation.

original: kye des mnyes par bya ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kye des mnyes par bya ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should please him.

original: drang po la zhugs pa zhes bya bas dge sbyong la zhugs pa bstan te /
analyzed: drang po la zhugs pa zhes bya bas dge sbyong la zhugs pa bstan te /
translated: One who has entered the straight is one who has entered into the ascetic.

original: de la dge sbyong ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la bya ste /
analyzed: de la dge sbyong ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la bya ste /
translated: Mendicant refers to the eightfold noble path,

original: nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba dang sbyor ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rab tu spong ba dang sbyor ba'i gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the antidote that abandons the afflictions and their connections.

original: de la zhugs pa ni drang po la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhugs pa ni drang po la zhugs pa'o //
translated: One who has entered that path is one who has entered the straight path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa yang drang po zhes bya bar cis mngon zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa yang drang po zhes bya bar cis mngon zhe na /
translated: Why is the eightfold noble path called straight?

original: mdo gzhan las /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las /
translated: In another sutra it says:

original: bdud rtsi'i sgo ni rnam par phye //
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i sgo ni rnam par phye //
translated: The door of nectar is opened

original: drang po'i lam ni shin tu bsgrags //
analyzed: drang po'i lam ni shin tu bsgrags //
translated: and the straight path is proclaimed.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang gzhan dag las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / yang gzhan dag las /
translated: And in another sutra it says:

original: drang po gang yin pa 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: drang po gang yin pa 'phags pa'i lam mo //
translated: The straight path is the noble path.

original: yon po gang yin pa sdig pa can gyi lta ba'o //
analyzed: yon po gang yin pa sdig pa can gyi lta ba'o //
translated: The crooked path is the view of sinners.

original: zhes bya'o // de la mtshungs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni dge @176a * //🔽sbyong gi dngos por zhugs pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de la mtshungs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni dge @176a * //🔽sbyong gi dngos por zhugs pa zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: One who has entered the same path is one who has entered the state of a mendicant.

original: ci zhig mtshungs she na byams pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa dang / byams pa'i ngag gi las dang ldan pa dang / byams pa'i yid kyi las dang ldan pas mtshungs pa dang / longs spyod dang tshul khrims dang lta ba mthun pa'i phyir mtshungs par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhig mtshungs she na byams pa'i lus kyi las dang ldan pa dang / byams pa'i ngag gi las dang ldan pa dang / byams pa'i yid kyi las dang ldan pas mtshungs pa dang / longs spyod dang tshul khrims dang lta ba mthun pa'i phyir mtshungs par zhugs pa'o //
translated: What is similar? They are similar in having loving physical actions, loving verbal actions, and loving mental actions, and they are similar in engaging in the same enjoyments, ethics, and views.

original: chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la rab tu zhugs pa gnyer ba'i chos la spyod pa zhes bya bas dge sbyong gis nye bar bstan pa la zhugs pa bstan te /
analyzed: chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la rab tu zhugs pa gnyer ba'i chos la spyod pa zhes bya bas dge sbyong gis nye bar bstan pa la zhugs pa bstan te /
translated: Those who engage in the Dharma and the Dharma to be practiced are called those who practice the Dharma to be practiced. This teaches that they engage in the instructions of a monk.

original: dge sbyong gis nye bar bstan pa ni dge sbyong gi don du bstan pa'i chos te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gis nye bar bstan pa ni dge sbyong gi don du bstan pa'i chos te /
translated: The Dharma taught for the sake of monks is the Dharma of monks.

original: de yang 'dul ba dang ; mdo sde dang / mngon pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de yang 'dul ba dang ; mdo sde dang / mngon pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: That is the Vinaya, the Sutra, and the Abhidharma.

original: de la bshad par bya ba'i gsung rab rnams ni chos so //
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ba'i gsung rab rnams ni chos so //
translated: Among them, the scriptures to be explained are the Dharma.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i gsung rab rnams gnyer ba'i chos te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i gsung rab rnams gnyer ba'i chos te /
translated: The scriptures to be practiced are the Dharma to be practiced.

original: bshad par bya ba'i gsung rab kyi nang nas /
analyzed: bshad par bya ba'i gsung rab kyi nang nas /
translated: Among the scriptures to be explained,

original: ji skad du gsungs pa bzhin du rjes su spyod par byed pas na /
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa bzhin du rjes su spyod par byed pas na /
translated: They practice in accordance with what has been taught.🔽

original: chos la rab tu zhugs pa'o //🔽bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rnams de bzhin du sgrub par byed pas na /
analyzed: chos la rab tu zhugs pa'o // bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rnams de bzhin du sgrub par byed pas na /
translated: Since he practices in accordance with what has been taught, he is one who has entered the Dharma.

original: gnyer ba'i chos la spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyer ba'i chos la spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he practices the Dharma that is to be practiced in that way, he is one who practices the Dharma that is to be practiced.

original: dge 'dun du 'du shes nas dad pa dang ldan te zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i mthus 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la yon tan gong du bshad pa dang ldan par yid ches shing dang ba ni dge 'dun du shes nas dad pa dang ldan
analyzed: dge 'dun du 'du shes nas dad pa dang ldan te zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i mthus 'phags pa'i dge 'dun la yon tan gong du bshad pa dang ldan par yid ches shing dang ba ni dge 'dun du shes nas dad pa dang ldan
translated: Having the perception of the Saṅgha and being endowed with faith means that through the power of realizing the noble truths, he has confidence and clarity in the qualities of the noble Saṅgha as explained above. This is having the perception of the Saṅgha and being endowed with faith.

original: pa'o // yang na don gyi mchog sgrub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par sgrub pa dang / tha dad pa med par sgrub pa dang / ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bsgrubs pa la brtsams nas /
analyzed: pa'o // yang na don gyi mchog sgrub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par sgrub pa dang / tha dad pa med par sgrub pa dang / ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bsgrubs pa la brtsams nas /
translated: Alternatively, having begun with the accomplishment of the supreme meaning, the accomplishment without error, the accomplishment without distinction, and the accomplishment in accordance with what is taught,

original: rigs pa la rab tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs pa la rab tu zhugs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he is said to have entered reasoning and so forth.

original: de la rigs pa la zhugs pa la zhes bya bas don gyi mchog bsgrub pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la rigs pa la zhugs pa la zhes bya bas don gyi mchog bsgrub pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase who have entered into reasoning indicates the accomplishment of the highest goal.

original: don gyi mchog ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: don gyi mchog ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The highest goal is nirvana.

original: de sgrub par byed pa'i phyir rigs pa la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa'i phyir rigs pa la zhugs pa'o //
translated: One who is who have entered into reasoning is one who accomplishes that.

original: drang po la zhes bya ba phyin ci ma log par bsgrub pa bstan te /
analyzed: drang po la zhes bya ba phyin ci ma log par bsgrub pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase who have entered into the straight indicates the accomplishment of non-error.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i lam sgrub par byed pas na drang po la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i lam sgrub par byed pas na drang po la zhugs pa'o //
translated: One who is who have entered into the straight is one who accomplishes the path of non-error.

original: mtshungs par zhugs pa zhes bya bas tha dad pa med par bsgrub pa bstan te /
analyzed: mtshungs par zhugs pa zhes bya bas tha dad pa med par bsgrub pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase who have entered into the same indicates the accomplishment of non-differentiation.

original: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa gzhan dag sgrub pa de bzhin du bsgrubs pas mtshungs par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa gzhan dag sgrub pa de bzhin du bsgrubs pas mtshungs par zhugs pa'o //
translated: One who is who have entered into the same is one who accomplishes the same as the other noble arhats.

original: chos dang gnyer @176b ba'i chos la zhugs //
analyzed: chos dang gnyer @176b ba'i chos la zhugs //
translated: They have entered into the Dharma and the Dharma's practice.

original: zhes bya bas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du sgrub pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du sgrub pa bstan te /
translated: The phrase who have entered into the Dharma and the Dharma's practice indicates the accomplishment of practice in accordance with the teaching.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi lung las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du sgrub par byed pas na chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la rab tu zhugs pa dang / gnyer ba'i chos la spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi lung las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du sgrub par byed pas na chos dang gnyer ba'i chos la rab tu zhugs pa dang / gnyer ba'i chos la spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they practice in accordance with the scriptures of the Bhagavān, they are called “those who have entered into the Dharma” and “those who practice the Dharma.”

original: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa de dag kyang gang zag dngos gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan de lta bu dang ldan pa de dag kyang gang zag dngos gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the actual persons who possess such qualities,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa'i dge 'dun yang yod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa'i dge 'dun yang yod ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said: “There is also a saṅgha that has entered in order to actualize the fruit of stream-entry.”

original: de la rgyun du ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: de la rgyun du ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
translated: Here, “stream” refers to the noble path.

original: de la zhugs pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhugs pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: “One who has entered that” is a stream-enterer.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The “fruit of stream-entry” is the gnosis of subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.

original: skad cig ma bcu drug la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma bcu drug la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the state of abiding in the sixteen moments.

original: mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ni lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: “Having entered in order to actualize” is the forbearance of subsequent knowledge with regard to the path.

original: sems kyi skad cig ma bco lnga la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma bco lnga la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the state of abiding in the fifteen moments of mind.

original: rab tu zhugs pa'i dge 'dun yang yod ces bya ba ni ;
analyzed: rab tu zhugs pa'i dge 'dun yang yod ces bya ba ni ;
translated: The Sangha of those who have entered the stream exists.

original: sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug lam la rjes su shes pa'i ye shes la gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig ma bcu drug lam la rjes su shes pa'i ye shes la gnas pa nyid de /
translated: It is those who abide in the gnosis of subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path, the sixteenth moment of mind.

original: des khams gsum gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs so //
analyzed: des khams gsum gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spangs so //
translated: They have completely abandoned all the defilements of the three realms that are to be eliminated by seeing.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa ni /
translated: Those who have entered the path to manifest the result of a once returner

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po dang / chen po'i 'bring po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring po'i chen po dang / 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chung ngu dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po dang / chen po'i 'bring po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring po'i chen po dang / 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chung ngu dang /
translated: are those who abide on the path that eliminates the five types of defilements of the desire realm: the great of the great, the medium of the great, the small of the great, the great of the medium and the medium of the medium.

original: chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chung ngu ste /
analyzed: chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chung ngu ste /
translated: They have not yet eliminated the small of the medium, the great of the small, the medium of the small and the small of the small.

original: dgu las nyon mongs pa 'bring po'i bar nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga spang ba'i lam la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dgu las nyon mongs pa 'bring po'i bar nyon mongs pa rnam pa lnga spang ba'i lam la gnas pa'o //
translated: They are those who abide on the path that eliminates the five types of defilements, up to the medium of the medium.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i dge 'dun ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po ste /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i dge 'dun ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po ste /
translated: The Sangha of once returners is the path of meditation abandoning the great of the small and the medium of the small afflictions of the desire realm.🔽

original: rnam pa brgyad spang ba'i lam la gnas pa'o//🔽phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad spang ba'i lam la gnas pa'o// phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa ni /
translated: The Saṅgha of once-returners is those abiding in the path of abandoning the eight afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation: the great of the great, the medium of the great,🔽and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po gnyis spang ba'i lam la gnas pa'o //🔽phyir mi 'ong ba'i dge 'dun ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgoms @177a * //🔽pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po gnyis spang ba'i lam la gnas pa'o // phyir mi 'ong ba'i dge 'dun ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgoms @177a * // pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu ste /
translated: Those who have entered to manifest the result of nonreturn are those abiding in the path of abandoning the two afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation: the great of the great and the medium of the great.

original: rnam pa dgu spang ba'i lam la gnas pa'o //🔽de ltar 'dod pa'i khams 'dir 'ong ba med par mya ngan las 'das bas na /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu spang ba'i lam la gnas pa'o // de ltar 'dod pa'i khams 'dir 'ong ba med par mya ngan las 'das bas na /
translated: The Saṅgha of nonreturners is those abiding in the path of abandoning the nine afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation: the small of the small and so on.

original: lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: Thus they are nonreturners because they do not come to this desire realm and attain nirvana.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa ni /
translated: One who has entered the path for the purpose of manifesting the result of an arhat

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi re re zhing nyon mongs pa dgu dgur phye /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi re re zhing nyon mongs pa dgu dgur phye /
translated: divides the nine degrees of defilement of each stage of the form realm

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la yang nyon mongs pa dgu dgur phye ba las /🔽srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i 'bring po ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la yang nyon mongs pa dgu dgur phye ba las / srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i 'bring po ste /
translated: and divides the four meditative attainments of the formless realm into nine degrees of defilement each.

original: rnam pa brgyad kyi bar spang ba'i lam la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad kyi bar spang ba'i lam la gnas pa'o //
translated: He is situated on the path of elimination up to the eighth degree of the weak-weak defilement of the summit of existence.

original: dgra bcom pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa dgu spang ba'i lam la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i nyon mongs pa dgu spang ba'i lam la gnas pa ste /
translated: The arhat is situated on the path of eliminating the ninth degree of defilement of the summit of existence.

original: nyon mongs pa dgra dang 'dra ba rnams der ma lus par bcom pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dgra dang 'dra ba rnams der ma lus par bcom pa ste /
translated: The defilements, which are like enemies, are completely destroyed there.

original: med pas na dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: med pas na dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since they do not exist, he is called an arhat.

original: yang na 'jig rten thams cad kyis mchod cing bkur bar 'os pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten thams cad kyis mchod cing bkur bar 'os pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, he is worthy of the worship and praise of the entire world.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called an arhat.

original: de bas na mdo gzhan las kyang dbang po dang nye dbang pos mchod pa dang / bkur stir bya bar 'os so zhes bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na mdo gzhan las kyang dbang po dang nye dbang pos mchod pa dang / bkur stir bya bar 'os so zhes bya bar gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, another sutra says, “They are worthy of worship and reverence by gods and men.”

original: skyes bu zung bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'bras bu thob pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: skyes bu zung bzhi zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'bras bu thob pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four pairs of beings are the four enterers and the four abiders.

original: de ltar na gang zag brgyad do ;
analyzed: de ltar na gang zag brgyad do ;
translated: Thus, there are eight persons.

original: / de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / de ltar zhes bya ba ni gong du bshad pa ltar na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Thus means in the manner just explained.

original: dad pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa rnams la bzlog pa med pa'i yid ches pa dang ldan pas na /🔽dad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dad pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la las dang 'bras bu dang / bden pa rnams la bzlog pa med pa'i yid ches pa dang ldan pas na / dad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: They are perfect in faith because they possess unwavering confidence in karma, its results, and the truths.

original: yang na rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir dad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //🔽yan lag drug pa'i tshul khrims sam zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir dad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o // yan lag drug pa'i tshul khrims sam zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, they are perfect in faith because they possess the four limbs of stream entry.

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: They are perfect in morality because they possess the six limbs of morality or undefiled morality.

original: thog mar yang dge / bar du yang dge zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo phal cher thos shing phyin ci ma log par thos pas na /
analyzed: thog mar yang dge / bar du yang dge zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo phal cher thos shing phyin ci ma log par thos pas na /
translated: Since he has heard most of the sutras and heard them without error,

original: thos pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: he has perfect learning.

original: gang zag la bdag med par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pas na /
translated: Since he possesses uncontaminated samadhi, which is characterized by the observation of the selflessness of the person,

original: ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: he has perfect samadhi.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ma nor bar khong du chud pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas na ;
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ma nor bar khong du chud pa'i shes rab dang ldan pas na ;
translated: Since he possesses the wisdom that unerringly comprehends the four noble truths,

original: @177b shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: @177b shes rab phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: he has perfect wisdom.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba dang ldan pas na /
translated: Since he possesses the abandonment of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation,

original: rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: he has perfect liberation.

original: de'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa spang bar shes pa dang / bya ba byas par shes pa dang / phyis sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bar shes pa dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa spang bar shes pa dang / bya ba byas par shes pa dang / phyis sems kyi rgyud la nyon mongs pa mi 'byung bar shes pa dang ldan pas na /
translated: Then, having understood the abandonment of the afflictions, having understood the performance of what must be done, and having understood that the afflictions will not arise again in the mindstream,

original: rnam par grol ba'i ston pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ston pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he is the perfect teacher of liberation.

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa mi'i rgyal po dang blon po la sogs pas sbyin par bya zhing mchod par bya ba'i gnas su gyur pas na ;
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa mi'i rgyal po dang blon po la sogs pas sbyin par bya zhing mchod par bya ba'i gnas su gyur pas na ;
translated: He is the object of offerings and worship by the lord of the gods Indra, Brahma, and so forth, by human kings, ministers, and so forth,

original: sbyin par 'os pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin par 'os pa zhes bya'o //
translated: so he is the one worthy of offerings.

original: dngos po dam pa dang bzang po dang mang pos mchod par 'os pas na /
analyzed: dngos po dam pa dang bzang po dang mang pos mchod par 'os pas na /
translated: He is worthy of worship with the best, good, and many things,

original: rab tu sbyin par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu sbyin par 'os pa'o //
translated: so he is worthy of the best offerings.

original: skabs skabs su lus kyis btud cing thal mo sbyar ba'i gnas yin pas na /
analyzed: skabs skabs su lus kyis btud cing thal mo sbyar ba'i gnas yin pas na /
translated: He is the object of bowing down with the body and joining the palms in supplication from time to time,

original: thal mo sbyar bar rung ba zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar bar rung ba zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: so he is the one worthy of the palms being joined.

original: lus smad lnga sa la gtugs te sri zhu'i gnas yin pas na /
analyzed: lus smad lnga sa la gtugs te sri zhu'i gnas yin pas na /
translated: He is the object of prostrating the five limbs to the ground and of respect,🔽so he is the one worthy of prostration.

original: phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
translated: He is worthy of worship.

original: bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is a field of merit that is unsurpassed.

original: gang du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyungs nas /
analyzed: gang du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyungs nas /
translated: In other words, he is a field in which the roots of virtue such as generosity are planted,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / rnam par thar ba'i mtshan nyid thob par byed pa'i zhing du 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / rnam par thar ba'i mtshan nyid thob par byed pa'i zhing du 'gyur te /
translated: and from which the abandonment of all the afflictions and the attainment of the characteristics of liberation spring.

original: de las zhing dam par gyur pa gzhan med pas na /
analyzed: de las zhing dam par gyur pa gzhan med pas na /
translated: There is no other field that is superior to him.

original: bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing ngo //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i bsod nams kyi zhing ngo //
translated: Therefore, he is a field of merit that is unsurpassed.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i yon phul lam /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i yon phul lam /
translated: If one offers him gifts and honors,

original: 'tsho ba sbyar tam /
analyzed: 'tsho ba sbyar tam /
translated: provides for his livelihood,

original: chos gos la sogs pa'i yo byad sbyar na /
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa'i yo byad sbyar na /
translated: or offers him robes and other necessities,

original: skad cig ma re re nyin re bzhin rgyun du 'phel bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: skad cig ma re re nyin re bzhin rgyun du 'phel bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: one’s own virtue will increase continuously, day by day, and moment by moment.

original: 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas su rung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi sbyin gnas su rung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: For this reason, he is worthy of the offerings of the world.

original: 'phags pa bzhed pa'i tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa bzhed pa'i tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims kyi yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: He possesses the morality that is accepted by the noble beings and the good qualities of morality.

original: gang yang de dag tshul khrims ma zhig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang de dag tshul khrims ma zhig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, they are endowed with unbroken moral discipline, and so on.

original: gang yang zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i dge 'dun de dag yon tan gong du bshad pa dang ldan par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i dge 'dun de dag yon tan gong du bshad pa dang ldan par ma zad kyi /
translated: Moreover means that not only are the noble Sangha endowed with the qualities explained above,

original: tshul khrims ma zhig pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'og nas 'byung ba rnams dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ma zhig pa la sogs pa'i yon tan 'og nas 'byung ba rnams dang yang ldan no //
translated: they are also endowed with the qualities that will be explained below, such as unbroken moral discipline.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de la tshul khrims ni rnam pa gsum ste /🔽tshul khrims kyi yan lag dang / brtul zhugs kyi @178a * //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims ni rnam pa gsum ste / tshul khrims kyi yan lag dang / brtul zhugs kyi @178a * //
translated: Moral discipline is threefold:🔽the branch of moral discipline,🔽the branch of ascetic practices,

original: yan lag dang / bag yod pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: yan lag dang / bag yod pa'i yan lag go //
translated: and the branch of conscientiousness.

original: de gsum car las nyams par ma gyur pas na /
analyzed: de gsum car las nyams par ma gyur pas na /
translated: Since they have not lapsed in any of these three,

original: tshul khrims ma zhig pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ma zhig pa'o //
translated: they have unbroken moral discipline.

original: de la rang bzhin gyi sdig pa phas pham pa rnams mi byed pa ni tshul khrims kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyi sdig pa phas pham pa rnams mi byed pa ni tshul khrims kyi yan lag go //
translated: Not committing the natural sins of the grounds of defeat is the branch of moral discipline.

original: skra 'breg pa dang / gos ngur smrig gyon pa ni brtul zhugs kyi yan lag go //
analyzed: skra 'breg pa dang / gos ngur smrig gyon pa ni brtul zhugs kyi yan lag go //
translated: Shaving the head and wearing saffron robes is the branch of ascetic practices.

original: chang mi btung ba ni bag yod pa'i yan lag ces bya'o //🔽skabs skabs su srung /🔽skabs skabs su 'bul zhing gtong ba med pas ma bral ba'o //
analyzed: chang mi btung ba ni bag yod pa'i yan lag ces bya'o // skabs skabs su srung / skabs skabs su 'bul zhing gtong ba med pas ma bral ba'o //
translated: Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.

original: ngang tshul ngan pa'i dri ma dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: ngang tshul ngan pa'i dri ma dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ma nyams pa'o //
translated: Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.

original: tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu 'dod pa la rtogs pa dang zhe sdang la rtogs pa mi 'byung bas na ma 'dres pa'o //🔽gcig tu dkar po'i phyogs 'ba' zhig 'byung zhing /
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ba'i rgyu 'dod pa la rtogs pa dang zhe sdang la rtogs pa mi 'byung bas na ma 'dres pa'o // gcig tu dkar po'i phyogs 'ba' zhig 'byung zhing /
translated: Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu byed pas na /🔽dri ma med pa'o //🔽tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ba'i gnyen por ldan zhing /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu byed pas na / dri ma med pa'o // tshul khrims nyams par 'gyur ba'i gnyen por ldan zhing /
translated: Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.

original: yongs su 'dzin pas na rang dbang yod pa'o //🔽tshul khrims nyams pa'i gnyen po ni /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pas na rang dbang yod pa'o // tshul khrims nyams pa'i gnyen po ni /
translated: Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.🔽Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.

original: shes rab kyi mthu sgom pa'i mthu ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mthu sgom pa'i mthu ste /
translated: Heedfulness is the cause of not being separated from the thought of awakening.

original: de gnyis la yang nas yang du goms par byas pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyi dbang du mi 'gyur zhing mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis gzhan du bkri bar mi nus pas na /
analyzed: de gnyis la yang nas yang du goms par byas pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyi dbang du mi 'gyur zhing mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyis gzhan du bkri bar mi nus pas na /
translated: Since one has repeatedly cultivated these two, one is not subject to sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas and cannot be led elsewhere by bad friends.

original: rang dbang yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang dbang yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “autonomous.”

original: lta ba ngan pa dang smon lam ngan pa'i dri ma dang ma 'dres pas na ma god pa ste mngon par 'byung ba 'ba' zhig tu bsngos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa dang smon lam ngan pa'i dri ma dang ma 'dres pas na ma god pa ste mngon par 'byung ba 'ba' zhig tu bsngos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is not mixed with the stain of bad views and bad aspirations, it is “uncorrupted,” because it is dedicated solely to going forth.

original: lta ba ngan pa dang ma 'dres pa ni /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa dang ma 'dres pa ni /
translated: It is not mixed with bad views,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i dri ma dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i dri ma dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not mixed with the stain of the view of the transitory collection, etc.

original: smon lam ngan pa dang ma 'dres pa ni tshul khrims 'di ltar gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs par smon lam dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam ngan pa dang ma 'dres pa ni tshul khrims 'di ltar gyur cig ces bya ba la sogs par smon lam dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: It is not mixed with bad aspirations, because it is not mixed with aspirations such as “May I have such and such morality.”

original: shin tu rdzogs zhes bya ba ni rab tu rdzogs /
analyzed: shin tu rdzogs zhes bya ba ni rab tu rdzogs /
translated: “Very complete” means “very perfect.”

original: mthar phyin pa ste /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ste /
translated: It is “consummated,”🔽because it is consummated.

original: ji ltar mthar phyin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mthar phyin zhe na /
translated: How is it consummated?

original: ma zhig pa dang ma ral ba dang ma nyams pa'i phyir mthar phyin to //🔽shin tu brtsams zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma zhig pa dang ma ral ba dang ma nyams pa'i phyir mthar phyin to // shin tu brtsams zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is perfected because it is not destroyed, not torn, and not impaired.

original: legs par bsgrubs zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: legs par bsgrubs zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: It is well undertaken is the meaning of well accomplished.

original: ji ltar legs par bsgrubs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar legs par bsgrubs she na /
translated: How is it well accomplished?

original: ma 'dres pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / rang @178b dbang yod pa dang / ma god pa'i phyir legs par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / rang @178b dbang yod pa dang / ma god pa'i phyir legs par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: It is well accomplished because it is not mixed, not defiled, not dependent on others, and not subject to decline.

original: mkhas pas rab tu bsngags pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims te /
analyzed: mkhas pas rab tu bsngags pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims te /
translated: It is praised by the wise is morality,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / 'phags pa dgra bcom pa la sogs pas yon tan can du bsgrags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / 'phags pa dgra bcom pa la sogs pas yon tan can du bsgrags pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is proclaimed to have good qualities by the Tathagatas, the noble arhats, and so on.

original: mkhas pas ma smad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mkhas pas ma smad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not despised by the wise is

original: tshul khrims de la nyes pa dang / skyon yod par mkhas pas ma gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshul khrims de la nyes pa dang / skyon yod par mkhas pas ma gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the wise do not say that morality has faults and defects.🔽It is not subject to decline is because it is not subject to decline,

original: zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is without outflows.

original: 'phags pa 'dod pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is the morality of the noble ones who delight in the desire realm is

original: 'phags pa rnams bzhed pa'i tshul khrims yin pas na 'dod pa'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams bzhed pa'i tshul khrims yin pas na 'dod pa'i tshul khrims te /
translated: It is morality that is accepted by the noble ones, and so it is morality that is accepted.

original: tshul khrims de dge ba dang zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas na mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du de la yang nas yang du mngon sum du mdzad pas na /
analyzed: tshul khrims de dge ba dang zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas na mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du de la yang nas yang du mngon sum du mdzad pas na /
translated: Since that morality has the characteristics of virtue and the uncontaminated, it is the meaning of nirvana.

original: de'i phyir 'phags pa bzhed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'phags pa bzhed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Therefore, it is morality that is accepted by the noble ones.

original: don du na 'di dag gis sman pa dang / sman dang / nye g-yog dang / yo byad du gyur pa rnams bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: don du na 'di dag gis sman pa dang / sman dang / nye g-yog dang / yo byad du gyur pa rnams bstan pa yin te /
translated: In fact, these indicate the doctor, the medicine, the nurse, and the supplies.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyon mongs pa sel ba'i sman pa'o //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyon mongs pa sel ba'i sman pa'o //
translated: Among them, the Tathagata is the doctor who removes the afflictions.

original: chos ni nyon mongs pa sel ba'i sman to //
analyzed: chos ni nyon mongs pa sel ba'i sman to //
translated: The Dharma is the medicine that removes the afflictions.

original: dge 'dun ni nyon mongs pa sel ba'i nye g-yog go //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni nyon mongs pa sel ba'i nye g-yog go //
translated: The Sangha is the nurse who removes the afflictions.🔽Noble ones' morality is the supplies for abandoning the afflictions.

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i yo byad du gyur pa'o / rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims ni nyon mongs pa spang bar bya ba'i yo byad du gyur pa'o / rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize the four limbs of stream-entry, it is said:

original: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi rnams so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi rnams so zhes gsungs so //
translated: These are the four limbs of the stream-enterer.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi bstan pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi bstan pa'i 'og tu /
translated: After teaching the four limbs of the stream-enterer,

original: stobs bcu bstan te /
analyzed: stobs bcu bstan te /
translated: he taught the ten powers.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par gsungs pa /
translated: He said that he would explain them just as they were taught.

original: dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu gang zhe na /
translated: “Bhikṣus, what are the tathāgatas’ ten powers?🔽”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: gang cung zad 'dis bshad cing gsungs pa rnams de bzhin du /
analyzed: gang cung zad 'dis bshad cing gsungs pa rnams de bzhin du /
translated: Whatever he explained and taught is just so,

original: phyin ci ma log cing ma nor ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log cing ma nor ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and because it is not mistaken and is not erroneous, he is called the Tathāgata.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bdud thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir stobs so//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bdud thams cad zil gyis gnon pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir stobs so//
translated: Because he has the power to overcome all the afflictions and māras, they are powers.

original: stobs dang po bstan pa'i phyir /🔽dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa gnas la gnas /
analyzed: stobs dang po bstan pa'i phyir / dge slong dag de bzhin gshegs pa gnas la gnas /
translated: In order to teach the first power,🔽he said, “Bhikṣus, the tathāgatas know as it actually is what is possible as possible and what is impossible as impossible.

original: gnas ma yin pa la gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la gnas ma yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: One should know that it is not a basis just as it is.🔽

original: de la gnas ni rgyu la bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas ni rgyu la bya'o //
translated: The term “basis” refers to a cause.

original: gnas ma yin pa ni rgyu ma yin pa la bya'o //🔽de la las dge ba dang / @179a * //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa ni rgyu ma yin pa la bya'o // de la las dge ba dang / @179a * //
translated: The term “non-basis” refers to a non-cause.

original: mi dge ba ni 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes mkhyen pa ni gnas la gnas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽byed pa po dang bdag la sogs pa ni chos kyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes mkhyen pa ni gnas la gnas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o // byed pa po dang bdag la sogs pa ni chos kyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: The knowledge that a virtuous or non-virtuous action is the cause of a pleasant or unpleasant result is called “the correct knowledge of the basis as the basis.”

original: de ltar mkhyen pa ni gnas ma yin pa la gnas ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽yang na gnas zhes bya ba ni srid pa la bya la /
analyzed: de ltar mkhyen pa ni gnas ma yin pa la gnas ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o // yang na gnas zhes bya ba ni srid pa la bya la /
translated: The knowledge that a creator, self, and so on are not the cause of a dharma is called “the correct knowledge of the non-basis as the non-basis.”

original: gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa la bya ste /🔽sbyin pas longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba ni srid la /
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi srid pa la bya ste / sbyin pas longs spyod chen por 'gyur ba ni srid la /
translated: Alternatively, the term “basis” refers to what is possible, and the term “non-basis” refers to what is impossible.🔽The knowledge that the result of generosity is great wealth is possible, but the knowledge that the result of generosity is poverty is impossible.

original: sbyin pas dbul bar gyur pa mi srid pa dang / tshul khrims kyis mtho ris su skye ba ni srid la /
analyzed: sbyin pas dbul bar gyur pa mi srid pa dang / tshul khrims kyis mtho ris su skye ba ni srid la /
translated: The knowledge that the result of morality is birth in a higher realm is possible, but the knowledge that the result of morality is birth in a lower realm is impossible.

original: tshul khrims kyis ngan song du skye ba ni mi srid pa dang / slar bzlog ste sdig pa byas pas mtho ris su skye ba mi srid la /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ngan song du skye ba ni mi srid pa dang / slar bzlog ste sdig pa byas pas mtho ris su skye ba mi srid la /
translated: It is impossible for someone with moral discipline to be born in the lower realms, but it is possible for someone who has committed evil deeds to be born in the higher realms.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba byas pas ngan song du skye ba ni srid pa dang / dge ba byas pas mtho ris su skye ba ni srid la /🔽dge bas ngan song du 'gro ba mi srid pa dang / skyes pas mngon par sangs rgyas shing 'khor lo bskor ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba dang / rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ni srid la /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba byas pas ngan song du skye ba ni srid pa dang / dge ba byas pas mtho ris su skye ba ni srid la / dge bas ngan song du 'gro ba mi srid pa dang / skyes pas mngon par sangs rgyas shing 'khor lo bskor ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ba dang / rang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ni srid la /
translated: It is possible for someone who has committed evil deeds to be born in the lower realms, but it is impossible for someone who has done good deeds to be born there.🔽It is possible for someone who has done good deeds to be born in the higher realms, but it is impossible for someone who has done good deeds to go to the lower realms.

original: bud med kyis de ltar mi 'gyur bar thugs su chud pa ni /
analyzed: bud med kyis de ltar mi 'gyur bar thugs su chud pa ni /
translated: It is possible for a man to become a fully enlightened Buddha and a king who turns the wheel, and to become a pratyekabuddha, but it is impossible for a woman to do so.🔽This is what the Buddha understood.

original: gnas la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the knowledge of the possible and the impossible, just as it is.”

original: de la thams cad shes pa dang thogs pa med par shes pa dang / dag par shes pa ni ;
analyzed: de la thams cad shes pa dang thogs pa med par shes pa dang / dag par shes pa ni ;
translated: “Knowledge of everything,” “unimpeded knowledge,” and “pure knowledge”

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: are called “knowledge of the way things are.”

original: stobs gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the second power,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “in relation to the past, future, and present.”

original: gang las byas shing bsags nas 'gags par gyur pa de dag ni 'das pa'i las so //🔽las gang byas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang las byas shing bsags nas 'gags par gyur pa de dag ni 'das pa'i las so // las gang byas pa yang ma yin /
translated: Those actions that have been performed and accumulated and have ceased are past actions.

original: 'gags pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'gags pa yang ma yin /
translated: Those actions that have not been performed and have not ceased

original: byed pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: byed pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: and are not being performed

original: ma 'ongs pa na byed par 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i las so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na byed par 'gyur ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i las so //
translated: but will be performed in the future are future actions.

original: las gang byas zin pa dang / 'gags pa yang ma yin /🔽da ltar byed pa la zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: las gang byas zin pa dang / 'gags pa yang ma yin / da ltar byed pa la zhugs pa ni /
translated: Those actions that have been performed and have not ceased🔽and are being performed in the present

original: da ltar byung ba'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: are present actions.

original: de yang lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las kyi sgo nas rnam pa gsum du bsdu ba nas las yang dag par gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang yid kyi las kyi sgo nas rnam pa gsum du bsdu ba nas las yang dag par gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, those actions are summarized as being of three types: bodily actions, verbal actions, and mental actions.

original: las de dag las 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal smin pa ni /
analyzed: las de dag las 'bras bu bde ba dang sdug bsngal smin pa ni /
translated: The ripening of the results of those actions as pleasure and pain

original: rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called “ripening.”

original: de la yang rnam pa bzhi lta bur mkhyen pa ni /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa bzhi lta bur mkhyen pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of these four aspects

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called “the perfect knowledge of things as they are.”

original: las kha cig da ltar bde la /
analyzed: las kha cig da ltar bde la /
translated: Some actions are pleasant now🔽but have a ripening in the future that is suffering.

original: ma 'ongs @179b pa na sdug bsngal par rnam par smin par 'gyur ba dang / las kha cig da ltar sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs @179b pa na sdug bsngal par rnam par smin par 'gyur ba dang / las kha cig da ltar sdug bsngal la /
translated: Some actions are suffering now🔽but have a ripening in the future that is pleasant.

original: ma 'ongs pa na bde bar rnam par smin pa dang / las kha cig da ltar yang sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na bde bar rnam par smin pa dang / las kha cig da ltar yang sdug bsngal la /
translated: Some actions are both suffering now🔽and have a ripening in the future that is suffering.

original: ma 'ongs pa na yang sdug bsngal bar rnam par smin pa dang / las kha cig da ltar yang bde la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na yang sdug bsngal bar rnam par smin pa dang / las kha cig da ltar yang bde la /
translated: Some actions are pleasant now🔽and have a ripening in the future that is pleasant.

original: ma 'ongs pa na yang bde bar smin par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de bzhin du thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na yang bde bar smin par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de bzhin du thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata has realized these four aspects.

original: de la tshe rabs gzhan na yang las mi dge ba spyad pa la goms pas tshe 'dir yang mi dge ba'i las la dga' ba bzhin du 'jug pa de dag de'i rkyen gyis ma 'ongs pa na ngan song gsum du rnam par smin par 'gyur bas de ni🔽las da ltar bde la /
analyzed: de la tshe rabs gzhan na yang las mi dge ba spyad pa la goms pas tshe 'dir yang mi dge ba'i las la dga' ba bzhin du 'jug pa de dag de'i rkyen gyis ma 'ongs pa na ngan song gsum du rnam par smin par 'gyur bas de ni las da ltar bde la /
translated: Due to that condition, they will experience the maturation of that karma in the three lower rebirths in the future.

original: ma 'ongs par sdug bsngal rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs par sdug bsngal rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called karma that is happy in the present but has a painful maturation in the future.

original: la la dag tshe rabs snga ma na dge ba la goms pa chen por ma byas pas tshe 'dir tshul khrims bsrung ba la sogs pa'i dge ba la mi bde bzhin du 'jug pa /
analyzed: la la dag tshe rabs snga ma na dge ba la goms pa chen por ma byas pas tshe 'dir tshul khrims bsrung ba la sogs pa'i dge ba la mi bde bzhin du 'jug pa /
translated: Some do not engage in virtue such as guarding ethical discipline in this life as if they do not like it because they did not cultivate virtue in previous lives.

original: de'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du bde 'gror rnam par smin pa ni 'dir mi bde la tshe rabs gzhan du bde bar smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du bde 'gror rnam par smin pa ni 'dir mi bde la tshe rabs gzhan du bde bar smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Due to that cause, they experience the maturation of that karma in the happy realms in other lives. This is called karma that is painful in the present but has a happy maturation in the future.

original: sems can kha cig tshe rabs gzhan du sdig pa'i las la goms par ma byas pas tshe 'dir mi 'dod bzhin du mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis sdig pa'i las byed du bcug pa de dag ni ma 'ongs pa na ngan song gsum du rnam par smin par
analyzed: sems can kha cig tshe rabs gzhan du sdig pa'i las la goms par ma byas pas tshe 'dir mi 'dod bzhin du mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis sdig pa'i las byed du bcug pa de dag ni ma 'ongs pa na ngan song gsum du rnam par smin par
translated: Those will ripen in the three lower realms in the future,

original: 'gyur bas / de dag ni tshe 'di la yang mi bde la /
analyzed: 'gyur bas / de dag ni tshe 'di la yang mi bde la /
translated: and so it is said that they will ripen unpleasantly in this life

original: ma 'ongs pa na yang sdug bsngal bar rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na yang sdug bsngal bar rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and ripen as suffering in the future.

original: la la dag tshe rabs snga ma na dge ba la goms pa chen por ma byas pas tshe 'dir tshul khrims bsrung ba la sogs pa'i dge ba la mi bde bzhin du 'jug pa /
analyzed: la la dag tshe rabs snga ma na dge ba la goms pa chen por ma byas pas tshe 'dir tshul khrims bsrung ba la sogs pa'i dge ba la mi bde bzhin du 'jug pa /
translated: Some, who in previous lives did not cultivate virtue to a great degree, in this life engage in virtue such as guarding ethical discipline against their will.

original: de'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du bde 'gror rnam par smin pa ni 'dir mi bde la tshe rabs gzhan du bde bar smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyus tshe rabs gzhan du bde 'gror rnam par smin pa ni 'dir mi bde la tshe rabs gzhan du bde bar smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of that, it is said that they will ripen in the happy realms in other lives, but that they ripen unpleasantly in this life and ripen as happiness in other lives.

original: sems can kha cig tshe rabs gzhan du sdig pa'i las la goms par ma byas pas tshe 'dir mi 'dod bzhin du mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rkyen gyis sdig pa'i las byed du bcug pa de dag ni ma 'ongs pa na ngan song gsum du rnam par
analyzed: sems can kha cig tshe rabs gzhan du sdig pa'i las la goms par ma byas pas tshe 'dir mi 'dod bzhin du mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rkyen gyis sdig pa'i las byed du bcug pa de dag ni ma 'ongs pa na ngan song gsum du rnam par
translated: Some sentient beings, who in other lives did not habituate themselves to sinful actions, in this life are forced by circumstances to commit sinful actions, such as associating with nonvirtuous friends, against their will.

original: smin par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: smin par 'gyur bas /
translated: In the future, they will ripen in the three lower realms.

original: de dag ni tshe 'di la yang mi bde la /
analyzed: de dag ni tshe 'di la yang mi bde la /
translated: They are said to have a miserable life in this world,

original: ma 'ongs pa na yang sdug bsngal bar rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na yang sdug bsngal bar rnam par smin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and to have a miserable ripening in the future.

original: kha cig tshe rabs snga ma la dge ba'i las byed pa la goms pas tshe 'dir yang de bzhin du dge ba'i las byed pa dang / tshe 'dir gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi thob pa dag ma 'ongs pa na yang mtho ris su rnam @180a * //
analyzed: kha cig tshe rabs snga ma la dge ba'i las byed pa la goms pas tshe 'dir yang de bzhin du dge ba'i las byed pa dang / tshe 'dir gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi thob pa dag ma 'ongs pa na yang mtho ris su rnam @180a * //
translated: Some, who in previous lives habituated themselves to virtuous actions, in this life also do virtuous actions in the same way, and in this life attain the four concentrations of the form realm. In the future, they will ripen in the higher realms.

original: par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag ni tshe 'dir yang bde la /
analyzed: par smin par 'gyur ba'i phyir de dag ni tshe 'dir yang bde la /
translated: Therefore, they are said to have a happy life in this world,

original: tshe rabs gzhan du yang rnam par smin pa bde ba zhes bya'o /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan du yang rnam par smin pa bde ba zhes bya'o /
translated: and to have a happy ripening in other lives.

original: stobs gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs gsum pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the third power,

original: sems can pha rol bo rnams kyi mos pa du ma dang mos pa sna tshogs pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can pha rol bo rnams kyi mos pa du ma dang mos pa sna tshogs pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “They perfectly know the many and various aspirations of other sentient beings.”

original: sems can rnams kyi mos pa du ma ni mos pa chung ba dang / mos pa 'bring po dang / mos pa chen po ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mos pa du ma ni mos pa chung ba dang / mos pa 'bring po dang / mos pa chen po ste /
translated: The many aspirations of sentient beings are lesser, middling, and great aspirations.

original: gang nyan thos kyi theg pa la mos pa ni mos pa chung ngu'o //
analyzed: gang nyan thos kyi theg pa la mos pa ni mos pa chung ngu'o //
translated: Those who aspire to the Hearers’ Vehicle have a lesser aspiration.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mos pa ni mos pa 'bring ngo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mos pa ni mos pa 'bring ngo //
translated: Those who aspire to the Solitary Realizers’ Vehicle have a middling aspiration.

original: theg pa chen po la mos pa ni mos pa chen po'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la mos pa ni mos pa chen po'o //
translated: Those who aspire to the Great Vehicle have a great aspiration.

original: sems can kha cig gzugs la mos pa yod la /
analyzed: sems can kha cig gzugs la mos pa yod la /
translated: Some sentient beings aspire to form,

original: sgra la ma yin /
analyzed: sgra la ma yin /
translated: but not to sound.

original: kha cig sgra la mos la /
analyzed: kha cig sgra la mos la /
translated: Some aspire to sound,

original: gzugs la ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs la ma yin /
translated: but not to form.

original: kha cig sgra la mos la /
analyzed: kha cig sgra la mos la /
translated: Some aspire to sound,

original: gzugs la ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs la ma yin /
translated: but not to form.

original: kha cig dri la mos la gzugs la ma yin pa la sogs pa mos pa'i rnam pa tshad med par yod pa rnams ni mos pa sna tshogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig dri la mos la gzugs la ma yin pa la sogs pa mos pa'i rnam pa tshad med par yod pa rnams ni mos pa sna tshogs zhes bya ste /
translated: Some have immeasurable aspects of interest, such as being interested in smell but not form, and so on. These are called various interests.

original: sems can rnams gang ci la mos pa de de bzhin du phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pas na /
analyzed: sems can rnams gang ci la mos pa de de bzhin du phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pas na /
translated: The Bhagavan knows exactly what interests sentient beings have, without error.

original: mos pa du ma dang mos pa sna tshogs rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa du ma dang mos pa sna tshogs rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Thus, he knows the many interests and various interests exactly as they are.

original: stobs bzhi pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs bzhi pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the fourth power,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams du ma dang / 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams du ma dang / 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “He knows the many worlds and the various worlds exactly as they are.”

original: khams kyi don ni 'dir sems can rnams kyi rigs sam rang bzhin nam sa bon la bya ste /
analyzed: khams kyi don ni 'dir sems can rnams kyi rigs sam rang bzhin nam sa bon la bya ste /
translated: Here, the meaning of world is the type, nature, or seed of sentient beings.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / theg pa chen po'i rigs can rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams du ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / theg pa chen po'i rigs can rnams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams du ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The worlds of those who have the śrāvaka type, the pratyekabuddha type, and the Mahāyāna type are called the many worlds.

original: sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong dag ni 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong dag ni 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs zhes bya ste /
translated: The eighty-four thousand activities of sentient beings are called the “various worlds.”

original: sems can rigs dang ldan pa dang / sems can gang spyod pa gang dang ldan pa de de bzhin du phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pas na /
analyzed: sems can rigs dang ldan pa dang / sems can gang spyod pa gang dang ldan pa de de bzhin du phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pas na /
translated: The Tathāgata has realized the various activities of sentient beings, just as they are, without error.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “knowledge of the way things really are.”

original: stobs lnga pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs lnga pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach the fifth power,

original: sems can gzhan rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽de la dbang po rnon po dang ; rtul po dang / 'bring po ste /
analyzed: sems can gzhan rnams kyi dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya ba gsungs te / de la dbang po rnon po dang ; rtul po dang / 'bring po ste /
translated: it says, “He knows the faculties of other beings and individuals just as they are.”

original: rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three types of faculties: sharp, dull, and middling.

original: 'di ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga rno ba dang ldan /
analyzed: 'di ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga rno ba dang ldan /
translated: This is the power of knowing the sharp and dull faculties of the five faculties of faith and so on.

original: 'di ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rtul ba dang ldan no zhes phyin ci ma log par rab tu mkhyen pa ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po rtul ba dang ldan no zhes phyin ci ma log par rab tu mkhyen pa ni dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the correct knowledge of the faculties of faith, etc. as dull or sharp, and is called the correct knowledge of the faculties as superior or inferior.

original: stobs @180b drug pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs @180b drug pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the sixth power,

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa gsungs te /
translated: the correct knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere is stated.

original: sems can rnams kyi rigs dang spyod pa dang dbang po rno rtul mkhyen nas sems can gang la lam dang chos gang bstan par 'os pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rigs dang spyod pa dang dbang po rno rtul mkhyen nas sems can gang la lam dang chos gang bstan par 'os pa de bzhin du /
translated: Having known the lineages, conduct, and sharp or dull faculties of sentient beings, the path and Dharma that are suitable to be taught to a particular sentient being are taught.

original: phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pa ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The correct knowledge of this is called the correct knowledge of the paths that lead everywhere.

original: dper na 'dod chags can la mi gtsang ba bstan pa dang / zhe sdang can la byams pa bstan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: dper na 'dod chags can la mi gtsang ba bstan pa dang / zhe sdang can la byams pa bstan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa mkhyen pa'o //
translated: For example, it is the knowledge of teaching the impure to those with attachment, love to those with aversion, and so on.

original: yang na lam rgyud lnga gzigs shing mkhyen pa ni /
analyzed: yang na lam rgyud lnga gzigs shing mkhyen pa ni /
translated: Or else, seeing and knowing the five paths of the individual is

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: called “knowing the path that goes everywhere just as it is.”🔽Or else, the path that is based on each individual, such as the śramaṇa, the brahmin, and so on, is attached to various individual views and is perceived as the path.

original: yang na so so'i phyogs la brten pa'i lam dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pa so sor lta ba sna tshogs la chags shing lam yin par 'du shes pa las gang tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du yang kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lam thams
analyzed: yang na so so'i phyogs la brten pa'i lam dge sbyong dang bram ze la sogs pa so sor lta ba sna tshogs la chags shing lam yin par 'du shes pa las gang tshe 'di dang tshe rabs gzhan du yang kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lam thams
translated: When, in this life and in other lives, all paths that are free from wrongdoing

original: cad du bde ba 'ba' zhig skyed par byed pa ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: cad du bde ba 'ba' zhig skyed par byed pa ni thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: produce only happiness, that is called “the path that goes everywhere.”

original: de phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pas na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de phyin ci ma log par mkhyen pas na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he knows that without error, it is called “knowing just as it is.”

original: stobs bdun pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs bdun pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the seventh power,

original: sems can pha rol po rnams kyi dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems can pha rol po rnams kyi dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Buddha said, “The strengths of other sentient beings,” and so on.

original: dbang po ni dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga'o //
translated: “Strength” refers to the five strengths of faith and so on.

original: stobs ni dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs lnga'o //
analyzed: stobs ni dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs lnga'o //
translated: Power is the five powers of faith, etc.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag ni dran pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi yan lag bdun no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag ni dran pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi yan lag bdun no //
translated: The limbs of enlightenment are the seven limbs of enlightenment, beginning with mindfulness.

original: bsam gtan ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni gzugs kyi khams kyi bsam gtan bzhi'o //
translated: Meditative absorption is the four meditative absorptions of the form realm.

original: rnam par thar pa ni gzugs can gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa brgyad do //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni gzugs can gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa brgyad do //
translated: Liberation is the eight liberations, beginning with the perception of form internally while viewing forms externally.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang stong pa nyid la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: Concentration is the three concentrations, beginning with emptiness, beginning with the absence of expectancy, and beginning with the absence of aspiration.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The meditative attainments are the four meditative attainments of the formless realm and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: yang na sems la dbang thob pa rnams gang 'dod pa'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sems la dbang thob pa rnams gang 'dod pa'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, those who have attained mastery over the mind enter into the meditative concentration that is conducive to the accomplishment of whatever objective they desire.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang zhes bya ba la ;
translated: The phrase “in regard to the afflicted class of entities” is stated in the root text.

original: mdor na bsam gtan la sogs pa thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis te /🔽ma thob pa rnams la ni thabs ma yin pa'i sbyor ba la 'jug pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang / thob pa rnams la ni de'i sa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mngon du spyod pa'am /
analyzed: mdor na bsam gtan la sogs pa thob par bya ba la bar du gcod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis te / ma thob pa rnams la ni thabs ma yin pa'i sbyor ba la 'jug pa dang / rmugs pa dang / rgod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang / thob pa rnams la ni de'i sa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mngon du spyod pa'am /
translated: In brief, there are two kinds of afflictions that obstruct the attainment of the absorptions and so on.🔽The first is the affliction of nonobtainment, which is the engagement in the application of nonmethods and the affliction of lethargy and agitation.

original: @181a * // bsam gtan gyi bde ba la ro myong bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: @181a * // bsam gtan gyi bde ba la ro myong bar byed pa ste /
translated: The second is the affliction of the obtainment of the absorptions, which is the manifest engagement in the affliction of that level or the experience of the pleasure of the absorptions.

original: de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called affliction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis dang bral ba nyid rnam par byang ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis dang bral ba nyid rnam par byang ba'o //
translated: Purification is the freedom from these two kinds of affliction.

original: bsam gtan tshad med pa rnams la bsam gtan gang gi ming gang yin pa ni rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan tshad med pa rnams la bsam gtan gang gi ming gang yin pa ni rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The absorptions and the immeasurables are called the classification of the absorptions because they are the names of the absorptions.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / de dag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / ming gang yin pa phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / de dag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / ming gang yin pa phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa ni /
translated: The correct understanding of phenomena such as the faculties, their defilement and purification, and whatever names there are, is

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: called “the correct knowledge of things as they really are.”

original: stobs brgyad pa bstan pa'i phyir sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: stobs brgyad pa bstan pa'i phyir sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the eighth power, [the Buddha] declares, “the various kinds of recollection of former existences,” and so on.

original: sems can gyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs de dang de dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi gnas rnam pa sna tshogs de dang de dag 'di lta ste /
translated: The various kinds of abodes of sentient beings are such as

original: shar dang nub dang byang dang lho la sogs pa /
analyzed: shar dang nub dang byang dang lho la sogs pa /
translated: east, west, north, south, and so on.

original: gnas sna tshogs dang ming la sogs pa tha dad pa tha snyad kyi dngos po brgyad rjes su 'brangs pa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi lus 'brangs pa rnams la mdor na spyod pa drug rjes su dran pa ni /
analyzed: gnas sna tshogs dang ming la sogs pa tha dad pa tha snyad kyi dngos po brgyad rjes su 'brangs pa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi lus 'brangs pa rnams la mdor na spyod pa drug rjes su dran pa ni /
translated: The various bodies of self and others, which are the eight conventional entities that follow from the different names and so on, are, in brief, the six kinds of conduct.

original: sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rnam pa dang bcas ;
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rnam pa dang bcas ;
translated: The recollection of former existences is the various kinds of recollection of former existences, together with their aspects,

original: yul dang bcas /
analyzed: yul dang bcas /
translated: together with their objects,🔽and together with their causes.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas par yang dag par rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas par yang dag par rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “recollection of the past with signs.”

original: tha snyad kyi dngos po brgyad ni ming gang yin pa dang / rigs gang yin pa dang / rus gang yin pa dang / tha snyad ci dag spyod pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ci myong ba dang / tshe ring thung ji tsam pa dang /
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dngos po brgyad ni ming gang yin pa dang / rigs gang yin pa dang / rus gang yin pa dang / tha snyad ci dag spyod pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ci myong ba dang / tshe ring thung ji tsam pa dang /
translated: The eight conventional things are: whatever the name is, whatever the family is, whatever the clan is, whatever the conventional usage is, whatever the happiness or suffering is, whatever the length of life is,

original: dus ji srid cig gnas pa dang / tshe'i mtha' ji tsam pa'o //
analyzed: dus ji srid cig gnas pa dang / tshe'i mtha' ji tsam pa'o //
translated: whatever the duration of life is, and whatever the end of life is.

original: spyod pa rnam pa drug ni /
analyzed: spyod pa rnam pa drug ni /
translated: The six kinds of conduct are:

original: 'bod pa'i phyir tha snyad dang / rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i rigs dang / pha ma gang yin pa dag bza' ba dang btung ba'i yo byad dang / dar ba dang / rgud pa dang / tshe'i 'du byed rnam pa sna tshogs so //
analyzed: 'bod pa'i phyir tha snyad dang / rgyal rigs la sogs pa'i rigs dang / pha ma gang yin pa dag bza' ba dang btung ba'i yo byad dang / dar ba dang / rgud pa dang / tshe'i 'du byed rnam pa sna tshogs so //
translated: conventional usage for calling, family such as the warrior class, parents, whatever the means of subsistence is, whatever the prosperity or decline is, and the various life-formations.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten dag tha snyad kyi dngos po brgyad la brten nas spyod pa rnam pa drug gis bdag dang pha rol dag la smra zhing gleng par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten dag tha snyad kyi dngos po brgyad la brten nas spyod pa rnam pa drug gis bdag dang pha rol dag la smra zhing gleng par byed do //
translated: Thus, in the world, on the basis of eight conventional things, one speaks and discusses with others in six ways.

original: de la mi gang yin pa ni bdag tshe rabs de dang / de dag nas mi gang dang gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi gang yin pa ni bdag tshe rabs de dang / de dag nas mi gang dang gang yin pa'o //
translated: Here, the person is the one who is oneself in this and that life.

original: rigs ni rgyal rigs sam /
analyzed: rigs ni rgyal rigs sam /
translated: The family is the one in which one is born, whether it be a kṣatriya family,

original: bram ze 'am /
analyzed: bram ze 'am /
translated: a brāhmaṇa family,🔽a vaiśya family,

original: rje'u rigs sam /🔽dmangs rigs la sogs pa gang dang gang du skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rje'u rigs sam / dmangs rigs la sogs pa gang dang gang du skyes pa'o //
translated: or a śūdra family.

original: pha dang ma ni sems can so so'i tshe rabs de dang de dag na ma gang yin pa dang / pha gang yin pa'o //🔽bza' ba dang btung ba'i yo byad ni /
analyzed: pha dang ma ni sems can so so'i tshe rabs de dang de dag na ma gang yin pa dang / pha gang yin pa'o // bza' ba dang btung ba'i yo byad ni /
translated: The parents are the mother and father who are the parents in this and that life.

original: tshe rabs de dang de dag na khre dang 'bras la sogs pa'i kha zas ci dang ci zos pa'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs de dang de dag na khre dang 'bras la sogs pa'i kha zas ci dang ci zos pa'o //
