translated: The possessions are the things that one has in this and that life, such as food and drink.

original: dar ba dang rgud pa ni tshe rabs de dang de dag na nyon mongs pa ci myong ba dang bde ba ci myong ba'o //
analyzed: dar ba dang rgud pa ni tshe rabs de dang de dag na nyon mongs pa ci myong ba dang bde ba ci myong ba'o //

analyzed: de la rnam pa dran pa ni /
translated: The various constituents of life are the number of years, whether a hundred, a thousand, or ten, and so on, in those lives.🔽The various

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi tshe gcig nas brtsams nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i pha rol na ci dang ci byed pa dran pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi tshe gcig nas brtsams nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i pha rol na ci dang ci byed pa dran pa'o //
translated: One remembers what was done in the past, beginning with one's own and others' lives, up to many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons.

original: dan rtags dran pa ni tshe rabs de dang de dag thams cad na tshe re re 'am so so'i ming rnams kyang dran pa ste /🔽tshe 'di'i tshe na ni ming 'di zhes bya ba /
analyzed: dan rtags dran pa ni tshe rabs de dang de dag thams cad na tshe re re 'am so so'i ming rnams kyang dran pa ste / tshe 'di'i tshe na ni ming 'di zhes bya ba /
translated: One remembers signs, that is, in those lives, one remembers one's own and others' names in each life.

original: 'di'i tshe na ni ming 'di zhes bya ba dran pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i tshe na ni ming 'di zhes bya ba dran pa'o //
translated: One remembers this name in this life, and in this life, this name.

analyzed: mtshan ma dran pa ni tshe rabs de dang de dag na dus dang rigs gang yin pa dang / dar ba dang rgud pa ci myong ba rnams dran pa'o //
translated: One remembers characteristics, that is, in those lives, one remembers what time it was, what family it was, and what experiences of prosperity and decline one had.

original: yul dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs de dang de dag na rus dang rigs gang yin pa dang / yul gang dang gang na gnas pa dang / de dag nas shi 'phos nas gang du skyes pa dran pa'o //

translated: One remembers with a place, that is, in those lives, one remembers what family and clan it was, what country one lived in, and where one was reborn after passing away from there.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs de dang de dag na pha ma gang yin pa dran pa dang / tshe'i 'du byed dus ji srid cig tu gnas pa dran pa'o //

translated: The phrase with its signs means that one recalls who one's parents were in those various lives and how long one remained in existence.

translated: The phrase with its aspects means that one recalls the time when one was born in those various lives,🔽who one's parents were, what kind of happiness and suffering one experienced, what kind of food one ate, and how long one remained in existence.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na don rnam pa gsum ston te /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na don rnam pa gsum ston te /
translated: In brief, it shows three topics:

original: gang gis dran pa dang / gang dran pa dang / ji ltar dran pa'o //🔽de la gang gis dran pa ni sngon gnas pa'i rjes su dran pa'i ye @182a * //

original: shes nyid kyis rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: shes nyid kyis rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: Among them, by what is remembered is by the knowledge of remembering former abodes.

original: gang dran pa ni tshe rabs gcig kyang dran pa nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar du dran pa'o //
analyzed: gang dran pa ni tshe rabs gcig kyang dran pa nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar du dran pa'o //
translated: What is remembered is from remembering one lifetime up to remembering many quintillions of eons.

original: ji ltar dran pa ni rnam pa dang bcas /
analyzed: ji ltar dran pa ni rnam pa dang bcas /
translated: How it is remembered is by remembering with aspects,

original: yul dang bcas /
analyzed: yul dang bcas /
translated: with objects,

original: mtshan ma dang bcas par dran pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas par dran pa'o //
translated: and with signs.

original: stobs dgu pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs dgu pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the ninth power,

analyzed: de mi las shin tu 'das pa'i 'phrul gyi mig rnam par dag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, With the pure divine eye that surpasses the human...

original: de la 'phrul ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'phrul ni bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, divine is the first, second, and so on concentrations.

original: 'phrul gyi mig de yang bsam gtan de de tsam dag la brten pa dang / de'i 'bras bur gyur pa dang / des yongs su zin pa'i phyir 'phrul gyi mig ces bya'o ;🔽/ bsam gtan yongs su rdzogs pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir /

translated: That magical eye is called magical eye because it is based on those meditative concentrations, it is the result of those meditative concentrations, and it is possessed by those meditative concentrations.

original: rnam par thar pa zhes bya'o //🔽'phrul gyi mig de'i ming tsam yang mi la med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa zhes bya'o // 'phrul gyi mig de'i ming tsam yang mi la med pa'i phyir /
translated: It is called liberation because it is the result of perfected meditative concentration and it is the result of liberation.

original: mi las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi las shin tu 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called far superior to the human because even the mere name of that magical eye does not exist among humans.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i lha rnams la ni /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i lha rnams la ni /
translated: Thus, the gods who are born in the desire realm

original: skye gnas thob pa'i 'phrul gyi mig yod pas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'phrul gyi mig ces bya yang /
analyzed: skye gnas thob pa'i 'phrul gyi mig yod pas de dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'phrul gyi mig ces bya yang /
translated: have a magical eye that is obtained through birth, and a magical eye that is similar to that.

original: mi rnams la de tsam yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rnams la de tsam yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: But even that does not exist among humans,

original: mi las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mi las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: so it is far superior to the human.

original: sems can rnams lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dge ba spyad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dge ba spyad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With regard to the phrase “sentient beings who engage in physical, verbal, and mental virtue,”

original: srog gcod pa las ldog pa la sogs pa'i dge ba bcu'i lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyis spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa las ldog pa la sogs pa'i dge ba bcu'i lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyis spyad par bya'o //
translated: One should practice the ten virtues with body, speech, and mind, such as turning away from killing.

original: mi dge ba spyad pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba bcu lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba spyad pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba bcu lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas spyod pa'o //
translated: Practicing non-virtue is engaging in the ten non-virtues with body, speech, and mind, such as killing.

original: dge ba bcu spyad pas lha dang mi'i nang du skye ba ni bde 'gror skye ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu spyad pas lha dang mi'i nang du skye ba ni bde 'gror skye ba'o //
translated: Practicing the ten virtues leads to birth among gods and humans, which is called birth in the happy realms.

original: mi dge ba bcu spyad pas ngan song gsum du ltung ba ni ngan par 'gro bar skye ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu spyad pas ngan song gsum du ltung ba ni ngan par 'gro bar skye ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Practicing the ten non-virtues leads to falling into the three lower realms, which is called birth in the lower realms.

original: sems can gang srog gi dbang po bor ba ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gang srog gi dbang po bor ba ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: When a sentient being loses the faculty of life, that is death.

original: srid pa bar mar skye ba ni 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa bar mar skye ba ni 'pho ba'o //
translated: Being born in the intermediate state is transference.

original: lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rigs su byung ba ni skye bar gyur pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi la sogs pa'i rigs su byung ba ni skye bar gyur pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Arising in the class of gods, humans, and so forth is called birth.

original: 'phrul gyi mig gis sems can tshe rabs gzhan du gang nas gang du ji ltar skye bar mthong ba ni /
analyzed: 'phrul gyi mig gis sems can tshe rabs gzhan du gang nas gang du ji ltar skye bar mthong ba ni /
translated: With the divine eye, one sees where sentient beings will be born in other lifetimes.

original: tshe rabs gzhan rjes su dran pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan rjes su dran pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the power of remembering past lives.

original: stobs bcu pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽zag pa zad pa'i shes rab kyis zag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stobs bcu pa bstan pa'i phyir / zag pa zad pa'i shes rab kyis zag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the tenth power,

original: sems rnam par grol ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Through the wisdom of the exhaustion of defilements, he knows as it truly is the liberation of mind and liberation through wisdom that are undefiled.”

original: bsgom pa dang mthong ba'i lam gyi bag la nyal ma lus par spangs nas /
analyzed: bsgom pa dang mthong ba'i lam gyi bag la nyal ma lus par spangs nas /
translated: Having completely abandoned the latent tendencies of the paths of meditation and seeing,

original: zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba @182b thob pa ni zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba @182b thob pa ni zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: he attains the undefiled discipline, concentration, wisdom, and liberation. This is the exhaustion of defilements.

original: de nas zag pa zad nas bdag gi rgyud la zag pa zad /
analyzed: de nas zag pa zad nas bdag gi rgyud la zag pa zad /
translated: Then, having exhausted the defilements, he attains the wisdom of liberation, thinking, “My continuum has exhausted the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa ni spangs /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni spangs /
translated: Afflictions have been abandoned.

original: srid pa gzhan du mi skye zhes rnam par grol ba'i ye shes thob pa ni /
analyzed: srid pa gzhan du mi skye zhes rnam par grol ba'i ye shes thob pa ni /
translated: I will not be born in another existence.”

original: shes rab kyi zag pa med pa'i rnam par grol ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi zag pa med pa'i rnam par grol ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the wisdom of liberation that is undefiled through the wisdom of the exhaustion of defilements.

original: ji ltar bdag gi rgyud la zag pa zad pa shes bzhin du sems can gzhan gyi rgyud kyi zag pa rnams kyang zad par bya bar mkhyen pa ni zag pa zad pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi rgyud la zag pa zad pa shes bzhin du sems can gzhan gyi rgyud kyi zag pa rnams kyang zad par bya bar mkhyen pa ni zag pa zad pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the extinction of contaminants in one’s own stream of consciousness, and the knowledge of the extinction of contaminants in the streams of consciousness of other sentient beings, is called the power of the knowledge of the extinction of contaminants.

original: de la stobs bcu 'di dag gi rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba dang / ma 'dres pa dang / mnyam pa dang / las byed pa dang / go rims dang / khyad par rnams bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de la stobs bcu 'di dag gi rang bzhin rab tu dbye ba dang / ma 'dres pa dang / mnyam pa dang / las byed pa dang / go rims dang / khyad par rnams bstan par bya'o //
translated: The nature, differentiation, non-confusion, equality, function, sequence, and distinction of these ten powers should be explained.

original: de la stobs bcu rnams kyi rang bzhin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la stobs bcu rnams kyi rang bzhin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the ten powers?

original: 'di dag gi rang bzhin ni zag pa med pa'i dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rang bzhin ni zag pa med pa'i dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Their nature should be understood as the five faculties of faith, etc., which are without outflows.

original: yang na de dag gi nang na shes rab gtso bo yin pas shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na de dag gi nang na shes rab gtso bo yin pas shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Or, since wisdom is predominant among them, their nature should be understood as wisdom.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni stobs bcu 'di dag rnam pa gsum du rab tu phye nas /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni stobs bcu 'di dag rnam pa gsum du rab tu phye nas /
translated: The differentiation of the ten powers is threefold:

original: tshad med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the nature of the immeasurables is as follows.

original: rnam pa gsum ni dus rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam par rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyud rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ni dus rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam par rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyud rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The three aspects are the division of time, the division of types, and the division of streams.

original: de la dus rab tu dbye ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus su gtogs pa'i shes par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dus rab tu dbye ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus su gtogs pa'i shes par bya ba'i dngos po thams cad thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The division of time is the understanding of all knowable things included in the past, future, and present.

original: rnam pa rab tu dbye ba ni 'dus byas kyi dngos po gcig la yang ngang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ji snyed yod pa thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa rab tu dbye ba ni 'dus byas kyi dngos po gcig la yang ngang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ji snyed yod pa thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The division of types is the understanding of all the types of conditioned things, such as the specific characteristics of a thing, its general characteristics, its form, its formlessness, and so on.

original: rgyud rab tu dbye ba ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa na 'dug pa'i sems can so so'i rgyud ci 'dra ba ma lus par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud rab tu dbye ba ni phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa na 'dug pa'i sems can so so'i rgyud ci 'dra ba ma lus par thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The division of streams is the understanding of the individual streams of sentient beings dwelling in the immeasurable world systems of the ten directions.

original: de ltar rnam par dbye ba gsum thugs su chud pas stobs bcu 'di dag tshad med pa'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dbye ba gsum thugs su chud pas stobs bcu 'di dag tshad med pa'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, by understanding these three kinds of distinctions, one should know that these ten powers have the nature of being immeasurable.

original: de la ma 'dres pa'i stobs bcu po 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig la mnga' bar zad gyi /
analyzed: de la ma 'dres pa'i stobs bcu po 'di dag de bzhin gshegs pa nyag gcig la mnga' bar zad gyi /
translated: Among them, the ten powers are unshared, for they exist only in the Tathagata.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa gzhan la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa gzhan la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not exist in others, such as sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: mnyam pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad stobs bcu po 'di dag brnyes par 'dra ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad stobs bcu po 'di dag brnyes par 'dra ste /
translated: Equality means that all Tathagatas are equal in acquiring these ten powers,

original: che chung khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: che chung khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between them in terms of greater or lesser.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ste /🔽sems can gyi don dang sbyar nas skabs kha cig tu la la mngon sum du byed /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas pa zhes bya ste / sems can gyi don dang sbyar nas skabs kha cig tu la la mngon sum du byed /
translated: Therefore, it is said that all Tathagatas abide in equality.🔽In terms of benefiting sentient beings, there is a difference in that in some situations, some are manifested,

original: @183a * // skabs kha cig tu la la mngon sum du mi byed pa tsam gyi khyad par yod do //
analyzed: @183a * // skabs kha cig tu la la mngon sum du mi byed pa tsam gyi khyad par yod do //
translated: and in some situations, some are not manifested.

original: las ni stobs bcu po 'di dag stobs gang gis las gang byed ce na /
analyzed: las ni stobs bcu po 'di dag stobs gang gis las gang byed ce na /
translated: What is the function of these ten powers?

original: de la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa shes pa'i stobs kyis ni rgyu la yang rgyu dang / 'bras bu la yang 'bras bur gnas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen cing rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba'i dge sbyong dang /🔽bram ze rnams tshar gcod do //
analyzed: de la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa shes pa'i stobs kyis ni rgyu la yang rgyu dang / 'bras bu la yang 'bras bur gnas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen cing rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams tshar gcod do //
translated: The power of knowledge of the possible and impossible functions to know exactly what is possible and impossible, to know exactly what is the cause and what is the result, and to refute ascetics and brahmins who propound noncauses and discordant causes.

original: rang gi las shes pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis ni rang gi las byas pa rnams rang nyid kyis 'bras bu rnam par myong ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen cing sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams dang / 'pho bar smra ba'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams tshar gcod do //
analyzed: rang gi las shes pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis ni rang gi las byas pa rnams rang nyid kyis 'bras bu rnam par myong ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen cing sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams dang / 'pho bar smra ba'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams tshar gcod do //
translated: The power of knowledge of one's deeds are one's own functions to know exactly that one experiences the results of one's own deeds and to refute ascetics and brahmins who propound the transference of karma.🔽The power of knowledge of the absorptions, liberations, concentrations, and so on functions to attain the uncontaminated absorptions and so on and to teach disciples the contaminated ones.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / gdams pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can rnams btul nas /🔽yang dag pa'i gdams ngag ston par mdzad cing lta ba so sor mi mthun pa dang 'gal bar smra zhing /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / gdams pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis sems can rnams btul nas / yang dag pa'i gdams ngag ston par mdzad cing lta ba so sor mi mthun pa dang 'gal bar smra zhing /
translated: By the power of knowing the absorptions, the liberations, the concentrations, and the meditative attainments, he tames beings by means of the miracle of teaching, the miracle of instruction, and the miracle of psychic power.

original: phyir rgol ba'i bram ze dang / dge sbyong rnams tshar gcod do //🔽dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis sems can rnams kyi dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang tha ma la sogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing de dag la ci rigs par so sor dam pa'i chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba'i bram ze dang / dge sbyong rnams tshar gcod do // dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis sems can rnams kyi dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang tha ma la sogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing de dag la ci rigs par so sor dam pa'i chos ston par byed do //
translated: He teaches the true instructions and refutes the brahmans and ascetics who are his adversaries, who have different views and who speak in contradiction.🔽By the power of knowing the different aspirations of beings, he knows the aspirations of beings and teaches them the Dharma accordingly.

original: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /
translated: By the power of knowing the different elements of beings, he knows the faculties of beings, their sharp, middling, and dull faculties, and so forth, just as they are, and he teaches them the excellent Dharma individually and appropriately.🔽By the power of knowing the paths that lead everywhere, he knows the paths that lead to all destinations, and he teaches the path that leads to liberation.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos la mos pa chen po dang / 'bring dang / mos pa chung ngu la sogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen cing dge ba la mos pa rnams kyi dge ba 'phel bar mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i chos la mos pa chen po dang / 'bring dang / mos pa chung ngu la sogs pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen cing dge ba la mos pa rnams kyi dge ba 'phel bar mdzad pa dang /
translated: The power of knowledge of the various dhātus correctly knows the great, middling, and small degrees of interest in virtue and nonvirtue and so on and increases the virtue of those with interest in virtue.

original: mi dge ba la mos pa rnams kyi mi dge ba spong du 'dzud pa mdzad do //
analyzed: mi dge ba la mos pa rnams kyi mi dge ba spong du 'dzud pa mdzad do //
translated: It causes those with interest in nonvirtue to abandon nonvirtue.

original: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni rigs chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / rigs chen po rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen cing dbang po ji lta ba bzhin pa dang bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin pa dang / bag la nyal ji lta ba bzhin du bsgral bar bya ba'i sgo de dang de dag la ci rigs par sbyong bar mdzad do //
analyzed: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni rigs chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / rigs chen po rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen cing dbang po ji lta ba bzhin pa dang bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin pa dang / bag la nyal ji lta ba bzhin du bsgral bar bya ba'i sgo de dang de dag la ci rigs par sbyong bar mdzad do //
translated: The power of knowledge of the various dhātus correctly knows the small, middling, and great dhātus and, in accordance with their faculties, dispositions, and latent propensities, it causes them to be liberated by means of the appropriate doors of liberation.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis ni sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'byung bar byed pa'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis ni sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'byung bar byed pa'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud /
translated: The knowledge of the path that leads everywhere correctly understands the path that leads out of all suffering.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad las 'byung bar mi byed pa'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su @183b chud nas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad las 'byung bar mi byed pa'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su @183b chud nas /
translated: Correctly understanding the path that does not lead out of all suffering,

original: 'byung bar mi byed pa'i lam spangs te /
analyzed: 'byung bar mi byed pa'i lam spangs te /
translated: he abandons the path that does not lead out of suffering.

original: 'byung bar byed pa'i lam la yang dag par 'god par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'byung bar byed pa'i lam la yang dag par 'god par mdzad do //
translated: He establishes beings on the path that leads out of suffering.🔽By the power of remembering past lives, he causes beings to remember and understand how they were born in the past.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i stobs kyis ni sems can rnams sngon gyi mthar ji ltar skyes pa dang / 'byung ba rnams dran pa dang / shes par mdzad nas skyob dang / dad pa bskyed de chos 'chad par mdzad cing ther zug tu smra ba'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams tshar gcod do //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i stobs kyis ni sems can rnams sngon gyi mthar ji ltar skyes pa dang / 'byung ba rnams dran pa dang / shes par mdzad nas skyob dang / dad pa bskyed de chos 'chad par mdzad cing ther zug tu smra ba'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams tshar gcod do //
translated: He generates faith and teaches the Dharma, and he defeats the ascetics and brahmins who propound eternalism.

original: 'chi 'pho mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis ni //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis ni //
translated: By the knowledge of death and rebirth,

original: bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyen thos ji ltar dus 'das pa dang / phyis ji ltar skye ba lung ston par 'gyur zhing 'chad par smra ba'i dge sbyong dang bram ze tshar gcod do //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pas 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyen thos ji ltar dus 'das pa dang / phyis ji ltar skye ba lung ston par 'gyur zhing 'chad par smra ba'i dge sbyong dang bram ze tshar gcod do //
translated: The Tathagata proclaims the past and future disciples of the three times, and refutes the claims of the ascetics and Brahmins who propound the doctrine of a creator.

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni nyid kyi rnam par grol ba la the tshom mi mnga'/
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni nyid kyi rnam par grol ba la the tshom mi mnga'/
translated: By the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of the contaminants, he is free from doubt and uncertainty regarding his own liberation.

original: yid gnyis mi mnga' zhing dgra bcom pa thob par mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams tshar gcod do //
analyzed: yid gnyis mi mnga' zhing dgra bcom pa thob par mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyi dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams tshar gcod do //
translated: He refutes the claims of the ascetics and Brahmins who are full of pride regarding the attainment of Arhatship.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams kyi las so //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu rnams kyi las so //
translated: This is the function of the ten powers of the Tathagata.

original: de la stobs bcu po de dag gi rim pa ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la stobs bcu po de dag gi rim pa ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one understand the order of the ten powers?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas pa na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams bla na med pa'i byang chub mngon par sangs rgyas pa na /
translated: When the Tathagatas have fully awakened to supreme enlightenment,

original: stobs bcu po 'di dag dus gcig tu thams cad thob ste /
analyzed: stobs bcu po 'di dag dus gcig tu thams cad thob ste /
translated: they acquire all ten powers at the same time.

original: dus gcig tu thob nas rim gyis mngon sum du mdzad do //
analyzed: dus gcig tu thob nas rim gyis mngon sum du mdzad do //
translated: Having attained them simultaneously, he actualizes them in sequence.

original: de la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa dang po nyid du gnas pa dang / gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis gzigs par mdzad do //🔽de ltar gzigs nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba /
analyzed: de la mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas ma thag tu de bzhin gshegs pa rnams chos kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa dang po nyid du gnas pa dang / gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis gzigs par mdzad do // de ltar gzigs nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi sems can 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba /
translated: Immediately after perfect buddhahood, the tathāgatas first perceive with the wisdom that knows the basis and nonbasis the presentation of the cause and effect of phenomena.

original: thob par 'dod pa rnams la rang gi las mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis mi dge ba'i las spang bar bya ba dang / dge ba'i las bsgrub par bya ba'i thabs ston to //
analyzed: thob par 'dod pa rnams la rang gi las mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis mi dge ba'i las spang bar bya ba dang / dge ba'i las bsgrub par bya ba'i thabs ston to //
translated: Having perceived that, they teach sentient beings of the desire realm who wish to attain a pleasant result the means to abandon nonvirtuous karma and to accomplish virtuous karma through the power of their wisdom that knows their individual karmas.

original: de la yang gang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags spang bar 'dod pa'i sems can rnams la bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang gang 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags spang bar 'dod pa'i sems can rnams la bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, for the sake of sentient beings who wish to eliminate attachment through the mundane path, the Buddha, by means of the power of knowledge of the absorptions, deliverances, concentrations and meditative attainments, causes them to become free from mundane attachment.

original: 'jig rten gyi lam thob par bya ba'i don du /🔽gdams ngag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston par mdzad do //🔽'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams la ni stobs lhag ma bdun gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par bya @184a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lam thob par bya ba'i don du / gdams ngag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston par mdzad do // 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams la ni stobs lhag ma bdun gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par bya @184a * //
translated: For those sentient beings who wish to abandon attachment by the mundane path, he teaches the mundane path in order to obtain the mundane detachment through the power of knowing the concentrations, liberations, samādhis and absorptions.

original: ba'i phyir chos ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: ba'i phyir chos ston par mdzad do //
translated: For those who wish to abandon attachment by the supramundane path, he teaches the Dharma through the remaining seven powers in order to obtain supramundane detachment.

original: ji lta zhe na dang por dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'dod pa rnams kyi dbang po gzigs par mdzad do //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na dang por dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'dod pa rnams kyi dbang po gzigs par mdzad do //
translated: How is it? First, by the power of knowing the supreme and not supreme faculties, he sees the faculties of those who desire to attain the supramundane freedom from attachment.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu dbang po brtags nas /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu dbang po brtags nas /
translated: Then, after that, having examined the faculties,

original: mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis bsam pa la rnam par gzigs par mdzad do //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis bsam pa la rnam par gzigs par mdzad do //
translated: by the power of knowing the various inclinations, he sees their intentions.

original: de nas khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis de'i 'og tu bag la nyal rnam par gzigs par mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis de'i 'og tu bag la nyal rnam par gzigs par mdzad do //
translated: Then, by the power of knowing the various elements, he sees their dormant tendencies.

original: de ltar dbang po dang bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba mkhyen nas /
analyzed: de ltar dbang po dang bsam pa dang bag la nyal ba mkhyen nas /
translated: Thus, knowing the faculties, intentions, and dormant tendencies,

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ci rigs par dmigs pa dang ; bsgral bar bya ba'i sgo la sgrol bar mdzad do //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ci rigs par dmigs pa dang ; bsgral bar bya ba'i sgo la sgrol bar mdzad do //
translated: by the power of knowing the paths that go everywhere, he liberates them from the door of the object to be liberated, as is appropriate.

original: de nas sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i stobs dang 'chi 'pho ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis de'i 'og tu dmigs pa dang bsgral ba'i sgo la rab tu sbyar bas sems gnas par byas pa dang / spyod pa yongs su dag par byas nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba dang /🔽thar zug dang chad par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis spang ba dbu ma'i lam yang dag par ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i stobs dang 'chi 'pho ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis de'i 'og tu dmigs pa dang bsgral ba'i sgo la rab tu sbyar bas sems gnas par byas pa dang / spyod pa yongs su dag par byas nas 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba dang / thar zug dang chad par lta ba'i mtha' gnyis spang ba dbu ma'i lam yang dag par ston par mdzad do //
translated: Then, by the power of remembering past lives and the power of knowing death and rebirth, he applies himself to the door of liberation of the object of observation and liberation, and having stabilized his mind and purified his conduct, he teaches the middle path that abandons the two extremes of the view of the transitory collection and the view of annihilation.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis de ltar yang dag par zhugs shing zhi gnas kyis brtan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis de ltar yang dag par zhugs shing zhi gnas kyis brtan par 'gyur la /
translated: Then, after that, by the power of knowing the exhaustion of contaminants, he teaches the abandonment of manifest pride to those who have entered the path in that way, who have become stable through śamatha,

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal ma spangs te /
translated: who have not abandoned the latent afflictions,

original: mngon du rgyu ba tsam dang bral ba la bya ba ma byas kyang bya ba byas pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal skye ba rnams kyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal spong bar mdzad de //
analyzed: mngon du rgyu ba tsam dang bral ba la bya ba ma byas kyang bya ba byas pas mngon pa'i nga rgyal skye ba rnams kyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal spong bar mdzad de //
translated: and who have not performed the action of merely being free from manifest activity but have performed the action of having done it.

original: 'di yang thang cig stobs kyis rim pa rnam pa gcig go //
analyzed: 'di yang thang cig stobs kyis rim pa rnam pa gcig go //
translated: This is also one type of stage by the power of an instant.

original: de la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / rang gi las mkhyen pa'i stobs la khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: de la gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / rang gi las mkhyen pa'i stobs la khyad par ci yod /
translated: What is the difference between the power of knowledge of proper and improper conditions and the power of knowledge of one’s former abodes?

original: smras pa / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni las dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams las 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba 'byung bar thugs su chud la /
analyzed: smras pa / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni las dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams las 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba 'byung bar thugs su chud la /
translated: It is said: By the power of knowledge of proper and improper conditions, one understands that pleasant and unpleasant results arise from virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: rang gi las mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: rang gi las mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /
translated: By the power of knowledge of one’s former abodes,

original: gang gi las dge ba dang mi dge ba byas pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba 'byung bar thugs su chud de khyad par ni yod do //
analyzed: gang gi las dge ba dang mi dge ba byas pa de nyid kyi 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba 'byung bar thugs su chud de khyad par ni yod do //
translated: one understands that the pleasant and unpleasant results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions arise for the one who performs them.

original: de la rang gi las mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang gang snyoms par 'jug pa de nyid kyis de 'thob bo zhes thugs su chud la /
analyzed: de la rang gi las mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang gang snyoms par 'jug pa de nyid kyis de 'thob bo zhes thugs su chud la /
translated: he knows that one will attain that very meditative stabilization, liberation, or meditative absorption in which one is engaged.🔽By the power of meditative stabilization, liberation, and meditative absorption,🔽he knows that one will attain that very meditative stabilization, liberation, or meditative absorption in which one is engaged.🔽By the power of meditative stabilization, liberation, and meditative absorption,🔽he knows that one will attain that very meditative stabilization, liberation, or meditative absorption in which one is engaged.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs kyis ni /
translated: By the power of meditative stabilization, liberation, and meditative absorption,🔽he knows that one will attain that very meditative stabilization, liberation, or meditative absorption in which one is engaged.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa'i de dag nyid la brten nas /🔽'dul ba @184b rnams la cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis ni ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa'i de dag nyid la brten nas / 'dul ba @184b rnams la cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum gyis ni ston par mdzad do //
translated: By the power of meditative stabilization, liberation, and meditative absorption,🔽he knows that one will attain that very meditative stabilization, liberation, or meditative absorption in which one is engaged.🔽By the power of meditative stabilization, liberation, and meditative absorption,🔽he knows that one will attain that very meditative stabilization, liberation, or meditative absorption in which one is engaged.🔽By the power of meditative stabilization, liberation, and meditative absorption,

original: de la bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs kyis dad pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i sems spyi tsam du mkhyen la /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs kyis dad pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i sems spyi tsam du mkhyen la /
translated: he knows that one will attain that very meditative stabilization, liberation, or meditative absorption in which one is engaged.🔽By the power of meditative stabilization, liberation, and meditative absorption,🔽he knows that one will attain that very meditative stabilization, liberation, or meditative absorption in which one is engaged.🔽By the power of meditative stabilization, liberation, and meditative absorption,🔽he knows that one will attain that very meditative stabilization, liberation, or meditative absorption in which one is engaged.🔽By the power of meditative stabilization, liberation, and meditative absorption,🔽he knows that one will attain that very meditative stabilization, liberation, or meditative absorption in which one is engaged.🔽By the power of meditative stabilization, liberation, and meditative absorption,🔽he knows that one will attain that very meditative stabilization, liberation, or meditative absorption in which one is engaged.🔽By the power of meditative stabilization, liberation, and meditative absorption,🔽he knows that one will attain that very meditative stabilization, liberation, or meditative absorption in which one is

original: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni dad pa la sogs pa de nyid chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rang bzhin so sor 'byed par mdzad do //
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni dad pa la sogs pa de nyid chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'i rang bzhin so sor 'byed par mdzad do //
translated: By the power of knowledge of the supreme and not supreme faculties, he distinguishes the natures of those such as faith as lesser, middling, or great.

original: de la dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid kyang tshe rabs snga ma na chos gang dang gang dag la bsam pa ji ltar zhugs pa'i bsam pa mkhyen la /
analyzed: de la dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis dad pa la sogs pa de dag nyid kyang tshe rabs snga ma na chos gang dang gang dag la bsam pa ji ltar zhugs pa'i bsam pa mkhyen la /
translated: Therein, by the power of knowledge of the supreme and not supreme faculties, he knows the resolve of those such as faith in terms of the Dharma and the manner of engagement in former lives.

original: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bsam pa de dag nyid la yang /
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bsam pa de dag nyid la yang /
translated: By the power of knowledge of various higher interests, he knows the various aspects of those very resolves.

original: 'di ni 'dod chags kyi bsam pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags kyi bsam pa dang bcas pa /
translated: This one has a resolve accompanied by attachment.

original: 'di ni zhe sdang gi bsam pa dang bcas pa zhes bsam pa de nyid la rnam pa sna tshogs su 'byed pa mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'di ni zhe sdang gi bsam pa dang bcas pa zhes bsam pa de nyid la rnam pa sna tshogs su 'byed pa mkhyen to //
translated: This one has a resolve accompanied by anger.

original: bsam pa de yang mdor bsdu na rnam par dbye ba drug ste /
analyzed: bsam pa de yang mdor bsdu na rnam par dbye ba drug ste /
translated: That resolve is also summarized as sixfold:

original: dbyung ba ma yin pa'i bsam pa dang / 'byung ba'i bsam pa dang / rnam par dag pa thag ring ba'i bsam pa dang / rnam par dag pa dang nye ba'i bsam pa dang / mthong ba'i chos nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang /
analyzed: dbyung ba ma yin pa'i bsam pa dang / 'byung ba'i bsam pa dang / rnam par dag pa thag ring ba'i bsam pa dang / rnam par dag pa dang nye ba'i bsam pa dang / mthong ba'i chos nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa dang /
translated: the intention of non-emergence, the intention of emergence, the intention of distant purification, the intention of near purification, the intention of desiring to attain nirvana in this very life,

original: ma 'ongs pa na mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: and the intention of desiring to attain nirvana in the future.

original: de la 'byung ba ma yin pa'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'byung ba ma yin pa'i bsam pa ni /
translated: The intention of non-emergence is

original: mthu che ba dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i bstan pa la mos pa rnams kyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: mthu che ba dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i bstan pa la mos pa rnams kyi bsam pa'o //
translated: the intention of those who are very powerful and those who are devoted to the teachings of Brahma and so on.

original: 'byung ba'i bsam pa ni theg pa gsum la mos pa rnams kyi bsam pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i bsam pa ni theg pa gsum la mos pa rnams kyi bsam pa'o //
translated: The intention of emergence is the intention of those devoted to the three vehicles.

original: rnam par dag pa thag ring ba'i bsam pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu dang 'bring du sbyin pa la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa thag ring ba'i bsam pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu dang 'bring du sbyin pa la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The intention of distant purification is that of those who are established in the small and medium roots of virtue.

original: rnam par dag pa thag nye ba'i bsam pa ni gang dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa thag nye ba'i bsam pa ni gang dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The attitude of being close to purity is that of those who are established in the great roots of virtue.

original: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The attitude of desiring to attain nirvana in this very life is that of the noble disciples and so on.

original: ma 'ongs pa na mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa ni /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'dod pa'i bsam pa ni /
translated: The attitude of desiring to attain nirvana in the future is that of

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: those who are not yet noble.🔽The attitude of not desiring either is that of the tathagatas.

original: de la mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis ni mos pa'i rgyu la 'byung ba'i sa bon tsam du thugs su chud do //
analyzed: de la mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis ni mos pa'i rgyu la 'byung ba'i sa bon tsam du thugs su chud do //
translated: Among these, the knowledge of various inclinations comprehends the cause of inclination as merely the seed of occurrence.

original: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis ni sa bon de nyid rnam par phye nas rnam pa du mar mkhyen to //
analyzed: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis ni sa bon de nyid rnam par phye nas rnam pa du mar mkhyen to //
translated: The knowledge of various elements comprehends that seed as divided into many aspects.

original: khams de phye na mdor rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: khams de phye na mdor rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: When that element is divided, it is in brief of four kinds.

original: rang bzhin la gnas pa'i sa bon dang / goms pa las byung ba'i sa bon dang / dag par 'gyur ba'i sa bon dang / dag par mi 'gyur ba'i sa bon no //🔽de la rang bzhin @185a * //🔽la gnas pa'i sa bon ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin la gnas pa'i sa bon dang / goms pa las byung ba'i sa bon dang / dag par 'gyur ba'i sa bon dang / dag par mi 'gyur ba'i sa bon no // de la rang bzhin @185a * // la gnas pa'i sa bon ni /
translated: the seed that abides naturally, the seed that arises from cultivation, the seed that will be purified, and the seed that will not be purified.

original: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas theg pa gsum gyi rigs rang bzhin gyis yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas theg pa gsum gyi rigs rang bzhin gyis yod pa'o //
translated: The seed that abides naturally is the naturally existing gene for the three vehicles, existing from beginningless time.

original: goms pa las byung ba'i sa bon ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la goms par byas pa las rigs su smin pa'i sa bon brtas par bsags pa'o //
analyzed: goms pa las byung ba'i sa bon ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la goms par byas pa las rigs su smin pa'i sa bon brtas par bsags pa'o //
translated: The seed that arises from cultivation is the seed that has been increased by the development of roots of virtue.

original: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i sa bon ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'i chos can rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i sa bon ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba'i chos can rnams so //
translated: The seed that will be purified is that of those who will attain final nirvāṇa.

original: rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ba'i sa bon ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par dag par mi 'gyur ba'i sa bon ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba rnams so //
translated: The seed that will not be purified is that of those who will not attain final nirvāṇa.

original: de la khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni sa bon dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam la 'dzud pas mkhyen to //
analyzed: de la khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni sa bon dang rjes su mthun pa'i lam la 'dzud pas mkhyen to //
translated: The power of knowledge of the various dhātus knows these seeds and causes one to enter the path that is appropriate to them.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni lam 'di kun nas nyon mongs pa can /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni lam 'di kun nas nyon mongs pa can /
translated: This path is defiled,

original: 'di ni rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par byang ba dang ldan pa /
translated: this is associated with purification,🔽this leads to complete purification,

original: 'di ni shin tu rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba /🔽'di ni thang cig rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'o zhes ji snyed du lam gyi rnam par dbye ba yod pa thams cad ma lus par mkhyen to //🔽de la kun tu 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni sngon gyi mtha' dang sngon gyi mtha'i lam rgyud lnga'i rgyu dang bcas pa mkhyen la /
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba / 'di ni thang cig rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'o zhes ji snyed du lam gyi rnam par dbye ba yod pa thams cad ma lus par mkhyen to // de la kun tu 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni sngon gyi mtha' dang sngon gyi mtha'i lam rgyud lnga'i rgyu dang bcas pa mkhyen la /
translated: this leads to momentary purification.🔽By the power of knowing the paths that lead everywhere, he knows the past and the paths of the past with their five causes.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i stobs kyis ni /
translated: By the power of knowing the recollection of past lives, he knows the future and the paths of the future with their five causes.

original: sngon gyi mtha' yang tha snyad rnam par brgyad dang 'brel ba'i spyod pa rnam pa drug rab tu phye nas de la sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i stobs kyis ni sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams nas sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba mkhyen la /🔽'chi 'pho shes pa'i stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' yang tha snyad rnam par brgyad dang 'brel ba'i spyod pa rnam pa drug rab tu phye nas de la sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i stobs kyis ni sngon gyi mtha' las brtsams nas sems can rnams kyi 'chi 'pho ba mkhyen la / 'chi 'pho shes pa'i stobs kyis ni /
translated: The power of the knowledge of previous abodes and deaths and rebirths is the knowledge of the deaths and rebirths of sentient beings from the beginning.

original: sems can rnams kyi phyi ma'i mtha' ji ltar skye ba dang / 'chi ba mkhyen to //🔽de la 'chi 'pho ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni rang gi don mthar thug par ma byas pa rnams ma 'ongs pa na yang skye ba'i mtshams sbyor ro zhes mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi phyi ma'i mtha' ji ltar skye ba dang / 'chi ba mkhyen to // de la 'chi 'pho ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni rang gi don mthar thug par ma byas pa rnams ma 'ongs pa na yang skye ba'i mtshams sbyor ro zhes mkhyen to //
translated: The power of the knowledge of death and rebirth is the knowledge of the future abodes of sentient beings.🔽The power of the knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants is the knowledge of the attainment of nirvana in this life by those who have completed their tasks and liberated their minds.

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /🔽gang rang gi bya ba mthar thug cing /🔽sems rnam par grol ba rnams mthong ba'i chos nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mkhyen to //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /🔽gang rang gi bya ba mthar thug cing /🔽sems rnam par grol ba rnams mthong ba'i chos nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par mkhyen to //
translated: The power of the knowledge of previous abodes and deaths and rebirths is the knowledge of the future rebirths of those who have not completed their own goals.

original: de ltar na stobs bcu po de dag phan tshun khyad med pa dang khyad yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na stobs bcu po de dag phan tshun khyad med pa dang khyad yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these ten powers should be understood as both undifferentiated and differentiated.

original: stobs bcu bstan pa'i 'og tu mi 'jigs pa bzhi bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: stobs bcu bstan pa'i 'og tu mi 'jigs pa bzhi bstan pas ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: After teaching the ten powers, in order to teach the four forms of fearlessness as they are presented in the sutras, he says,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What are the four forms of fearlessness of the Tathagata?

original: de la mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽bag tsha ba med pa 'am /
analyzed: de la mi 'jigs pa zhes bya ba ni / bag tsha ba med pa 'am /
translated: Here, fearlessness means🔽absence of anxiety

original: spa gong ba med pa ste /
analyzed: spa gong ba med pa ste /
translated: or absence of trembling.

original: de yang nyan thos dang thun mong du ma gyur ba'i shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad mngon par sangs rgyas par 'khor gyi nang du dam @185b bcas pa dang / nyan thos dang thun mong du gyur pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba 'khor gyi nang du dam bcas pa dang /
analyzed: de yang nyan thos dang thun mong du ma gyur ba'i shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad mngon par sangs rgyas par 'khor gyi nang du dam @185b bcas pa dang / nyan thos dang thun mong du gyur pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba 'khor gyi nang du dam bcas pa dang /
translated: Moreover, it is the proclamation in the midst of the assembly that one is liberated from the obscurations to omniscience that are not shared with the Sravakas, and the proclamation in the midst of the assembly that one is liberated from the obscurations that are the afflictions that are shared with the Sravakas, having fully awakened to all phenomena in every respect.

original: rnam par grol bar 'dod pa'i sems can rnams sdug bsngal las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar 'dod pa'i sems can rnams sdug bsngal las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of sentient beings who desire liberation,🔽I have promised to teach the path that leads beyond suffering,🔽and I have promised to abandon those that are obstacles to attaining that path itself.🔽Even though the gods, humans, and so forth, who are holy and unholy, debate, I see no occasion or sign that would undermine me, and so I remain fearless.

original: 'byung ba'i lam bstan par dam bcas pa dang / lam de nyid 'thob pa'i gegs su gyur pa rnams spang bar bya'o zhes rnam pa bzhi dam bcas pa la dam pa dang dam par ma gyur pa'i lha dang / mi la sogs pas brgal kyang tshugs par 'gyur ba'i skabs dang mtshan ma ma mthong nas bag tsha ba med par gnas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i lam bstan par dam bcas pa dang / lam de nyid 'thob pa'i gegs su gyur pa rnams spang bar bya'o zhes rnam pa bzhi dam bcas pa la dam pa dang dam par ma gyur pa'i lha dang / mi la sogs pas brgal kyang tshugs par 'gyur ba'i skabs dang mtshan ma ma mthong nas bag tsha ba med par gnas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the four fearlessnesses of the Tathagata.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das yang dag par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das yang dag par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Blessed One is perfectly and completely enlightened.

original: 'jig rten du dge sbyong dang bram ze chos mthun pa sus kyang ma bskor ba'i tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba yan chad kyis nyan thos dang / thun mong du ma gyur ba'i shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba dang /🔽rnam pa thams cad du chos mngon par sangs rgyas par dam bcas pa la mi 'jigs pa bstan te /🔽'di ni mi 'jigs pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten du dge sbyong dang bram ze chos mthun pa sus kyang ma bskor ba'i tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba yan chad kyis nyan thos dang / thun mong du ma gyur ba'i shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du chos mngon par sangs rgyas par dam bcas pa la mi 'jigs pa bstan te / 'di ni mi 'jigs pa dang po'o //
translated: The first fearlessness is indicated by the passage beginning with “He set in motion the unsurpassed Dharma wheel that had not been set in motion in the world by any mendicant, brahmin, god, Mara, Brahma, or anyone else,” up to “He liberated those previously liberated by others.”

original: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pas bar chad kyi chos su gsungs pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pas bar chad kyi chos su gsungs pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The second fearlessness is indicated by the passage beginning with “Whatever the Tathagata declares to be a teaching leading to the cessation of suffering,” up to “He is not afraid, not terrified, not fearful.”🔽The third fearlessness is indicated by the passage beginning with “Whatever the Tathagata declares to be an obstruction,” up to “He is not afraid, not terrified, not fearful.”

original: ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa 'di la de gang gis zhes snga ma bzhin pa dang zhes bya ba yan chad kyis lam de nyid 'thob pa'i gegs su 'gyur ba spang bar dam bcas pa ste /🔽'di ni mi 'jigs pa gnyis pa'o //🔽gang yang des 'phags pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur zhes pa 'di la de gang gis zhes snga ma bzhin pa dang zhes bya ba yan chad kyis lam de nyid 'thob pa'i gegs su 'gyur ba spang bar dam bcas pa ste /🔽'di ni mi 'jigs pa gnyis pa'o //🔽gang yang des 'phags pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The fourth fearlessness is indicated by the passage beginning with “Whatever the Tathagata declares to be the path leading to liberation,” up to “He is not afraid, not terrified, not fearful.”

original: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba yang chad kyis rnam par thar pa 'dod pa'i sems can rnams sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba yang chad kyis rnam par thar pa 'dod pa'i sems can rnams sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “just as before” refers to the fact that, in order to help sentient beings who are desirous of liberation to transcend suffering,🔽

original: lam bstan par dam bcas par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: lam bstan par dam bcas par bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase as before indicates the vow to teach the path in order to help sentient beings who desire liberation to transcend suffering.

original: 'di ni mi 'jigs pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'jigs pa gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third fearlessness.

original: zag pa zad pa'o zhes bya ba nas tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba 'di ni zhes bya ba yan chad kyis nyan thos dang thun mong du gyur pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar dam bcas pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'o zhes bya ba nas tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba 'di ni zhes bya ba yan chad kyis nyan thos dang thun mong du gyur pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar dam bcas pa ste /
translated: The phrase I declare that I have exhausted all the defilements indicates the vow to become liberated from the afflictive obstructions, which is shared with the sravakas.

original: 'di ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi 'jigs pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth fearlessness.

original: 'di bcom ldan 'das yang dag par mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes bdag rab tu shes te zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs nas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam pa rnams ye shes kyis mngon sum du
analyzed: 'di bcom ldan 'das yang dag par mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes bdag rab tu shes te zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs nas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos kyi rnam pa rnams ye shes kyis mngon sum du
translated: The phrase I fully and perfectly realize the dharmas that are the obstructions to omniscience indicates the vow to become liberated from the obstructions to omniscience.

original: mdzad par rang nyid kyis thugs su chud pa ni yang dag par mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes bdag rub tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdzad par rang nyid kyis thugs su chud pa ni yang dag par mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes bdag rub tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that I have fully awakened to the realization of the deeds is called self-knowledge.

original: khyod kyis chos 'di mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes 'di @186a * //🔽la de lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang bdud du bcas pa'i dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: khyod kyis chos 'di mngon par sangs rgyas so zhes 'di @186a * // la de lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang bdud du bcas pa'i dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: You have fully awakened to this Dharma, and so on.

original: chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa des sangs rgyas so zhes dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyis brgal kyang /
analyzed: chos mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa des sangs rgyas so zhes dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyis brgal kyang /
translated: Here, even if the world with its gods, Māra, and Brahmā, and so on, were to dispute, saying, This Dharma has not been fully awakened to by you,

original: sangs ma rgyas pa'i mtshan ma mthong zhing tshugs par mi 'gyur ba mthong nas /
analyzed: sangs ma rgyas pa'i mtshan ma mthong zhing tshugs par mi 'gyur ba mthong nas /
translated: seeing the signs of non-awakening and not being able to stand it,

original: 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral te /
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral te /
translated: they would be free from all fear.

original: dogs pa med par 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra sgrogs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dogs pa med par 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra sgrogs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Without hesitation, one should roar the lion's roar in the assembly.

original: de la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the world with its gods means

original: dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i lha dang mi spyi la bya bar ston to //
analyzed: dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i lha dang mi spyi la bya bar ston to //
translated: This shows that the Buddha is not refuted by the gods and humans, whether holy or not.

original: lha dam pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i dbang phyug bdud dang / rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: lha dam pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i dbang phyug bdud dang / rnal 'byor gyi dbang phyug tshangs pa'o //
translated: The holy gods are the lord of the desire realm, Mara, and the lord of yoga, Brahma.

original: mi dam pa ni dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams te /
analyzed: mi dam pa ni dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams te /
translated: The holy humans are the ascetics and brahmins.

original: de dag shes pa dang ldan la rgyal pos kyang mchod par bya ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag shes pa dang ldan la rgyal pos kyang mchod par bya ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are endowed with knowledge and are worthy of the king’s offerings.

original: lha dang mi dam pa ma yin pa ni de las gzhan pa'i lha dang mi la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lha dang mi dam pa ma yin pa ni de las gzhan pa'i lha dang mi la sogs pa ste /
translated: The unholy gods and humans are the others, such as the gods and humans.

original: de dag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas par brtsad cing brgal kyang chos rnams mtha' mthong ba'i mtshan ma yod par ma gzigs la gtan tshigs kyis tshugs par ma gzigs pas na /🔽rtsod par byed pa'i mtshan ma ma mthong ste zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas par brtsad cing brgal kyang chos rnams mtha' mthong ba'i mtshan ma yod par ma gzigs la gtan tshigs kyis tshugs par ma gzigs pas na / rtsod par byed pa'i mtshan ma ma mthong ste zhes bya'o //
translated: Even though they debate and dispute with the Buddha, who is fully enlightened, he does not see any sign of seeing the extremes of phenomena, nor does he see any basis for reasoning.🔽Therefore, it is said that “he does not see any sign of dispute.”

original: mtshan ma mthong bas zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma mthong bas zhes bya bas ni /
translated: “Seeing signs” means

original: gtan tshigs kyis tshugs pa'i rgyu ma mthong bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyis tshugs pa'i rgyu ma mthong bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “not seeing a cause for the establishment of a reason” is that he does not see a cause for the establishment of a reason.

original: lus kyi spu ldang ba dang tshig 'dar ba mi mnga' ba brnyes pas /
analyzed: lus kyi spu ldang ba dang tshig 'dar ba mi mnga' ba brnyes pas /
translated: He has attained the state of not having body hair stand on end or voice tremble.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bde ba rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bde ba rnyed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the Tathāgata who has attained happiness.

original: sems spa gong ba med pa rnyed pas /
analyzed: sems spa gong ba med pa rnyed pas /
translated: He has attained the state of not having a mind that is overwhelmed.

original: 'jigs pa med pa rnyed pa la gnas te zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa rnyed pa la gnas te zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the one who abides in the attainment of fearlessness.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gnas bla na med pa yin la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gnas bla na med pa yin la /
translated: Nirvāṇa is the unsurpassed state.

original: de yang 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pas thob cing de thob nas kyang 'tshe ba dang 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba yin pas /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa'i lam bsgoms pas thob cing de thob nas kyang 'tshe ba dang 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba yin pas /
translated: Moreover, it is attained through the cultivation of the noble path. And, having attained it, one is free from all harm and fear.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni khyu mchog gi gnas te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni khyu mchog gi gnas te /
translated: Therefore, nirvāṇa is the state of the bull.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de mngon sum du mdzad pas na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de mngon sum du mdzad pas na /
translated: By actualizing that nirvāṇa,

original: khyu mchog gi gnas rab tu mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyu mchog gi gnas rab tu mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he is called the one who knows the state of the bull.

original: ston pa bla na med par dam bcas pa phun sum tshogs par bdag nyid khas len cing bstan pa na /
analyzed: ston pa bla na med par dam bcas pa phun sum tshogs par bdag nyid khas len cing bstan pa na /
translated: When he has fully accepted and taught the perfection of the unsurpassed teacher’s vow,

original: de las gzhan pa'i ston pa rnams tshar gcod pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad skrag par mdzad cing 'khor gyi spa gong ba med par gsung rgya chen po sgrogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ston pa rnams tshar gcod pa dang / phas kyi rgol ba thams cad skrag par mdzad cing 'khor gyi spa gong ba med par gsung rgya chen po sgrogs pa'i phyir /
translated: He is the one who, in the midst of the assembly, roars the great lion's roar, for he has vanquished all other teachers and frightened all adversaries, and he does so without intimidating his audience.

original: 'khor gyi nang du gshegs nas yang dag pa'i seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa zhes bya'o //🔽ji ltar nyid @186b mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas mngon sum du mdzad pa de nyid thugs brtse bas /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du gshegs nas yang dag pa'i seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa zhes bya'o // ji ltar nyid @186b mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas mngon sum du mdzad pa de nyid thugs brtse bas /
translated: He is the one who, having entered the midst of the assembly, roars the great lion's roar of perfect truth.

original: gzhan 'thob par bya ba'i phyir 'chad pas na /
analyzed: gzhan 'thob par bya ba'i phyir 'chad pas na /
translated: He is the one who, out of compassion, teaches others the way to realize nirvana, which he himself has realized.

original: 'jig rten du dge sbyong ngam bram ze chos mthun pas sus kyang ma bskor ba'i 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten du dge sbyong ngam bram ze chos mthun pas sus kyang ma bskor ba'i 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is the one who turns the wheel of the Dharma, which no one else in the world, whether holy man or Brahmin, whether god or Mara or Brahma, has been able to turn.

original: mdor tshig de dag gis don rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: mdor tshig de dag gis don rnam pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: In brief, these epithets indicate two things:

original: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pa dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pa dang / gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: the perfection of his own goal and the perfection of his work for others.

original: de la khyu mchog gi gnas rab tu mkhyen pa zhes bya bas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la khyu mchog gi gnas rab tu mkhyen pa zhes bya bas bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa brnyes pa bstan te /
translated: The first of these shows the attainment of the perfection of ones own goal, the knowledge of the state of a supreme being.

original: 'khor gyi nang du gshegs nas yang dag pa'i seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa dang / tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa bstan to //🔽yang na nyon mongs pa'i nang thams cad zhi ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du gshegs nas yang dag pa'i seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa dang / tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya bas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par mdzad pa bstan to // yang na nyon mongs pa'i nang thams cad zhi ba'i phyir /
translated: The second shows the perfection of the benefit of others, the turning of the wheel of the Dharma, the proclamation of the true lion's roar, having entered the assembly.

original: khyu mchog gi gnas thams cad rab tu mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyu mchog gi gnas thams cad rab tu mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or again, because of the pacification of all the inner afflictions, it is the knowledge of the state of a supreme being.

original: sman pa ngan pa nad pa nyon mongs pa'i nad kyi sman mi shes par yang dag pa'i sman yin par khas len par tshar gcod cing rang nyid yang dag pa'i sman par khas len pas na yang dag pa'i seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sman pa ngan pa nad pa nyon mongs pa'i nad kyi sman mi shes par yang dag pa'i sman yin par khas len par tshar gcod cing rang nyid yang dag pa'i sman par khas len pas na yang dag pa'i seng ge'i sgra sgrogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of the refutation of false medicine, the false claim to be a true physician, and the proclamation of the true medicine, it is the proclamation of the true lion's roar.

original: nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar bya ba'i thabs ston pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nad zhi bar bya ba'i thabs ston pa'i phyir tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “the turning of the wheel of Brahmā” because it teaches the means for curing the disease of the afflictions.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pas bar chad kyi chos su gsungs pa zhes bya ba gang 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa la bar du gcod par byed pa'i chos de 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la brten pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pas bar chad kyi chos su gsungs pa zhes bya ba gang 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa la bar du gcod par byed pa'i chos de 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la brten pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The Tathāgata has declared these to be obstacles” means that the things that obstruct the cultivation of the noble path are such things as relying on the five kinds of sense objects.

original: bar chad kyi chos su mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la brten kyang /
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos su mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa lnga'i yon tan la brten kyang /
translated: “They do not become obstacles” means that even though one relies on the five kinds of sense objects,

original: rnam par grol ba'i bgegs su mi 'gyur bar smra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i bgegs su mi 'gyur bar smra ba'o //
translated: one does not obstruct liberation.

original: 'di la gang gis rgyas pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos de dag bar du gcod pa yin par bshad pa las bar chad du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di la gang gis rgyas pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos de dag bar du gcod pa yin par bshad pa las bar chad du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Here, who would expand on this” means that, in the explanation that these things are obstacles, one should expand on the statement that they do not become obstacles.

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba yan chad rgyas par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba yan chad rgyas par sbyar ba'o //
translated: “The world with its gods” is expanded on up to “the turning of the wheel of Brahmā.”

original: gang yang des 'phags pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam du gsungs pa dang zhes bya ba la des ni de bzhin gshegs pas so //
analyzed: gang yang des 'phags pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam du gsungs pa dang zhes bya ba la des ni de bzhin gshegs pas so //
translated: said that it is the path that leads to the arising of the noble ones.

original: 'phags pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam ni /
translated: The path that leads to the arising of the noble ones is the path

original: lam gang la brten nas 'phags pa rnams rnam par grol ba'i lam thob cing 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: lam gang la brten nas 'phags pa rnams rnam par grol ba'i lam thob cing 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam ste /
translated: in dependence on which the noble ones obtain the path of liberation and arise from the suffering of saṃsāra.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the eightfold noble path and so on.

original: lam du @187a * //
analyzed: lam du @187a * //
translated: It is said to be the path

original: gsungs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i rgyur gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i rgyur gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said to be the cause for attaining nirvāṇa.

original: rten kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni lam de la bsgoms kyang khams gsum nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rten kyang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni lam de la bsgoms kyang khams gsum nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: “One would not arise from the three realms” means that even though one cultivates that path, one would not arise from the three realms.

original: skye rga na 'chi la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal med par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: skye rga na 'chi la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal med par lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: How could one be free from the suffering of birth, aging, sickness, death, and so on? This is the meaning.

original: 'di ltar lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, the world with its gods, etc., is as before.

original: zag pa zad pa'o zhes bdag nyid rab tu shes te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'o zhes bdag nyid rab tu shes te zhes bya ba la /
translated: He knows for himself that his outflows are exhausted.

original: zag pa ni mthong ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs te de dag ma lus par spangs pa bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du byas par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa ni mthong ba dang / bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i tshogs te de dag ma lus par spangs pa bdag nyid kyis mngon sum du byas par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Outflows are the mass of afflictions to be eliminated by the paths of insight and cultivation. He knows that he has directly experienced the complete elimination of those.

original: bshad pa gzhan ni snga ma bzhin du don blta'o //
analyzed: bshad pa gzhan ni snga ma bzhin du don blta'o //
translated: The other explanations should be understood as before.

original: de la mi 'jigs pa bzhi po 'di dag mdor bsdu na bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du mdzad nas /🔽de phun sum tshogs par rnyed par blta ste /
analyzed: de la mi 'jigs pa bzhi po 'di dag mdor bsdu na bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi dbang du mdzad nas / de phun sum tshogs par rnyed par blta ste /
translated: In brief, these four forms of fearlessness are to be understood as the perfection of benefit for oneself and others.🔽The perfection of benefit for oneself is to be understood as the attainment of the two kinds of fearlessness.🔽The perfection of benefit for others is to be understood as the attainment of the two kinds of fearlessness.

original: de la bdag gi don la yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de la bdag gi don la yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The perfection of benefit for oneself is twofold:

original: rnam pa gnyis ni ye shes kyi khyad par dang / spong ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni ye shes kyi khyad par dang / spong ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: the perfection of the distinctive knowledge and the perfection of the distinctive abandonment.

original: gzhan gyi don yang rnam pa gnyis te mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po la brten pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don yang rnam pa gnyis te mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba dang / gnyen po la brten pa'o //
