translated: The benefit for others is also of two kinds: the abandonment of adverse factors and the reliance on the antidote.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad du chos rnams yang dag par sangs rgyas zhes bya bas shes bya thams cad thugs su chud pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par dang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad du chos rnams yang dag par sangs rgyas zhes bya bas shes bya thams cad thugs su chud pa'i ye shes kyi khyad par dang ldan par ston to //
translated: Here, the perfect realization of all phenomena shows the distinctive wisdom that comprehends all objects of knowledge.

original: zag pa zad pa'o zhes bdag nyid rab tu shes te zhes bya bas spang ba'i khyad par dang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'o zhes bdag nyid rab tu shes te zhes bya bas spang ba'i khyad par dang ldan par ston to //
translated: The phrase the thorough knowledge of the self shows the distinctive abandonment.

original: bar chad kyi chos gsungs pa nas bya bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba bstan to //🔽'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam du gsungs pa zhes bya bas gnyen po la brten pa bstan to //
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos gsungs pa nas bya bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs spang ba bstan to // 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam du gsungs pa zhes bya bas gnyen po la brten pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase the teaching of the Dharma that interrupts shows the abandonment of adverse factors.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam du gsungs pa zhes bya bas gnyen po la brten pa bstan to //🔽mi 'jigs pa bzhi bstan pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lam du gsungs pa zhes bya bas gnyen po la brten pa bstan to // mi 'jigs pa bzhi bstan pa'i 'og tu /
translated: The phrase the teaching of the path that will arise shows the reliance on the antidote.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi bstan te /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi bstan te /
translated: The four forms of intrepid confidence are taught immediately after the four forms of thorough knowledge.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What are the four correct knowledges of the Tathagata?

original: de la chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par mkhyen pa ni /
analyzed: de la chos rnams kyi stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med par mkhyen pa ni /
translated: Here, the knowledge of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness of phenomena

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: is the correct knowledge of the meaning.

original: yang na sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa dang stong pa dang bdag med par mkhyen pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa dang stong pa dang bdag med par mkhyen pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, the knowledge of suffering, impermanence, emptiness, and non-self is called the correct knowledge of the meaning.

original: chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba mkhyen pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba mkhyen pa ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the classification of phenomena is the correct knowledge of phenomena,

original: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha @187b na ma tho ba med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang /
analyzed: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha @187b na ma tho ba med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang /
translated: which is virtuous and non-virtuous, reprehensible and irreproachable, compounded and uncompounded, with and without outflows,

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba tshad med pa rnams mkhyen pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / gzugs can dang / gzugs can med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba tshad med pa rnams mkhyen pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the immeasurably manifold divisions of phenomena, such as mundane and supramundane, good and bad, defiled and purified, with form and formless, etc.,

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: is the perfect knowledge of phenomena.

original: sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / de'i gnyen po chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rnams mkhyen pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi spyod pa brgyad khri bzhi stong dang / de'i gnyen po chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong rnams mkhyen pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the eighty-four thousand activities of sentient beings and the eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma that are their antidotes is the perfect knowledge of meaning.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / mi 'am ci la sogs pa ji snyed sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i skad ji snyed pa rnams mkhyen pa dang / skad dang sgra'i gtsug lag tu bya ba ji snyed yod pa mkhyen pa ni /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / mi 'am ci la sogs pa ji snyed sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i skad ji snyed pa rnams mkhyen pa dang / skad dang sgra'i gtsug lag tu bya ba ji snyed yod pa mkhyen pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the languages of all sentient beings, as many as there are, including gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, demigods, kinnaras, etc., and the knowledge of the treatises on language and grammar are the perfect knowledge of language.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge of the analytical knowledges of the meaning, the teaching, the languages, and perspicuity.

original: gsung gcig gis 'gro ba mtha' dag la go bar mdzad cing dngos po gcig gis rab tu dbye ba bskal ba'i mthar brjod kyang thug pa med par mkhyen pa ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gcig gis 'gro ba mtha' dag la go bar mdzad cing dngos po gcig gis rab tu dbye ba bskal ba'i mthar brjod kyang thug pa med par mkhyen pa ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: It is the knowledge that one utterance is understood by all beings, and that the classifications of one thing are spoken of until the end of time without ever being exhausted.

original: don du na gang bstan par bya ba dang / gang gis bstan par bya ba rnam pa gnyis mthar thug pa med cing thogs pa med par mkhyen pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don du na gang bstan par bya ba dang / gang gis bstan par bya ba rnam pa gnyis mthar thug pa med cing thogs pa med par mkhyen pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In brief, it is the knowledge that the two kinds of objects of expression and the two kinds of means of expression are endless and unobstructed.

original: de la gang bstan par bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te gnas dang gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang bstan par bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te gnas dang gnas pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of objects of expression are the basis and what is based on it.

original: de la gnas ni chos so //
analyzed: de la gnas ni chos so //
translated: The basis is the teaching.

original: gnas pa ni don to //🔽gang gis bstan par bya ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnas pa ni don to // gang gis bstan par bya ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: What is based on it is the meaning.

original: tshig thogs pa med pa dang / ye shes thogs pa med pas so //
analyzed: tshig thogs pa med pa dang / ye shes thogs pa med pas so //
translated: The two kinds of means of expression are the unobstructed knowledge of language and the unobstructed knowledge of teaching.

original: de la nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni yi shes thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni yi shes thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: The analytical knowledge of language is unobstructed knowledge.

original: de gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that these two are taught.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi bstan pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi bstan pa'i 'og tu /
translated: After teaching the four analytical knowledges,🔽the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are taught.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bstan te ji ltar bstan pa bzhin bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bstan te ji ltar bstan pa bzhin bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: With the intention of explaining them as they are taught,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “What are the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha?”

original: bco brgyad po de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi rgyud la mnga'i /
analyzed: bco brgyad po de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi rgyud la mnga'i /
translated: These eighteen are qualities that exist in the continuum of a tathāgata

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa gzhan la med pas thun mong du ma gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa gzhan la med pas thun mong du ma gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: and do not exist in others, such as śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore they are called the “eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.”

original: @188a * // bco brgyad po de dag gi don rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @188a * // bco brgyad po de dag gi don rnam par gzhag pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The presentation of the meaning of these eighteen is as follows.

original: dgra bcom pa'i dge slong zag pa zad pa bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du 'jug pa na /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i dge slong zag pa zad pa bsod snyoms kyi phyir grong du 'jug pa na /
translated: When a bhikṣu arhat whose contaminants have been extinguished enters a village for alms,

original: bar 'ga' ni glang po gtum po dang lhan cig 'grogs shing 'gro ba dang / bar 'ga' ni rta dang glang po che dang ba lang gtum po dang khyi gtum po dang 'grogs shing 'gro ba dang / bar 'ga' ni tsher ma stug por rkang pa 'dor /
analyzed: bar 'ga' ni glang po gtum po dang lhan cig 'grogs shing 'gro ba dang / bar 'ga' ni rta dang glang po che dang ba lang gtum po dang khyi gtum po dang 'grogs shing 'gro ba dang / bar 'ga' ni tsher ma stug por rkang pa 'dor /
translated: sometimes he walks together with a wild elephant, sometimes with a horse, elephant, wild cow, or wild dog, sometimes he throws his foot into a thicket of thorns,

original: bar 'ga' sbrul gdug pa gnas par rkang pa 'dor ba dang / 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas bud med la sogs pa yod par zhugs nas rigs pa ma yin pa smra bas bsdu bar byed pa dang / dgon pa'i gnas su song ba las lam por nas lam log bar 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: bar 'ga' sbrul gdug pa gnas par rkang pa 'dor ba dang / 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa'i gnas bud med la sogs pa yod par zhugs nas rigs pa ma yin pa smra bas bsdu bar byed pa dang / dgon pa'i gnas su song ba las lam por nas lam log bar 'gro ba dang /
translated: sometimes he throws his foot into a place where there is a poisonous snake, sometimes he enters a place that should not be entered, such as a woman, and tries to befriend her by speaking inappropriately, sometimes he goes the wrong way when he has gone to a solitary place,

original: rkun po'am seng ge'am stag gam dom la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: rkun po'am seng ge'am stag gam dom la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'gro ba ste /
translated: sometimes he goes together with a thief, lion, tiger, or bear.

original: rnam pa de lta bu dag ni 'phags pa dgra bcom pa'i 'khrul pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu dag ni 'phags pa dgra bcom pa'i 'khrul pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the mistakes of an ārya arhat.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad nas thams cad du de 'dra ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad nas thams cad du de 'dra ba mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the Tathāgata is completely and totally free of such things,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he is said to be “without error.”

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa dgon pa'i gnas kyi lam btsal ba las lam ma mthong ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa dgon pa'i gnas kyi lam btsal ba las lam ma mthong ba'am /
translated: Moreover, when noble arhats are seeking a path in a remote place, they may not see the path,

original: khang pa stong par zhugs nas 'di ci zhig ces sgra 'byin cing skad cher 'bod la /
analyzed: khang pa stong par zhugs nas 'di ci zhig ces sgra 'byin cing skad cher 'bod la /
translated: or they may enter an empty house and cry out, “What is this?”

original: dud mo cher 'bebs pa'am /
analyzed: dud mo cher 'bebs pa'am /
translated: or they may weep loudly,

original: bag chags kyi nyes pa'i rgyus gad mo rta gad 'byin pa ni /
analyzed: bag chags kyi nyes pa'i rgyus gad mo rta gad 'byin pa ni /
translated: or they may laugh loudly because of the fault of latent tendencies.

original: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ca co ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ca co ste /
translated: These are the “gibberish” of noble arhats.

original: rnam pa de lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad nas thams cad du mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad nas thams cad du mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the Tathāgata is completely and totally free of such things,

original: ca co med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ca co med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he is said to be “without gibberish.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la dran pa rmongs pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la dran pa rmongs pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is not confused.

original: byas te ring du lon pa dang ; smras nas ring du lon pa rnams kyang mi bsnyel bas na /
analyzed: byas te ring du lon pa dang ; smras nas ring du lon pa rnams kyang mi bsnyel bas na /
translated: He does not forget what he has done a long time ago or what he has said a long time ago.

original: dran pa nyams pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “without loss of mindfulness.🔽”

original: yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa na ni mnyam par gzhag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du ma zhugs pa na ni /
analyzed: yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa na ni mnyam par gzhag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin du ma zhugs pa na ni /
translated: When āryas who are arhats enter meditative equipoise, they are in meditative equipoise. When they do not enter meditative equipoise,

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin te /
translated: they are not in meditative equipoise.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rtag tu sems mnyam par bzhag pas rnam pa de lta bu thams cad nas thams cad du mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni rtag tu sems mnyam par bzhag pas rnam pa de lta bu thams cad nas thams cad du mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
translated: Because tathāgatas are always in meditative equipoise, they do not have any of those aspects at all.🔽Therefore it is called “without mind that is not in meditative equipoise.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “the absence of a non-concentrated mind.”🔽

original: de bas na mdo dag las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na mdo dag las gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it says in the sūtras:🔽When walking or in meditative equipoise,

original: glang po spyod na'am mnyam du 'jog / bzhengs na 'ang glang po mnyam 'jog la //🔽glang po @188b gzigs kyang mnyam 'jog ste //
analyzed: glang po spyod na'am mnyam du 'jog / bzhengs na 'ang glang po mnyam 'jog la // glang po @188b gzigs kyang mnyam 'jog ste //
translated: when standing or in meditative equipoise,🔽when lying down or in meditative equipoise,

original: bzhugs par gyur kyang mnyam du 'jog / ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhugs par gyur kyang mnyam du 'jog / ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: when sitting or in meditative equipoise.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa gcig pu phung po la yid 'byung ba ni 'du shes skye ba dang / lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes skye ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa gcig pu phung po la yid 'byung ba ni 'du shes skye ba dang / lhag ma ma lus par spangs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'i 'du shes skye ste /
translated: Moreover, a single arhat ārya generates the idea of disgust for the aggregates and generates the idea of peace for nirvāṇa, which is the complete abandonment of the remainder.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni phung po dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga' bas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni phung po dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis la tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga' bas na /
translated: But tathāgatas do not generate the idea of a difference between the aggregates and nirvāṇa.

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore they are said to be devoid of the idea of variety.

original: mchog tu btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa sems can skal ba yod dam /
analyzed: mchog tu btang snyoms kyi mtshan nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa sems can skal ba yod dam /
translated: Because they abide in the characteristic of supreme equanimity.

original: med par so sor ma brtags par yang sems can gyi don la btang snyoms su 'jog ste /
analyzed: med par so sor ma brtags par yang sems can gyi don la btang snyoms su 'jog ste /
translated: Moreover, arhats do not individually investigate whether sentient beings have good fortune or not and they are indifferent to the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni skal ba yod dam med ces brtags nas skal pa med pa rnams btang snyoms su 'jog gi ma brtags par btang snyoms su 'jog pa rnam pa thams cad du mi mnga' bas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni skal ba yod dam med ces brtags nas skal pa med pa rnams btang snyoms su 'jog gi ma brtags par btang snyoms su 'jog pa rnam pa thams cad du mi mnga' bas na /
translated: The tathagatas are not at all indifferent without examining whether beings have the good fortune or not.

original: so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are said to have no indifference without examination.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba las brtsams nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba las brtsams nas /
translated: Moreover, in the sutra called the arhat, it is said that from the point of view of abandoning the obscurations,

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa dag pa'i ye shes ma thob par yongs su nyams pas /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa dag pa'i ye shes ma thob par yongs su nyams pas /
translated: the arhats have not obtained the gnosis that purifies the obscurations to omniscience and they degenerate.

original: mos pa nyams pa dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / shes rab nyams pa dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes nyams pa ste der drug car med la /
analyzed: mos pa nyams pa dang / brtson 'grus nyams pa dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / shes rab nyams pa dang / rnam par grol ba nyams pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes nyams pa ste der drug car med la /
translated: They degenerate in interest, degenerate in perseverance, degenerate in mindfulness, degenerate in wisdom, degenerate in liberation and degenerate in the gnosis of liberation.

original: nyams pa rnam pa drug po de de bzhin gshegs pa la nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
analyzed: nyams pa rnam pa drug po de de bzhin gshegs pa la nyams pa mi mnga' ste /
translated: The tathagatas have none of these six degenerations.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba la mos pa nyams pa nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ston pa'i bar du ma nyams pas na /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spang bar bya ba la mos pa nyams pa nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ston pa'i bar du ma nyams pas na /
translated: The non-decrease of interest in eliminating the obscurations to omniscience, up to the non-decrease of the teaching of the wisdom of liberation.

original: mos pa bri ba med pa nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ston pa bri ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pa bri ba med pa nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ston pa bri ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The non-decrease of interest, up to the non-decrease of the teaching of the wisdom of liberation, are called the non-decrease of the thirty-two qualities.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa rnams dus gsum gyi shes par bya ba'i dngos po la 'bad pa tsam gyis khong du chud pa med de gang gi ye shes ni chags pa med pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa rnams dus gsum gyi shes par bya ba'i dngos po la 'bad pa tsam gyis khong du chud pa med de gang gi ye shes ni chags pa med pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: Moreover, the noble arhats do not comprehend things to be known in the three times merely through effort. Their wisdom is called “unimpeded.”

original: / thams cad khong du chud pa med de de dag gi phyir de dag gi ye shes ni thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / thams cad khong du chud pa med de de dag gi phyir de dag gi ye shes ni thogs pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They do not comprehend everything. Therefore, their wisdom is called “unobstructed.”

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ni 'bad pa med par dus gsum gyi dngos po khong du chud par ma chags pa dang / thams cad khong du chud pas ma thogs pa ste /
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ni 'bad pa med par dus gsum gyi dngos po khong du chud par ma chags pa dang / thams cad khong du chud pas ma thogs pa ste /
translated: However, the Tathāgatas comprehend things in the three times without effort, unimpededly and without attachment, because they comprehend everything.

original: de bas na 'das pa'i dus la ma @189a * //
analyzed: de bas na 'das pa'i dus la ma @189a * //
translated: Therefore, their wisdom is called “unimpeded.”

original: chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang zhes bya ba nas da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba dang zhes bya ba nas da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The vision of pristine consciousness that is not attached to the present is called the vision of pristine consciousness that is not attached to the present.🔽Moreover, because the ārya arhats do not have pristine consciousness preceding the engagement of the karma of body, speech, and mind, sometimes they engage in virtuous physical karma,

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las 'jug pa la ye shes sngon du gtong ba med pas bar 'ga' ni dge ba'i lus kyi las la 'jug / bar 'ga' ni lung du ma bstan pa la 'jug / de bzhin du ngag
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa dgra bcom pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las 'jug pa la ye shes sngon du gtong ba med pas bar 'ga' ni dge ba'i lus kyi las la 'jug / bar 'ga' ni lung du ma bstan pa la 'jug / de bzhin du ngag
translated: sometimes they engage in neutral physical karma, and likewise,

original: gi las dang yid kyi las la yang gong ma ltar 'jug ste /
analyzed: gi las dang yid kyi las la yang gong ma ltar 'jug ste /
translated: they engage in verbal and mental karma as above.

original: las 'dren ma la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: las 'dren ma la 'jug pa ste /
translated: They engage in mixed karma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las rnam pa gsum car la yang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las rnam pa gsum car la yang /
translated: For the tathāgatas, all three types

original: ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang bas /
analyzed: ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang bas /
translated: have pristine consciousness preceding and pristine consciousness following.

original: dge ba'i las 'ba' zhig 'byung bar zad kyi lung du mi ston pa'i las la mi 'byung bas na lus kyi las thams cad kyi sngon du ye shes 'gro ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i las 'ba' zhig 'byung bar zad kyi lung du mi ston pa'i las la mi 'byung bas na lus kyi las thams cad kyi sngon du ye shes 'gro ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Since only virtuous karma arises, not neutral karma, it is said that pristine wisdom precedes all physical actions,

original: yid kyi las thams cad kyi sngon du ye shes 'gro ste /
analyzed: yid kyi las thams cad kyi sngon du ye shes 'gro ste /
translated: and pristine wisdom precedes all mental actions.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said to follow pristine wisdom.

original: de la ye shes kyis bskyod pas na /
analyzed: de la ye shes kyis bskyod pas na /
translated: Since pristine wisdom moves them,

original: sngon du ye shes 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon du ye shes 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said that pristine wisdom precedes them.

original: ye shes dus gcig tu 'byung bas na /
analyzed: ye shes dus gcig tu 'byung bas na /
translated: Since pristine wisdom arises at the same time,

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: it is said to follow pristine wisdom.

original: ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de dag gi don du na lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnam par dag pa thun mong ma yin pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po'i rten 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma thob par yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de dag gi don du na lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las rnam par dag pa thun mong ma yin pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po'i rten 'bras bu dang bcas pa ma thob par yongs su nyams pa mi mnga' ba phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: In terms of the meaning of the eighteen distinctive qualities, it is the perfection of the unshared, pure physical, verbal and mental actions, and the perfection of the absence of degeneration without attaining the support of the tathāgata’s faculties and their result.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i ye shes la gnas pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i las la 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i ye shes la gnas pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i las la 'jug pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of the abode of extraordinary intuition, and the perfection of the engagement in extraordinary activities.

original: de la 'khrul pa med ces bya bas lus kyi rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa med ces bya bas lus kyi rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: Therein, the phrase “without error” indicates the purity of the body.

original: ca co med ces bya bas ngag gi las rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: ca co med ces bya bas ngag gi las rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “without chattering” indicates the purity of verbal activity.

original: dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems med pa dang / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa bzhis yid kyi las rnam par dag pa bstan to //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa med pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems med pa dang / sna tshogs kyi 'du shes med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med pa bzhis yid kyi las rnam par dag pa bstan to //
translated: The four phrases “without loss of memory,” “without a mind that is not in meditative equipoise,” “without the discriminations of multiplicity,” and “without a nondiscriminative equanimity” indicate the purity of mental activity.

original: mos pa 'bri ba med pa nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ston pa'i bar du bri ba med pa zhes bya ba drug gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po rten dang 'bras bur bcas pa la ma thob par yongs su nyams pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: mos pa 'bri ba med pa nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes ston pa'i bar du bri ba med pa zhes bya ba drug gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po rten dang 'bras bur bcas pa la ma thob par yongs su nyams pa med par bstan to //
translated: The six phrases “without a decrease in aspiration,” up to “without a decrease in the intuition that reveals liberation” indicate that there is no loss of the faculties of the Tathāgata, together with their support and fruit, due to non-attainment.

original: de la dbang po'i rten ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po'i rten ni mos pa'o //
translated: The support of the faculties is aspiration.

original: 'bras bu @189b ni rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu @189b ni rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes bstan pa'o //
translated: The result is the teaching of liberation and the knowledge of liberation.

original: dbang po nyid ni brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / shes rab ste /
analyzed: dbang po nyid ni brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / shes rab ste /
translated: The faculties themselves are effort, mindfulness, and wisdom.

original: rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: These are the three aspects.

original: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa zhes bya ba nas de ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis thun mong ma yin pa'i ye shes la gnas pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //🔽lus kyi las thams cad kyi ye shes sngon du 'gro ste zhes bya ba nas yid kyi las thams cad kyi sngon du ye shes 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa zhes bya ba nas de ltar byung ba'i dus la ma chags ma thogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis thun mong ma yin pa'i ye shes la gnas pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to // lus kyi las thams cad kyi ye shes sngon du 'gro ste zhes bya ba nas yid kyi las thams cad kyi sngon du ye shes 'gro ste /
translated: The three phrases beginning with “unimpeded knowledge of the past” and ending with “unimpeded knowledge of the present” teach the perfection of the dwelling in the extraordinary knowledge.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis thun mong ma yin pa'i las kun tu spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis thun mong ma yin pa'i las kun tu spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The three phrases beginning with “all physical actions are preceded by knowledge” and ending with “all mental actions are preceded by knowledge” teach the perfection of the extraordinary performance of action.

original: ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bstan pa'i 'og tu /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bstan pa'i 'og tu /
translated: After the teaching of the eighteen distinctive qualities,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis smos pas de bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis smos pas de bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: The thirty-two marks of a great person are mentioned, so in order to explain them,

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsungs so //
translated: it says What are the thirty-two marks of a tathāgata? and so on.

original: mtshan de dag dang ldan na 'di ni skyes bu chen po yin no zhes khong du chud par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: mtshan de dag dang ldan na 'di ni skyes bu chen po yin no zhes khong du chud par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Since it is understood that one who possesses those marks is a great person,

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan te /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan te /
translated: they are the marks of a great person.

original: de yang sum cu rtsa gnyis yod la /
analyzed: de yang sum cu rtsa gnyis yod la /
translated: Moreover, there are thirty-two of them.

original: dpe byad brgyad cu ni de'i 'khor du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpe byad brgyad cu ni de'i 'khor du gtogs pa'o //
translated: The eighty minor marks are included as their retinue.

original: zhabs shin tu brtan zhes bya ba ni zhabs gnyis kyi mthil shas gang la sa'i steng du mnyam du 'dor zhing /
analyzed: zhabs shin tu brtan zhes bya ba ni zhabs gnyis kyi mthil shas gang la sa'i steng du mnyam du 'dor zhing /
translated: Extremely stable feet means that the soles of the two feet are even when placed on the ground,

original: 'khor ba dang 'bur ba la sogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang 'bur ba la sogs pa med pa'o //
translated: and there are no hollows, bumps, and so on.

original: zhabs kyi mthil gnyis kyi 'og na /🔽'khor lo'i mtshan gyi zhabs kyi mthil la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil gnyis kyi 'og na / 'khor lo'i mtshan gyi zhabs kyi mthil la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: On the soles of the two feet🔽are the marks of wheels with a thousand spokes

original: zhabs gnyis kyi mthil na 'khor lo rtsibs stong yod pa /
analyzed: zhabs gnyis kyi mthil na 'khor lo rtsibs stong yod pa /
translated: means that on the soles of the two feet there are wheels with a thousand spokes,

original: lte ba dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lte ba dang bcas pa rnam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with a navel and all the other characteristics complete.

original: rting pa che zhing zhabs mtho ba zhes bya ba ni rting pa yangs shing sbom la zhabs kyi gong mtho ba'o //🔽zhabs dang phyag dra ba can ni /
analyzed: rting pa che zhing zhabs mtho ba zhes bya ba ni rting pa yangs shing sbom la zhabs kyi gong mtho ba'o // zhabs dang phyag dra ba can ni /
translated: He has broad heels and elevated feet means that his heels are broad and thick and the upper part of his feet are elevated.

original: zhabs gnyis dang phyag gnyis kyi sor mo'i bar srab mo dra ba dang 'dra bas 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: zhabs gnyis dang phyag gnyis kyi sor mo'i bar srab mo dra ba dang 'dra bas 'brel pa'o //
translated: His hands and feet are webbed means that the fingers and toes of his two hands and two feet are connected by thin membranes, like a net.

original: phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing mnyen pa ni phyag dang zhabs kyi pags pa 'jam la thag thug can du mkhrang ba yin no //
analyzed: phyag dang zhabs 'jam zhing mnyen pa ni phyag dang zhabs kyi pags pa 'jam la thag thug can du mkhrang ba yin no //
translated: His hands and feet are soft and tender means that the skin of his hands and feet is soft and smooth, and his hands and feet are supple.

original: sku bdun mtho ba zhes bya ba ni phyag gi thal gong gnyis mtho ba dang / zhabs kyi mthil dang gong mtho ba dang / dpung mgo gnyis mtho ba dang / mgur gyi thon gor shas gang ba ste bdun no //
analyzed: sku bdun mtho ba zhes bya ba ni phyag gi thal gong gnyis mtho ba dang / zhabs kyi mthil dang gong mtho ba dang / dpung mgo gnyis mtho ba dang / mgur gyi thon gor shas gang ba ste bdun no //
translated: His body has seven prominent parts means that the upper parts of his two hands, the two soles of his feet, the two shoulders, and the nape of his neck are prominent.

original: rje ngar ri dvags ae n+ya ya lta bu dang zhes bya ba ni sku brla nas brtsams te man chad khad kyis phra bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rje ngar ri dvags ae n+ya ya lta bu dang zhes bya ba ni sku brla nas brtsams te man chad khad kyis phra bar gnas pa'o //
translated: His thighs are like the antelope's, means that his thighs are gradually tapered from the hips down.

original: @190a * // mtshan gsang ba nang du nub pa ni mtshan gsang ba pags pa'i nang du nub ste mi snang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: @190a * // mtshan gsang ba nang du nub pa ni mtshan gsang ba pags pa'i nang du nub ste mi snang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: His male organ is concealed in a sheath, means that his male organ is concealed in a sheath, and is not visible.

original: sku ro stod seng ge'i lta bu ni ro stod 'phel ka che la rked pa phra ba'o //
analyzed: sku ro stod seng ge'i lta bu ni ro stod 'phel ka che la rked pa phra ba'o //
translated: His torso is like a lion's, means that his torso is broad and his waist is slender.

original: sgrog rus kyi bar rgyas pa ni /
analyzed: sgrog rus kyi bar rgyas pa ni /
translated: His chest is firm and full, means that

original: sgrog rus kyi bar shas gang ba'o //
analyzed: sgrog rus kyi bar shas gang ba'o //
translated: his chest is full between the collar bones.

original: dpung pa brkyang ba rab tu ring ba ni phyag brkyang na pus mo 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dpung pa brkyang ba rab tu ring ba ni phyag brkyang na pus mo 'das pa'o //
translated: His arms are long, means that when he stretches out his arms, his fingers reach his knees.

original: sku rnam par dag pa ni sku la dri ma mi 'chags pa'o //🔽mid pa dung lta bu ni mgul khrem gnyer can du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sku rnam par dag pa ni sku la dri ma mi 'chags pa'o // mid pa dung lta bu ni mgul khrem gnyer can du gnas pa'o //
translated: His body is pure, means that his body is not soiled by dust and the like.🔽His neck is like a conch, means that his neck is without wrinkles.

original: 'gram pa seng ge lta bu ni 'gram pa'i lha nga che ba'o //
analyzed: 'gram pa seng ge lta bu ni 'gram pa'i lha nga che ba'o //
translated: His cheeks are like the lion's, means that his jaws are prominent.

original: so bzhi bcu mnyam pa ni ya so dang ma so nyi shu nyi shur grangs mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: so bzhi bcu mnyam pa ni ya so dang ma so nyi shu nyi shur grangs mnyam pa'o //
translated: His forty teeth are even, means that he has twenty teeth in each jaw.

original: so bar ma bye zhing mnyam pa ni tshems thags 'brel zhing tshems che chung med pa'o //
analyzed: so bar ma bye zhing mnyam pa ni tshems thags 'brel zhing tshems che chung med pa'o //
translated: His teeth are even, without gaps, means that his teeth are close together and not too big or small.

original: lce che ba ni ljags brkyang na zhal khyab par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lce che ba ni ljags brkyang na zhal khyab par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: His tongue is large, means that when he extends his tongue it covers his whole face.

original: ro bro ba'i mchog ni ljags kyi steng du nas rul pa bab kyang lha'i zhal zas ro mchog tu myang bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ro bro ba'i mchog ni ljags kyi steng du nas rul pa bab kyang lha'i zhal zas ro mchog tu myang bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: He has the supreme taste, means that even if rotten barley falls on his tongue, he experiences the taste of divine food.

original: tshangs pa'i dbyangs ka la ping ka'i sgra skad ni gsung 'jam zhing mnyen pas gdul bya rnams kyi sems 'phrog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dbyangs ka la ping ka'i sgra skad ni gsung 'jam zhing mnyen pas gdul bya rnams kyi sems 'phrog par byed pa'o //
translated: His voice is like Brahmā’s and like the karavīka bird’s call, means that because his speech is gentle and soft, it captivates the minds of those to be tamed.

original: spyan kun sngo ba ni spyan gyi sprin dkar po'i gong na kha dog mthon mthing du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: spyan kun sngo ba ni spyan gyi sprin dkar po'i gong na kha dog mthon mthing du gnas pa'o //
translated: His eyes are dark blue, means that above the white of his eyes there is a deep blue color.

original: spyan pa'i rdzi ma 'dra ba ni spyan gyi rdzi ma ba'i rdzi ma lta bur spu mnyam zhing srab la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: spyan pa'i rdzi ma 'dra ba ni spyan gyi rdzi ma ba'i rdzi ma lta bur spu mnyam zhing srab la gnas pa'o //
translated: His eyelashes are like an ox’s, means that the eyelashes on his eyes are evenly distributed, fine, and well placed.

original: dbu'i gtsug tor ni dbu'i dbus na sha'i thor tshugs tshang ba'i 'jig rten nas kyang bltar mi snang ba mnga'o //
analyzed: dbu'i gtsug tor ni dbu'i dbus na sha'i thor tshugs tshang ba'i 'jig rten nas kyang bltar mi snang ba mnga'o //
translated: His head has a uṣṇīṣa, means that in the middle of his head there is a tuft of flesh that is not visible to the world.

original: shing n+ya gro dha ltar zlum zhing mdzes pa ni sku chu zheng gab la yan lag rnams kyang sku'i rkyen du bab la /
analyzed: shing n+ya gro dha ltar zlum zhing mdzes pa ni sku chu zheng gab la yan lag rnams kyang sku'i rkyen du bab la /
translated: His body is round and beautiful like a nyagrodha tree, for his body is well-proportioned and his limbs are in proportion to his body.

original: che chung med pa mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: che chung med pa mnga' ba'o //
translated: He has no limbs that are too long or too short.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid bstan nas gang dag mtshan thob par mos pas de'i rgyu sgrub pa la lan tan byed par 'dod pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du mtshan gyi bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid bstan nas gang dag mtshan thob par mos pas de'i rgyu sgrub pa la lan tan byed par 'dod pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi don du mtshan gyi bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Having taught the characteristics of the thirty-two marks of a great person, in order to benefit beings who wish to attain those marks and who wish to practice their causes, he taught the marks.

original: zhabs gnyis rab tu brtan pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyes bu chen po'i mtshan 'di ni sngon yi dam la rab tu bstan pas grub pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhabs gnyis rab tu brtan pa de bzhin gshegs pa skyes bu chen po'i mtshan 'di ni sngon yi dam la rab tu bstan pas grub pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The two firm feet of the Tathagata, this mark of a great person, is established by his previous practice of firm vows.

original: yang na mtshan rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: yang na mtshan rnams ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Or, the marks have the nature of a ripened effect.

original: 'bras bu la rgyu med mi srid pas de'i rgyu ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'bras bu la rgyu med mi srid pas de'i rgyu ston par mdzad do //
translated: Since it is impossible for an effect to be without a cause, he taught their causes.

original: sngon yi dam la rab tu brtan pas grub ces bya ba ni sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe dge ba la sogs pa bya bar khas blangs pa'i yi dam ma bral zhing nan tan du gus par bya ba las zhabs brtan pa grub pa
analyzed: sngon yi dam la rab tu brtan pas grub ces bya ba ni sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe dge ba la sogs pa bya bar khas blangs pa'i yi dam ma bral zhing nan tan du gus par bya ba las zhabs brtan pa grub pa
translated: The phrase he is accomplished because he is firm in his former holy aspirations means that he is accomplished because he is not separated from the holy aspirations that he made in the past when he was a bodhisattva, such as the aspiration to do what is wholesome, and because he is devoted to their practice.

original: bzhin no // sngon sems can pha rol rnams sbam bkong bas grub po zhes bya ba ni sems @190b can mthu chung shing nyam chung ba rnams la skrag pa dang / 'jigs pa ma byas pas grub pa'o //🔽chos kyis bsrung ba dang bskyab pa byas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzhin no // sngon sems can pha rol rnams sbam bkong bas grub po zhes bya ba ni sems @190b can mthu chung shing nyam chung ba rnams la skrag pa dang / 'jigs pa ma byas pas grub pa'o // chos kyis bsrung ba dang bskyab pa byas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase he is accomplished because he has protected other sentient beings means that he is accomplished because he has not frightened or harmed weak and powerless sentient beings.

original: sngon srog ma bcad pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las mi byed par srung ba las grub pa'o //
analyzed: sngon srog ma bcad pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las mi byed par srung ba las grub pa'o //
translated: The phrase he is accomplished because he has protected and guarded the Dharma means that he is accomplished because he has protected himself in the past from the nonvirtuous actions such as taking life, and so on.

original: yang na chos kyis bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang sba ba zhes bya ba ni gang zag chos spyod pa rnams la 'jigs pa dang / mi bde ba'i grogs mnyen pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i dus na phan 'dogs par byed par byed pa las grub pa'o //
analyzed: yang na chos kyis bsrung ba dang / bskyab pa dang sba ba zhes bya ba ni gang zag chos spyod pa rnams la 'jigs pa dang / mi bde ba'i grogs mnyen pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa la sogs pa'i dus na phan 'dogs par byed par byed pa las grub pa'o //
translated: Or else, “protection, defense, and concealment” means that when persons who practice the Dharma are in danger or are unhappy, he helps them with gentle companionship, thoughtfulness, and meditation, etc.

original: de la mnyan pa'i dus na grogs byed pa ni bsrung ba'o //🔽bsam pa'i dus na grogs byed pa ni bskyab pa'o //
analyzed: de la mnyan pa'i dus na grogs byed pa ni bsrung ba'o // bsam pa'i dus na grogs byed pa ni bskyab pa'o //
translated: At the time of listening, he helps them with companionship, which is protection.🔽At the time of reflection, he helps them with companionship, which is defense.

original: bsgom pa'i dus na grogs byas pa ni sba bar byas pa'o //🔽sngon 'khor ma phyed pas grub po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i dus na grogs byas pa ni sba bar byas pa'o // sngon 'khor ma phyed pas grub po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At the time of meditation, he helps them with companionship, which is concealment.

original: gzhan gyi g-yog 'khor kha ma drangs pa las grub pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi g-yog 'khor kha ma drangs pa las grub pa'o //
translated: “He is established through not dividing the retinue in the past” means that he is established through not dividing the retinue of others.

original: sngon bgo ba sna tshogs byin pas grub po zhes bya ba ni chos dang mal stan la sogs pa byin pas grub pa'o //
analyzed: sngon bgo ba sna tshogs byin pas grub po zhes bya ba ni chos dang mal stan la sogs pa byin pas grub pa'o //
translated: “He is established through giving various garments in the past” means that he is established through giving Dharma robes, bedding, etc.

original: sngon sangs rgyas kyi chos kun bzung bas grub po zhes bya ba ni sngar dam pa'i chos rnams mnyan pa de nas bsams /
analyzed: sngon sangs rgyas kyi chos kun bzung bas grub po zhes bya ba ni sngar dam pa'i chos rnams mnyan pa de nas bsams /
translated: It is said, Attained through previously upholding the Buddha's teachings means attained through previously listening to the excellent teachings, then reflecting,

original: de nas bsgoms pa las grub pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bsgoms pa las grub pa'o //
translated: and then meditating.

original: sngon gsang thub par bsrungs pa dang / 'khrig pa'i chos spangs pas grub ces bya ba ni snod ma yin pa la bstan du mi rung ba rnams snod ma yin pa la ma bstan te bsrung ba dang / gzhan gyis gsang ba rnams gzhan dag la ma bsgrags par bsrung ba dang /
analyzed: sngon gsang thub par bsrungs pa dang / 'khrig pa'i chos spangs pas grub ces bya ba ni snod ma yin pa la bstan du mi rung ba rnams snod ma yin pa la ma bstan te bsrung ba dang / gzhan gyis gsang ba rnams gzhan dag la ma bsgrags par bsrung ba dang /
translated: It is said, Attained through previously guarding secrets and abandoning sexual activity means attained through not teaching those unsuitable to be taught the unsuitable to be taught, such as the unsuitable to be taught to unsuitable recipients, and through guarding the secrets of others by not proclaiming them to others.

original: mi tshangs pa spyod pa'i chos rnams spangs pa las grub pa'o //
analyzed: mi tshangs pa spyod pa'i chos rnams spangs pa las grub pa'o //
translated: It is attained through abandoning sexual activity.

original: sngon dge ba'i chos spyad pa las grub pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab spyad pa las grub pa'o //
analyzed: sngon dge ba'i chos spyad pa las grub pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab spyad pa las grub pa'o //
translated: It is said, Attained through previously practicing virtuous dharmas means attained through practicing ethics, concentration, and wisdom.

original: pha rol po rnams mi 'jigs par dbugs phung ba phyin pas grub ces bya bas ni /
analyzed: pha rol po rnams mi 'jigs par dbugs phung ba phyin pas grub ces bya bas ni /
translated: It is said, Attained through previously giving others freedom from fear means attained through giving others freedom from fear.

original: rgyal po dang / rkun bu la sogs pa'i 'jigs pas nyen pa'i sems can rnams 'jigs pa de las bskyabs pa las grub pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po dang / rkun bu la sogs pa'i 'jigs pas nyen pa'i sems can rnams 'jigs pa de las bskyabs pa las grub pa'o //
translated: It is accomplished by protecting sentient beings who are threatened by the fear of kings, thieves, and so on.

original: sngon gzhan gyi bya ba spro bar byed pas grub pa las byed pa po la spro ba bskyed cing grogs byas pa las grub pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gzhan gyi bya ba spro bar byed pas grub pa las byed pa po la spro ba bskyed cing grogs byas pa las grub pa'o //
translated: It is accomplished by encouraging and assisting the agent, because in the past one encouraged the activities of others.

original: sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba la sbyor ba kun tu rdzogs pas grub po zhes bya ba ni dge ba gang brtsams pa rnams mthar phyin par byas pa las grub pa'o //
analyzed: sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba la sbyor ba kun tu rdzogs pas grub po zhes bya ba ni dge ba gang brtsams pa rnams mthar phyin par byas pa las grub pa'o //
translated: It is accomplished by perfecting the practice of roots of virtue, because in the past one brought to completion whatever roots of virtue one undertook.

original: sngon sems can dbugs dbyung ba bya ba las grub ces bya ba ni sems can ngan song du skyes pa rnams bskyabs pa las grub pa'o //🔽sngon lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las bsrungs pa las grub ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon sems can dbugs dbyung ba bya ba las grub ces bya ba ni sems can ngan song du skyes pa rnams bskyabs pa las grub pa'o // sngon lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las bsrungs pa las grub ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is accomplished by comforting sentient beings, because in the past one protected sentient beings who had been born in the lower realms.🔽It is accomplished by guarding the actions of body, speech, and mind,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos la mi 'jug pa bsrungs pa las grub pa'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos la mi 'jug pa bsrungs pa las grub pa'o //
translated: because in the past one guarded the body, speech, and mind so that they would not engage in evil, unwholesome actions.

original: sngon bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med pa la bdag brten pa @191a * //
analyzed: sngon bsod nams kyi phung po tshad med pa la bdag brten pa @191a * //
translated: In the past, I relied on immeasurable heaps of merit.🔽

original: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa bsod nams dpag tu med par bsags pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa bsod nams dpag tu med par bsags pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The phrase having relied upon immeasurable heaps of merit in the past means that it arises from the accumulation of immeasurable merit through generosity, morality, etc.

original: sngon bsam pas ma bcos par grub pa zhes bya ba ni sems la g-yo med par byas pa las grub pa'o //🔽chos yang dag par spyod pa na sems las su rung bar grub pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dpyod pa na gnyid dang rmugs pa dang rtog pa dang dpyod pa bsal te /
analyzed: sngon bsam pas ma bcos par grub pa zhes bya ba ni sems la g-yo med par byas pa las grub pa'o // chos yang dag par spyod pa na sems las su rung bar grub pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dpyod pa na gnyid dang rmugs pa dang rtog pa dang dpyod pa bsal te /
translated: The phrase having relied upon the accomplishment of firm resolve in the past means that it arises from the accomplishment of a mind free of deceit.🔽The phrase having relied upon the accomplishment of a serviceable mind in the practice of the Dharma means that it arises from the accomplishment of a mind free of torpor, sleep, discursive thought, and reflection when investigating the general and specific characteristics of the dharmas.

original: sems pa las grub pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa las grub pa'o //
translated: The phrase having relied upon the accomplishment of a mind free of distraction in the practice of the Dharma means that it arises from the accomplishment of a mind free of distraction when investigating the general and specific characteristics of the dharmas.

original: sngon 'du 'dzi spangs pa las grub pa ni sngon 'gro ba mang po nang na gnas pa spangs pa las grub pa'o //
analyzed: sngon 'du 'dzi spangs pa las grub pa ni sngon 'gro ba mang po nang na gnas pa spangs pa las grub pa'o //
translated: The phrase having relied upon the accomplishment of the avoidance of worldly pursuits in the past means that it arises from the accomplishment of the avoidance of dwelling in the midst of a multitude of people in the past.

original: sngon bsgrags par rigs pa rnams kyi grags pa brjod pa las grub pa ni yon tan bsgrags par 'os pa rnams kyi yon tan grags par byas pa las grub pa'o //
analyzed: sngon bsgrags par rigs pa rnams kyi grags pa brjod pa las grub pa ni yon tan bsgrags par 'os pa rnams kyi yon tan grags par byas pa las grub pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the praise of the qualities of those worthy of praise is the establishment of the praise of the qualities of those worthy of praise.

original: mthu bo che kun tu mdzes pa zhes bya ba la mthu bo che ni stobs kyi tshad de de'i stobs kyi tshad ni ji tsam zhe na tha mal pa'i ban glang bcu'i stobs spos kyi glang po gcig la yod do //
analyzed: mthu bo che kun tu mdzes pa zhes bya ba la mthu bo che ni stobs kyi tshad de de'i stobs kyi tshad ni ji tsam zhe na tha mal pa'i ban glang bcu'i stobs spos kyi glang po gcig la yod do //
translated: The word great in mahānagna means strength. What is the measure of that strength? The strength of ten ordinary elephants is the strength of one gandhahastin.

original: spos kyi glang po bcu'i stobs ma h'a n'a ga na gcig la yod do //
analyzed: spos kyi glang po bcu'i stobs ma h'a n'a ga na gcig la yod do //
translated: The strength of ten gandhahastins is the strength of one mahānāga.

original: de bcu'i stobs sra kan ta gcig la yod do //🔽sra kan ta bcu'i stobs pa rang ga gcig la yod do //
analyzed: de bcu'i stobs sra kan ta gcig la yod do // sra kan ta bcu'i stobs pa rang ga gcig la yod do //
translated: The strength of ten mahānāgas is the strength of one sankan.🔽The strength of ten sakanas is the strength of one parigha.

original: pa rang ga bcu'i stobs tsa nu ra ga gcig la yod do //
analyzed: pa rang ga bcu'i stobs tsa nu ra ga gcig la yod do //
translated: The strength of ten parighas is the strength of one canura.

original: tsa nu ra ga bcu'i stobs mthu bo che gcig la yod do //
analyzed: tsa nu ra ga bcu'i stobs mthu bo che gcig la yod do //
translated: The strength of ten canuras is the strength of one mahānagna.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i tshigs re re la yang mthu bo che'i stobs yod pas na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i tshigs re re la yang mthu bo che'i stobs yod pas na /
translated: Since the Blessed One has the strength of a mahānagna in each joint of his body,

original: mthu bo che kun tu mdzes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthu bo che kun tu mdzes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “the one with great power” because he is like the one with great power.

original: de bas na lha sbyin gyis bsad pa'i glang po che bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs kyi mthe bos ra ba bdun bsgral te btang ba'i phyir mthu bo che dang 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na lha sbyin gyis bsad pa'i glang po che bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs kyi mthe bos ra ba bdun bsgral te btang ba'i phyir mthu bo che dang 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because the elephant killed by Devadatta was killed by the toe of the Blessed One’s foot, he is called “the one with great power.”

original: mtshan gyi 'og tu dpe byad brgyad cu bstan pas de bshad par bzhed nas dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshan gyi 'og tu dpe byad brgyad cu bstan pas de bshad par bzhed nas dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: After the major marks, the eighty minor marks are taught. Wishing to explain them, he says, “What are the eighty minor marks?” and so on.

original: sen mo yid tsam dmar ba ni zangs kyi mdog lta bu'o //
analyzed: sen mo yid tsam dmar ba ni zangs kyi mdog lta bu'o //
translated: The nails are slightly red, like the color of copper.

original: sen mo snum pa ni phyi rol 'tsher ba'o //
analyzed: sen mo snum pa ni phyi rol 'tsher ba'o //
translated: The nails are glossy, shining on the outside.

original: sen mo mtho ba ni sen mo'i dbus thog thag mthon por gnas pa'o //🔽sen mo zlum pa ni leb leb po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sen mo mtho ba ni sen mo'i dbus thog thag mthon por gnas pa'o // sen mo zlum pa ni leb leb po ma yin pa'o //
translated: The nails are high, the center of the nails standing high.🔽The nails are round, not flat.

original: sen mo rgyas pa ni bar sang sing med pa'o //🔽sen mo bags kyis phra ba ni lhun gyis mgo phra ba'o //
analyzed: sen mo rgyas pa ni bar sang sing med pa'o // sen mo bags kyis phra ba ni lhun gyis mgo phra ba'o //
translated: The nails are full, without gaps in between.🔽The nails gradually taper, tapering naturally.

original: long bu nub pa ni long bu'i sha nang du nub pa'o //
analyzed: long bu nub pa ni long bu'i sha nang du nub pa'o //
translated: The ankles are hidden, the flesh of the ankles sunken.

original: zhabs mnyam pa ni zhabs gnyis che chung ngu ma gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhabs mnyam pa ni zhabs gnyis che chung ngu ma gyur ba'o //
translated: His feet are even means that his two feet are not of different sizes.

original: seng ge'i stabs ni 'jigs pa dang bag tsha ba med par gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i stabs ni 'jigs pa dang bag tsha ba med par gshegs pa'o //
translated: His gait is like that of a lion means that he walks without fear or timidity.

original: khyu mchog gi stabs ni sa chen po gnon pa lta bur gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: khyu mchog gi stabs ni sa chen po gnon pa lta bur gshegs pa'o //
translated: His gait is like that of a bull means that he walks as if pressing down on the great earth.

original: glang po'i stabs ni brjid par gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: glang po'i stabs ni brjid par gshegs pa'o //
translated: His gait is like that of an elephant means that he walks with dignity.

original: ngang pa'i stabs ni gom pa g-yas g-yon 'dor ba'i bar rtag tu mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: ngang pa'i stabs ni gom pa g-yas g-yon 'dor ba'i bar rtag tu mnyam pa'o //
translated: His gait is like that of a swan means that his steps to the right and left are always even.

original: g-yas kyis gshegs pa ni zhabs g-yas sngar 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas kyis gshegs pa ni zhabs g-yas sngar 'dor ba'o //
translated: He walks with his right foot first means that he puts down his right foot first.

original: bzang por @191b gshegs pa ni stabs mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: bzang por @191b gshegs pa ni stabs mdzes pa'o //
translated: He walks well means that his steps are beautiful.

original: mi 'khyor bar gshegs pa ni sku 'khyor ba med par zhabs 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'khyor bar gshegs pa ni sku 'khyor ba med par zhabs 'dor ba'o //
translated: He walks without staggering means that he puts down his feet without unsteadiness.

original: sku zlum pa ni mdzes pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sku zlum pa ni mdzes pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: His body is round means that he is endowed with beauty.

original: sku 'tsher ba ni sku'i pags pa bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba'o //
analyzed: sku 'tsher ba ni sku'i pags pa bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba'o //
translated: His body is smooth means that his skin is smooth and reflects images.

original: sku rims su phebs pa ni gang du che ba'i gnas su che la chung ba'i gnas su chung ba'o //
analyzed: sku rims su phebs pa ni gang du che ba'i gnas su che la chung ba'i gnas su chung ba'o //
translated: His body is well proportioned means that he is large where it is appropriate to be large and small where it is appropriate to be small.

original: chu zheng gab pa ni chu zheng du ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chu zheng gab pa ni chu zheng du ldan pa'o //
translated: The body is well-proportioned means that it is endowed with width and height.

original: dpe byad kun mdzes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad du bya ba rnams dum bu dang ma tshang ba med pa mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: dpe byad kun mdzes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad du bya ba rnams dum bu dang ma tshang ba med pa mnga' ba'o //
translated: All the major marks are beautiful means that the major and minor marks are complete and not incomplete.

original: mnyam par gshegs pa ni mdun du sgur ba dang rgyab tu dgyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gshegs pa ni mdun du sgur ba dang rgyab tu dgyes pa med pa'o //
translated: It moves with dignity means that it does not stoop forward or sway to one side.

original: sku gtsang ba ni mi gtsang ba la sogs pa mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sku gtsang ba ni mi gtsang ba la sogs pa mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: The body is pure means that it is not impure, and so forth.

original: sku rnam par dag pa ni dri ma mi mnga' ba'o //
analyzed: sku rnam par dag pa ni dri ma mi mnga' ba'o //
translated: The body is pure means that it is stainless.

original: sku ma zhum pa ni zhum por mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sku ma zhum pa ni zhum por mi gnas pa'o //
translated: The body is not stooped means that it does not stand bent over.

original: bdun mtho ba ni gzhan las 'phags pa 'am nu 'jing la sogs pa mtho ba'o //
analyzed: bdun mtho ba ni gzhan las 'phags pa 'am nu 'jing la sogs pa mtho ba'o //
translated: The seven parts of the body are prominent means that it is superior to others, or that the shoulders and so forth are prominent.

original: yan lag dang nying lag rab tu rnam par phye ba ni phyag dang zhabs so sor ma 'dres shing 'brel ba med par mdzes par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag rab tu rnam par phye ba ni phyag dang zhabs so sor ma 'dres shing 'brel ba med par mdzes par gnas pa'o //
translated: The limbs and digits are well-spaced means that the hands and feet are not webbed, and are well-proportioned.

original: rab rib med cing dag par snang ba ni /
analyzed: rab rib med cing dag par snang ba ni /
translated: The eyes are free of turbidity and are clear means that

original: spyan gyi long thog la sogs pa dang bral zhing gsal bar gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: spyan gyi long thog la sogs pa dang bral zhing gsal bar gzigs pa'o //
translated: the eyes are free of the white coating and so forth, and see clearly.

original: lto zlum pa ni phyal phyang nge ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lto zlum pa ni phyal phyang nge ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: His belly is not flabby, but round.

original: lto 'jam pa ni pags pa 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: lto 'jam pa ni pags pa 'jam pa'o //
translated: His belly is smooth, with smooth skin.

original: lto ma zhom pa ni gong du sbom la bar na phra ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: lto ma zhom pa ni gong du sbom la bar na phra ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: His belly is not sunken, not being large above and narrow below.

original: lto ma bri ba ni khong du ma song ba'o //
analyzed: lto ma bri ba ni khong du ma song ba'o //
translated: His belly is not emaciated, not being concave.

original: lte ba zab pa ni sku'i nang du nub pa'o //
analyzed: lte ba zab pa ni sku'i nang du nub pa'o //
translated: His navel is deep, and it is turned inward.

original: kun tu mdzes pa ni 'od 'dom gong gis kun nas bskor te mdzes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu mdzes pa ni 'od 'dom gong gis kun nas bskor te mdzes par byas pa'o //
translated: He is completely beautiful, surrounded by a halo of light one fathom wide.

original: spyod pa gtsang ba ni phyag g-yas pa mi gtsang ba'i gnas su nam du yang mi reg pa'o //🔽phyag gi ri mo zab pa ni ri mo nang du song ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa gtsang ba ni phyag g-yas pa mi gtsang ba'i gnas su nam du yang mi reg pa'o // phyag gi ri mo zab pa ni ri mo nang du song ba'o //
translated: His conduct is pure, in that his right hand never touches unclean things.

original: phyag gi ri mo ring ba ni rgyun ma chad pa'o //🔽zhal rab tu mi ring ba ni zhal chu rings su mi 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: phyag gi ri mo ring ba ni rgyun ma chad pa'o // zhal rab tu mi ring ba ni zhal chu rings su mi 'dug pa'o //
translated: The lines on his hands are deep, and they are continuous.

original: gzugs dang gzugs brnyan snang ba dang / zhal gyi ya mchu ma mchu che chung du ma gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs brnyan snang ba dang / zhal gyi ya mchu ma mchu che chung du ma gyur pa'am /
translated: His face is not too long, and his upper and lower teeth are neither too large nor too small.

original: sku la gzugs brnyan du snang ba'o //
analyzed: sku la gzugs brnyan du snang ba'o //
translated: His face is radiant, and his body is radiant.

original: ban glang dang sprin ltar sgrogs pa'i dbyangs ni dbyangs ring du 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: ban glang dang sprin ltar sgrogs pa'i dbyangs ni dbyangs ring du 'dug pa'o //
translated: The voice is like the voice of an elephant or a cloud, in that it is deep.

original: mche ba mnyam pa ni mche ba bzhi che chung med pa'o //
analyzed: mche ba mnyam pa ni mche ba bzhi che chung med pa'o //
translated: The teeth are even, in that the four rows of teeth are neither too big nor too small.

original: mche ba bags kyis phra ba ni rtse phra ba'o //
analyzed: mche ba bags kyis phra ba ni rtse phra ba'o //
translated: The teeth are gradually tapered, in that they are tapered to a fine point.

original: sna gtsang ba ni snabs mi 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: sna gtsang ba ni snabs mi 'dzag pa'o //
translated: The nose is clean, in that it does not drip.

original: spyan yangs pa ni zheng du yang che ba'o //
analyzed: spyan yangs pa ni zheng du yang che ba'o //
translated: The eyes are wide, in that they are wide in breadth.

original: spyan ring ba ni dkyus su yang ring ba'o //
analyzed: spyan ring ba ni dkyus su yang ring ba'o //
translated: The eyes are long, in that they are long in length.

original: autpala'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu ni bags kyis sngo la thog thag tu ring por gnas pa'o //
analyzed: autpala'i 'dab ma rangs pa lta bu ni bags kyis sngo la thog thag tu ring por gnas pa'o //
translated: The eyes are like the petals of a blue lotus, in that they are gradually blue and long.

original: ring la stug pa ni srab mo ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ring la stug pa ni srab mo ma yin pa'o //
translated: The eyelashes are long and thick, in that they are not thin.

original: smin ma ring ba ni smin ma'i bar ma chad par dkyus ring ba'o //
analyzed: smin ma ring ba ni smin ma'i bar ma chad par dkyus ring ba'o //
translated: The eyebrows are long, in that the space between the eyebrows is long.

original: smin ma'i sbu mnyam pa ni spu ring thung med pa'o //
analyzed: smin ma'i sbu mnyam pa ni spu ring thung med pa'o //
translated: The eyebrow hairs are even, in that the hairs are neither too long nor too short.

original: rna ba gang zhing ring ba ni snyan rkang rkong ma @192a * //🔽yin pa snyan che ba'o //
analyzed: rna ba gang zhing ring ba ni snyan rkang rkong ma @192a * // yin pa snyan che ba'o //
translated: The ears are full and long, in that the earlobes are not torn and the ears are large.

original: rna ba mnyam pa ni snyan g-yas g-yon gnyis la che chung med pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba mnyam pa ni snyan g-yas g-yon gnyis la che chung med pa'o //
translated: The ears are even, in that the right and left ears are neither too big nor too small.

original: rna ba'i dbang po ma nyams pa ni rkyen gang gis kyang 'on par bya bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po ma nyams pa ni rkyen gang gis kyang 'on par bya bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: The faculty of hearing is unimpaired, and cannot be made deaf by any condition.

original: phra la rgyas pa ni rkang rkong med cing shas rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: phra la rgyas pa ni rkang rkong med cing shas rgyas pa'o //
translated: The body is well-proportioned, not too tall or too short.

original: yan lag gi dam pa kun tu rgyas pa ni sku thams cad kyang mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag gi dam pa kun tu rgyas pa ni sku thams cad kyang mdzes pa'o //
translated: The limbs are well-proportioned, and the whole body is beautiful.

original: skra ma 'dzings pa ni phan tshun 'dres nas long long por ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skra ma 'dzings pa ni phan tshun 'dres nas long long por ma gyur pa'o //
translated: The hair is not matted, but is well-arranged and does not become disheveled.

original: don rnam par gdon mi za ba gong du bshad pa ma lus par bstan zin to zhes dgongs nas dge slong rnams la zhes bya ba nas ngas bstan zin to zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
analyzed: don rnam par gdon mi za ba gong du bshad pa ma lus par bstan zin to zhes dgongs nas dge slong rnams la zhes bya ba nas ngas bstan zin to zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //
translated: Thinking that the meaning of the above explanation is complete, he said to the monks, up to I have explained it.

original: ji ltar bstan pa'i chos la yang tshig tsam du gzung ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa'i chos la yang tshig tsam du gzung ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that the Dharma taught should be held merely as words.

original: nan tan gyis bsgrub dgos so zhes bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: nan tan gyis bsgrub dgos so zhes bka' stsal pa //
translated: It is necessary to practice it earnestly.

original: dge slong dag dgon pa'i gnas dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag dgon pa'i gnas dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He said, Monks, in a solitary place, up to...

original: nga'i bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nga'i bstan pa'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is my teaching.

original: dge slong dag bag yod par byos la zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i chos la 'jug par ma byed cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong dag bag yod par byos la zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba'i chos la 'jug par ma byed cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Monks, be heedful! means do not engage in nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: de ltar zhugs par gyur na 'chi kar yang sems la gdung ba dang / phyis kyang gnod par gyur ta re zhes dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs par gyur na 'chi kar yang sems la gdung ba dang / phyis kyang gnod par gyur ta re zhes dgongs nas bka' stsal pa /
translated: Thinking, “If you engage in that, you will have remorse at the time of death and you will be harmed later,” he said,

original: 'gyod par ma gyur cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyod par ma gyur cig ces bya'o //
translated: “Do not have remorse!”

original: 'di ni nga'i bstan pa'o zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa'i cho 'phrul gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nga'i bstan pa'o zhes bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa'i cho 'phrul gsum ste /
translated: This is my teaching means the three miracles of the Tathāgata.

original: kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lo //
translated: They are the miracle of reading others’ minds, the miracle of instruction, and the miracle of magical transformation.

original: de la kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul ni 'di ltar sgoms shig pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun brjod pa'i cho 'phrul ni 'di ltar sgoms shig pa'o //
translated: The miracle of reading others’ minds is, for example, “Meditate like this.”

original: rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul ni /
analyzed: rjes su bstan pa'i cho 'phrul ni /
translated: The miracle of instruction is, for example,

original: khyod kyi bsam pa da ltar 'di dang 'di'i sems zhes bshad pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyi bsam pa da ltar 'di dang 'di'i sems zhes bshad pa'o //
translated: “Your mind is now like this and like that.”

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'phur ba la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul ni nam mkha' la 'phur ba la sogs pa ston to //
translated: The miracle of magical transformation is, for example, flying through the sky and so on.

original: 'dir ni bstan pa cho 'phrul bshad pa'i phyir 'di ni nga'i bstan pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir ni bstan pa cho 'phrul bshad pa'i phyir 'di ni nga'i bstan pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here, in order to explain the teaching as a miracle, it is said, “This is my teaching.”

original: cho 'phrul de ni cho 'phrul gnyis pa'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: cho 'phrul de ni cho 'phrul gnyis pa'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: That miracle is the second miracle,

original: cho 'phrul de ni cho 'phrul gnyis las dam par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cho 'phrul de ni cho 'phrul gnyis las dam par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that miracle is the best of the two miracles.

original: mdo sde bshad pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: mdo sde bshad pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa na /
translated: In order to show the result of explaining the sutra, it is said, “When this Dharma discourse was explained,

original: dge slong lnga brgya len pa med cing zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong lnga brgya len pa med cing zag pa las sems rnam par grol lo zhes gsungs so //
translated: the minds of five hundred monks were liberated from the fluxes without further appropriation.”

original: mdo sde thos pa'i phung po gcig tu mtshams sbyar ba spang ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgoms pas spang pa nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: mdo sde thos pa'i phung po gcig tu mtshams sbyar ba spang ba dang / mthong ba dang / bsgoms pas spang pa nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result is the freedom from afflictions that is the abandonment of the connections to a single aggregate of hearing the sutra, and the abandonment by seeing and by cultivation.

original: de la tshe gcig nas gcig tu sbyor ba spangs pas na len pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshe gcig nas gcig tu sbyor ba spangs pas na len pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: There, it is called “without further appropriation” because the connections to rebirth are abandoned.

original: mthong ba dang bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas na sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral bas na sems rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “liberated mind” because it is free from the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: don rnam par gdon mi za ba'i t'i ka rdzogs so /
analyzed: don rnam par gdon mi za ba'i t'i ka rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on the ascertainment of meaning is complete.
